recipeInstructions: Cream shortening together with sugar and eggs.  Sift dry ingredients together and add.  Mix well.  Roll into balls about the size of a walnut.  Roll balls into a mixture of cinnamon and sugar.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 8 to 10 minutes at 400°. Cool on flat surface.
name: SNICKERDOODLES

recipeInstructions: Cream together butter, sugar and salt.  Add vanilla.  Add flour to butter mixture and mix well.  Add nuts and mix well. Roll into 1-inch balls.  Bake 1 hour at 275°.  When slightly cooled, roll in confectioners sugar.  Roll again when cold.
name: HEAVENLY BITS

recipeInstructions: Mix first 4 ingredients; add the dry ingredients.  Shape into ball size of a small walnut.  Dip in sugar and place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.
name: MOLASSES SUGAR COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Mix eggs, sugar and salt.  Add dates, coconut and nuts.  Pour into 2-quart casserole greased with margarine or butter.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.  Remove from oven, stir real good.  When cool, drop by teaspoons and roll in granulated sugar.
name: DATE BALLS

recipeInstructions: Cream butter; add sugar and beat until fluffy.  Beat in egg yolk, add flour and cinnamon;  press into a 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch pan.  Brush top with slightly beaten egg white, sprinkle nuts on top and press into dough.  Cook 1 hour at 275°.  Drizzle top with melted chocolate.
name: BAR COOKIES
recipeIngredient: 2  2 oz. sq. semi sweet chocolate, melted

recipeInstructions: Mix brown sugar, shortening, molasses and egg.  Stir in flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and salt.  Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour.

Heat oven to 375°.  Shape dough by rounded teaspoonfuls into balls.  Dip tops in granulated sugar.  Place balls, sugared sides up, about 3 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet.  Bake cookies just until set, 8 to 10 minutes.  Immediately remove from cookie sheet.  Yields about 3 dozen.
name: GINGERSNAPS

recipeInstructions: Grease and flour 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.  Combine cake mix, oleo, milk and egg.  Add chocolate chips and nuts.  Batter will be thick.  Spread in pan.  Bake 20 to 30 minutes at 350°.
name: BAVARIAN BROWNIES

individualIngredient: powdered sugar quantity of strawberries and nuts
recipeInstructions: Cook first 4 glaze ingredients together, until thick and clear. Stir in 3 tablespoons strawberry Jell-O.  Cool before putting on fruit.

Pizza:  Cut cookie dough as though to bake cookies.  Line up on pan within 1/4 to 1/2-inch of each other.  Bake 10 to 13 minutes at 350°.  Holes will fill in.  Cream powdered sugar and cream cheese; spread on cookie crust.  Layer bananas that have been dipped in lemon juice to retard browning.  Top with pineapple and oranges. Add strawberries as desired.  Refrigerate.
name: FRUIT PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1 c. powdered sugar quantity of strawberries and nuts

recipeInstructions: Take liquid from oranges.  Add water to make 1 cup.  Dissolve gelatin in 2 cups hot water.  Stir in liquid from orange sections (1 cup).  Chill in refrigerator until slightly thickened.  Beat until foamy; add the 1 pint sherbet.  Beat until well blended. Fold in orange sections.  Pour into 2-quart mold and chill.
name: FLUFF ORANGE MOLD

recipeInstructions: Combine rice, peaches and 1/3 cup sugar in buttered, shallow 1 1/2-quart baking dish.  Mix flour, remaining sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg in medium bowl; cut in margarine until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle flour mixture over rice and peaches.  Sprinkle walnuts over flour mixture.  Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.  Makes 6 servings.
name: PEACH CRISP

recipeInstructions: First layer:  Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted margarine and chopped nuts.  Press into 9 x 13-inch pan; bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Cool.
Second layer:  Mix 1 cup Cool Whip with cream cheese and sugar. Spread on first layer.
Third layer:  Mix the pudding mix with milk.  Pour and spread over top of second layer.
Fourth layer:  Spread the remaining Cool Whip on top of pistachiio layer, sprinkle with nuts.  Chill and serve.
name: PISTACHIO DREAM
recipeIngredient: 2  3 oz. pkg. instant pistachio pudding mix

recipeInstructions: Tear apart cake and place in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Layer pineapple, bananas, pudding and Cool Whip.
name: WEIGHT WATCHERS DELIGHT

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Pour into a shallow pan; chill. Cut.
name: FINGER JELLO
recipeIngredient: 3 1/2 c. boiling water, dissolve gelatine in

recipeInstructions: Peel and slice apples into baking dish.  Toss brown sugar, bread and butter together and sprinkle on top of apples.  Cook juice, sugar and cornstarch until thick.  Pour over apples and bread.  Bake in 2-quart baking dish at 350° for 45 minutes, covered.  Uncover and bake 15 more minutes.
name: BAKED APPLES IN ORANGE SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Combine apples, orange juice, oleo, salt and cinnamon in a saucepan.  Bring to a boil.  Stir in rice.  Cover, remove from heat.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Makes 4 servings.
name: APPLE RICE

recipeInstructions: Whip cream, slice bananas thinly.  Drain cherries and chop nuts.  Mix all ingredients together and pour into a freezable container.  Cover with aluminum foil and freeze.  Cut into squares to serve.
name: BANANA SPLIT FREEZE

recipeInstructions: Mix vanilla wafers and butter, press in 9 x 9-inch pan.  Save a few crumbs, for topping.  Refrigerate.  Soften ice cream, spread over crumb mixture, put in freezer.  Melt 1/2 cup butter and chocolate over low heat, beat egg yolks and add to chocolate.  Add sugar and vanilla, mix well, and cool.  Beat egg whites until stiff.  When chocolate mixture is cool, fold in egg whites and nuts.  Put on top of ice cream, sprinkle with reserved crumbs; return to freezer.  Cut in squares to serve.
name: CHARLOTTE'S DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Melt butter and then add sugar.  While still warm, add unbeaten eggs.  When blended, add vanilla; then nuts.  Sift dry ingredients together and add to butter, sugar, egg mixture.
Pour into an 8 x 15-inch pan and bake in a moderate oven (350°) for 30 minutes.  Cut and remove caramel cuts from pan while still warm.
name: CARAMEL CUTS

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine and mix with sugar, peanut butter and vanilla (will be very stiff), and pat out into greased platter.  Melt Hershey bar and spread on top.  Cut into squares before hard.
name: PEANUT BUTTER REESE CUP

recipeInstructions: Stir ingredients together and cook over medium-heat until peanuts start popping and liquid looks the color of light honey. Do not overcook.  Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon soda and pour on buttered surface.  To prepare butter surface, butter aluminum foil heavily and place on cookie sheet.  When candy is cold, break into pieces.
name: PEANUT BRITTLE

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, oleo and milk together and bring to a boil.  Boil 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and add peanut butter, Marshmallow Creme and vanilla.  Stir well and pour into greased 9 x 13-inch pan, (will be thick).
name: PEANUT BUTTER FUDGE

individualIngredient: softened cream cheese candy paste color
recipeInstructions: Mash the cream cheese, add the powdered sugar gradually until the candy mixture becomes like a stiff pie dough (approximately 3 1/4 cups).  Add desired flavoring and paste color.  Roll into small balls.  Roll balls in granulated sugar.  Press balls in candy mold, unmold at once.  Yield 60 candies.
name: CREAM CHEESE CANDY MINTS
recipeIngredient: 3 oz. softened cream cheese candy paste color

recipeInstructions: Melt peanut butter and margarine over low-heat, slowly until well blended.  Remove from heat.  Add box of sugar.  Work fast to mix and blend.  Pour and spread into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Allow to cool.  Cut into squares and serve.
name: PEANUT BUTTER CANDY

recipeInstructions: Mix thoroughly; stir constantly with a wooden spoon on medium to slow fire.  Cook to hard ball stage or so you can chew it.  Add nuts if desired and vanilla and pour into a greased 9 x 11-inch pan.  Let cool.  Cut into strips and then into pieces and wrap with wax paper.  Takes about 25 minutes of cooking time.
My church in Ohio made many batches of these to send to the soldiers during World War 2.
name: CARAMELS

recipeInstructions: For dieters, use lite fruit and pudding.

Drain juices from all canned fruit.  Mix 2 cups liquid (if not enough, add water to make 2 cups) with vanilla pudding.   Follow directions for stovetop or microwave cooking.  Cool.  Mix with canned fruit.  Add strawberries.  Mix.
Approximately 50 calories per 1/2 cup serving for lite pudding.
name: FRUIT PUDDING
recipeIngredient: 1 c. fresh strawberries, cut in half

recipeInstructions: Boil sugar and 4 cups water; add Jell-O.  Mix other ingredients together and add to Jell-O liquid.  Makes 2 gallons.
name: PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Use the same flavor in Jell-O as in Kool-Aid.  In mixing your Jell-O, use hot water.  Makes 2 1/2 gallons.
name: STRAWBERRY PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Spoon ice cream and sherbet into 6-quart punch bowl.  Pour juice and Sprite over ice cream and sherbet.  This is so easy to make and so good.  Makes 12 to 16 servings.
name: LIME PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Skin chicken pieces and remove all fat.  Mix all other ingredients together and pour over chicken in 6-quart casserole. Cook 45 minutes on medium.  Remove from microwave and turn chicken in sauce.  Turn dish in microwave to finish cooking.  Cook until chicken is tender.  Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.  Serves approximately 6. Cooking time:  1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours, depending on microwave.
name: MICROWAVE BARBECUED CHICKEN

recipeInstructions: Combine all sauce ingredients and set aside.  Combine all meat loaf ingredients in large bowl.  Mix well.  Pour into 9 x 5 x 2-inch loaf microwavable dish.  Cook on High 6 minutes.  Pour sauce over meat loaf, cook on High 25 to 30 minutes or until temperature of 160° is reached.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.
name: MICROWAVE MEAT LOAF

recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients except nuts in large bowl.  Microwave at Medium (50%) until chocolate bits are melted, 3 to 5 minutes, stirring once or twice during cooking.  Stir in nuts.  Pour into well-greased square baking dish, 8 x 8-inches.  Refrigerate until set.  Makes about 2 pounds.
Variation:  Substitute 1 cup peanut butter chips for 1 cup chocolate bits.
name: MICROWAVE FUDGE

individualIngredient: vanilla nuts optional peanut butter optional
recipeInstructions: Microwave on High 2 minutes.  Beat with mixer.  Add vanilla, nuts or peanut butter.  Pour into a buttered pan.  Chill, cut and serve.
name: MICROWAVE FUDGE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. vanilla nuts optional peanut butter optional

recipeInstructions: Mix together horseradish, mayo, cheese and beef.  Top with black olive slices.  Place 1 tablespoon of mixture on top of bread. Spread evenly on top, then broil until bubbly at 300°.
name: RYE BREAD APPETIZERS

recipeInstructions: Drain sauerkraut.  Mix all together.  Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes or in microwave for 3 to 4 minutes until cheese is melted.  Serve on crackers or party rye bread.  Can also be mixed and put in crock-pot.
name: REUBEN SAUERKRAUT SPREAD

recipeInstructions: Put beef in blender.  Mix half the beef and remaining ingredients.  Let stand in refrigerator until firm.  Shape as desired and roll in 1/2 of dried beef.  Decorate with celery, onions and lettuce, if desired.
name: CHEESE BALL

individualIngredient: lemon juice chopped pimento, if desired
recipeInstructions: Set cream cheese and Cheddar cheese out so they're at room temperature and softened.  Combine all ingredients well, using a mixer.  Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.  Shape into 2 balls.  Chop 1/2 cup nuts and roll the cheese balls in them.
name: GRANDMA D.'S CHEESE BALL
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. Cracker Barrel sharp Cheddar cheese
1 tsp. lemon juice chopped pimento, if desired

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together and roll into ball(s).  Roll ball(s) into nuts.  Serve with crackers.
name: CHEESE BALL

recipeInstructions: Mix cheese, olives and onions with mayonnaise.  Put on cookie sheet and bake at 350° for about 10 minutes or until the cheese bubbles.  Serve hot.
name: PARTY RYE

individualIngredient: can chopped green chilies, drained sliced black olives pepperoni
recipeInstructions: Mix first 5 ingredients together.  Top with black olives and pepperoni.  Bake in shallow dish or pie pan at 325° for 25 minutes. Serve with Ry-Krisp, Triscuits or vegies.
name: HOT CHEESE DIP
recipeIngredient: 4 oz. can chopped green chilies, drained sliced black olives pepperoni

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients and chill 2 hours.
name: VEGETABLE DILL DIP

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients and chill for 4 hours or overnight.  Serve with assorted raw veggies.
name: VEGGIE DIP

recipeInstructions: Mix all 6 ingredients well.  Serve with cut up vegetables.
name: DILL DIP

individualIngredient: finely chopped onion dash of hot sauce
recipeInstructions: With an electric mixer, gradually blend soup into cream cheese.  Beat just until smooth.  Mix in remaining ingredients. Chill.  Serve as dip for crackers or chips.  Makes about 2 1/3 cups dip.
name: PARTY DIP
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. finely chopped onion dash of hot sauce

individualIngredient: onion, grated small amount milk for proper texture
recipeInstructions: Take "softened" cream cheese in mixing bowl.  Add Miracle Whip and onion; mix together with electric beater.  Add milk until desired consistency.
Great for dipping chips, pretzels and veggies.
name: GREG'S FAVORITE DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 small onion, grated small amount milk for proper texture

recipeInstructions: Mix together cream cheese, sour cream, garlic powder and oregano.  Spread evenly in a quiche pan.  Spread pizza sauce over the top.  Sprinkle pepperoni, green onion and green pepper over sauce.  Cover and place in microwave for 5 minutes on High. Remove and sprinkle Mozzarella cheese.  Place in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes on High.  Serve with chips or crackers.
name: PEPPERONI PIZZA DIP

individualIngredient: mushroom pieces, drained dash of garlic seasoning sour cream
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together except sour cream.  Gradually add sour cream to the consistency you want your dip, thinner for chips or thicker for crackers.
name: MUSHROOM DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 can mushroom pieces, drained dash of garlic seasoning sour cream

recipeInstructions: Beat all except shrimp until smooth; add shrimp.  Chill.
name: SHRIMP DIP

individualIngredient: can shrimp, rinsed and drained chili sauce
recipeInstructions: Blend chili sauce, lemon juice, salt, pepper, horseradish and Tabasco sauce.  Fold in sour cream.  Add shrimp (broken in pieces).  Cover and chill.  Use as a dip or spread.
name: SHRIMP DIP
recipeIngredient: 4 1/2 oz. can shrimp, rinsed and drained chili sauce
1 tsp. horseradish dash of Tabasco sauce

recipeInstructions: Melt cream cheese and soup in nonstick frypan.  Stir until smooth.  Add gelatine; stir and let cool.  Add mayonnaise, crabmeat onion and celery.  Mix together and put in copper mold or desired mold/dish.  Chill at least 12 hours.  Serve with crackers.
name: CRAB DIP

individualIngredient: Hoffman's shrimp sauce amount to your taste
recipeInstructions: Spread softened cream cheese on dinner sized plate.  Put in fridge until firm.  Mix crabmeat and sauce.  Spread over cream cheese.  Serve with snack crackers.
name: CRABMEAT SPREAD
recipeIngredient: 1 jar Hoffman's shrimp sauce amount to your taste

individualIngredient: frozen spinach, thawed, drained and squeezed
recipeInstructions: Mix together over stove.  Serve warm with crackers.
name: HOT SPINACH SPREAD
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. frozen spinach, thawed, drained and squeezed

recipeInstructions: Thaw and squeeze spinach until dry.  Stir together all ingredients.  Mix well.  Chill at least 2 hours.  (Best to make day before serving.)
name: KNORR SPINACH DIP

individualIngredient: frozen chopped spinach, thaw and drain
can water chestnuts, chop and drain
pkg. Knorr vegetable soup mix dry
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients.  Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours. Serve with bread, crackers or vegetables.
name: SPINACH DIP
recipeIngredient: 1   10 oz. frozen chopped spinach, thaw and drain
1  8 oz. can water chestnuts, chop and drain
1  1 5/8 oz. pkg. Knorr vegetable soup mix dry

recipeInstructions: Mix with electric mixer.  Use as a dip for apple or pear halves.
name: CARAMEL DIP

individualIngredient: caramel ice cream topping apple slices
recipeInstructions: Mix until blended cream cheese, Marshmallow Creme and caramel topping.  Chill, if desired.  Dip apple slices.
name: CARAMEL APPLE DIP
recipeIngredient: 6 oz. caramel ice cream topping apple slices

individualIngredient: dill weed salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Boil eggs 10 minutes.  Drain, peel and cut in half lengthwise and cool about 10 minutes.  Remove yolks and add to pickles, Miracle Whip, sugar, dill weed, salt and pepper, onion and celery. Stir well and fill egg halves with 1 tablespoon of mixture. Sprinkle with paprika and chill until cool.  Garnish with celery leaves.  If there is any remaining egg mixture, make a sandwich!
name: DEVILED EGGS SUPREME
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. dill weed salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Shell cooled eggs.  Cut in half lengthwise.  Take out yolks and put in bowl.  Break up yolks with fork.  Add all ingredients except paprika.  Mix until fluffy.  Fill egg whites with yolk mixture.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Makes 12 deviled eggs.
name: DEVILED EGGS

recipeInstructions: Wrap bacon around chestnuts.  Place in broiler until bacon is cooked.  Place cooked wraps in slow cooker.  Pour barbecue sauce over.  Heat and serve.  Great appetizer.
name: BACON WRAPS

individualIngredient: sliced almonds salad oil for deep frying
recipeInstructions: Place water, salt, nutmeg and butter in a 2-quart saucepan. Bring mixture to a full rolling boil over high heat.  Add flour all at once.  Remove pan from heat.  Stir until mixture forms a ball and leave sides of pan.  Beat in eggs, one at a time, until mixture is smooth and shiny.  Add cheese and stir until blended.

Drop mixture by teaspoons into almonds in shallow pan.  Roll to coat evenly and shape each into a 3/4-inch ball.  Place on waxed paper and let stand 10 to 15 minutes.  Pour oil to a depth of 1 1/2 to 2 inches into a deep heavy frying pan.  Heat to 370°. Fry cheese balls, about 8 at a time, until golden brown on all sides, 2 to 3 minutes.  Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towel.  Keep balls warm in oven at 200° until all are fried. Serve hot.
name: CHEESE BALLS
recipeIngredient: 1 c. sliced almonds salad oil for deep frying

recipeInstructions: Microwave Cheez Whiz according to directions on jar.  Place chips on platter.  Sprinkle with onions, tomatoes and olives.  Pour cheese over top.
name: QUICK 'N CHEESY NACHOS

recipeInstructions: Combine Cheddar cheese, cream cheese and margarine until well blended.  Spread 1/4 of mixture on each ham slice.  Roll up from short sides; chill for several hours.  Slice rolls into 1/2-inch thick slices.  Arrange each slice on a Ritz cracker.
name: HAM 'N CHEESE ROLL-UPS

individualIngredient: Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix dry
recipeInstructions: Pour 1 cup oil over crackers.  Mix dry ingredients together and sprinkle over crackers.  Stir several times; store in airtight container to keep fresh (or mix oil, dressing and spices together, pour over crackers and continue as above).
name: OYSTER CRAX SNAX
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix dry

recipeInstructions: Mix dill weed, garlic powder, lemon pepper and dressing with oil.  Pour onto crackers and mix.  Put in Ziploc bags or airtight container.
name: OYSTER CRACKERS
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch original dressing

recipeInstructions: Put crackers in heavy paper bag.  (Use 2 grocery bags put together.)  Put all ingredients but crackers in blender.  Mix well. Dribble over crackers in bag.  Shake well.  Keep in closed bag for 12 hours, then store in container.
name: OYSTER CRACKERS
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. original Hidden Valley Ranch dressing

individualIngredient: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, softened
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together well.  Let sit in fridge for 1 hour so spices mix in well.  Serve on your favorite crackers.
name: CRACKER SPREAD
recipeIngredient: 4 Tbsp. chives sprinkle of dill weed
1/4 lb. I Can't Believe It's Not Butter, softened

recipeInstructions: Slice first 3 ingredients.  Stir vinegar, sugar and salt to dissolve.  Pour over cukes, peppers and onions and let stand out for 1/2 hour or so (cukes will sink).  Put into jars and refrigerate.
name: SLICED FRIDGE PICKLES

recipeInstructions: Clean and slice pickles with peelings and soak in 2 tablespoons salt and 1 quart water for 2 hours.  After soaking, mix 1 cup sugar on drained pickles, then add 1/2 cup vinegar.  Mix together and put in container in fridge.  Add more or less sugar and vinegar to taste.
name: FRIDGE PICKLES

individualIngredient: sliced cucumbers, sliced round with peelings on use larger cukes
onion, sliced slice more if you want to eat onion
recipeInstructions: Mix brine well.

Mix pickles and brine together.  Put in large glass container in fridge.  Be sure pickles are covered with brine.  If not, make more brine.  Let stand in fridge for 2 weeks, then keep in fridge or put in freezer containers and freeze.
name: FREEZER PICKLES
recipeIngredient: 2 qt. sliced cucumbers, sliced round with peelings on use larger cukes
1 medium onion, sliced slice more if you want to eat onion

recipeInstructions: Pack cucumbers in jars with 1 head of dill and 1 clove of garlic in each jar.  Put vinegar, water and salt in large kettle and bring to a boil.  Pour while boiling hot over cucumbers in jars.  Cover each jar with canning lid and ring.  Place jars in boiling water bath for 15 minutes.  (Start timing as soon as jars are placed in boiling water.)  Makes 7 quarts.
name: DILL PICKLES

recipeInstructions: Put pickles in jars with a slice of onion, 1 clove garlic and fresh dill.  Boil juice and pour over pickles.  Put lids and rings on jars.  Put in hot water bath for 10 minutes.
name: DILL PICKLES

recipeInstructions: Boil meat until just cooked through.  Drain and slice.  Mix everything together and pour over tongue or heart.  Make sure you have tongue and heart sliced the way you want it.  Put it in a good sized jar with lid, so it is all covered with liquid.
name: PICKLED COW HEART OR COW TONGUE

recipeInstructions: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook ground beef or ground pork and onion until meat is browned or onion is tender.  Drain off fat.  Stir in beef broth, water, peas, potatoes, mushrooms, carrots, sage, basil, salt and pepper.   Bring to boiling; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serves 6.
name: MEAL IN A BOWL SOUP

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger.  In large soup kettle, combine all ingredients.  Pour in water just to cover cabbage.  Mix well. Cook until cabbage is tender, stirring often in the beginning, about 1 1/2 hours.
name: CABBAGE SOUP

recipeInstructions: Put in big pot and simmer 20 minutes; contains 18 calories per cup.
name: LO-CAL VEGGIE SOUP

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger and onion in soup pot.  Drain off all fat. Add potatoes, carrots, celery, cabbage and tomato sauce.  Bring to a boil.  Add rice and other ingredients except peas.  Cover and simmer 50 minutes.  Add peas and cook another 5 to 10 minutes. Put in bowls and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Makes 6 servings, 200 calories each.
name: SUPER HAMBURGER SOUP
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. salt dash of cayenne pepper

recipeInstructions: Cook beef and onions together until browned; drain excess fat. Add all remaining ingredients and bring mixture to a boil.  Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until vegetables are done.
name: HAMBURGER VEGETABLE SOUP

recipeInstructions: In large saucepan, combine everything except cheese.  Over medium-high heat, bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Smash with potato masher.  Pour in cheese.  Cook and stir until cheese melts.
To serve, sprinkle with parsley, if desired.  Serves 8.
name: POTATO CHEESE SOUP

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients in large soup kettle.  Cook and stir to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour.  Stir often.
name: CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except butter beans in stockpot and bring to a boil.  Simmer until beans are tender, about 2 hours. Add butter beans.  Makes about 1 gallon soup or about 16 servings.
name: COUNTRY KITCHEN CALICO BEAN SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1/3 c. dry light red kidney beans

individualIngredient: ground beef with salt and pepper
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients.  Best cooked the day before using.
name: THE BEST CHILI YET
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. ground beef with salt and pepper

recipeInstructions: Boil chicken in 6 to 7 quarts of water in large kettle.  Boil on medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, adding water to keep 6 to 7 quarts of water at all times.  Remove from heat and remove chicken from water.  Let cool.  Cut all meat from bones into 1/2 to 1-inch size chunks and return to kettle.  Add carrots, celery, onions, tomatoes, chicken concentrate and barley.  Simmer 1 hour.  Add noodles 10 minutes before serving.
name: CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP

recipeInstructions: Have broth from chicken boiling.  Beat 1 egg.  Add salt.  Add water and stir to make a smooth paste.  Add flour and mix.  Take a real thin sliver off of spoon and drop into boiling broth.  It will come to top.  Cook just a little longer and serve.  If I don't have enough mix and if there is a lot of broth, I mix up another batch.
name: GRANDPA VINNIE'S EGG DROPS FOR SOUP

individualIngredient: frozen peas not cooked or thawed
recipeInstructions: Shred lettuce in a large flat serving dish or bowl.  Sprinkle over top next 3 ingredients in layers.  Break peas apart and sprinkle over while frozen.  Spread mayo like frosting over the top.  Sprinkle on sugar and enough grated cheese to completely cover the top.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Before serving, top with bacon, tomatoes, eggs and parsley.  Serves 12.
name: 24 HOUR LETTUCE SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. frozen peas not cooked or thawed

recipeInstructions: Layer lettuce, onion, pepper and peas into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix Miracle Whip and sugar; spread over lettuce mixture.  Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese and top with bacon.  Better if set overnight.
name: 7 LAYER SALAD

recipeInstructions: Layer first 5 ingredients in one large salad in order given. Mix mayo with sugar and seasoned salt.  Spread over all.  Sprinkle cheese and bacon pieces on top.  Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.
name: 7-LAYER SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix vegetables, cheese and bacon.  Combine salad dressing, sugar and vinegar in another bowl.  Pour over vegetable mixture and mix well.  Serve immediately.
name: BROCCOLI SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1/2 head cauliflower, cut into small pieces
1/2 bunch broccoli, cut into small pieces
1/2 lb. bacon, fried, drained and crumbled

recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, combine broccoli, cauliflower, bacon and tomatoes.  Set aside.  In another bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar; mix until smooth.  Just before serving, pour dressing over salad and toss.  Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
name: BROCCOLI SALAD

recipeInstructions: Chop vegetables.  Mix with peas (uncooked).  Mix together rest of ingredients.  Pour over vegetables and set overnight.
Optional:  Top with cheese and bacon bits.
name: VEGETABLE SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix cranberries, pineapple, sugar and marshmallows together. Refrigerate overnight.  Before serving, add whipping cream (already whipped).
name: CRANBERRY SALAD

recipeInstructions: Cook spaghetti; drain and cool.  Chop first 6 ingredients and add to spaghetti.  Pour dressing and Salad Supreme over all and mix well.  Serve chilled.
name: PASTA SALAD DELIGHT

individualIngredient: lemon juice raw onion, chopped small
recipeInstructions: Cook noodles until tender.  Rinse noodles in cold water.  Stir in remaining ingredients with noodles.
name: SHRIMP SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. lemon juice raw onion, chopped small

individualIngredient: box macaroni Miracle Whip Lawry's seasoned salt onion salt garlic salt
recipeInstructions: Make macaroni according to directions on box.  Drain shrimp, peas and pineapple.  Mix all together.  Add Miracle Whip to taste. Season with Lawry's seasoned salt, onion salt and garlic salt.
name: SHRIMP SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 small box macaroni Miracle Whip Lawry's seasoned salt onion salt garlic salt

recipeInstructions: Mix all items together.  Refrigerate.
name: PISTACHIO SALAD

recipeInstructions: Combine flour and sugar; blend in egg.  Add cider vinegar and juice from pineapple.  Add to flour mixture.  Cook over low heat until thick.  Cool and mix in Cool Whip.  Add apples and nuts. Mix together.  Keep in fridge.
name: CARAMEL APPLE SALAD
recipeIngredient: 4 c. diced, unpeeled red Delicious apples
1 c. salted peanuts, cashews or pecans

recipeInstructions: Mix first 3 ingredients together.  Fold in remaining ingredients.
name: CARAMEL APPLE SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix all together and refrigerate.
name: CHERRY FLUFF

recipeInstructions: All ingredients must be refrigerated and cold.  Take milk and beat it 5 minutes in large bowl.  Drain pineapple and squeeze out juice.  Fold in pineapple and cherries.  Fold in Cool Whip. Refrigerate 4 to 5 hours.
name: CHERRY FLUFF

recipeInstructions: Put Jell-O in hot water and let stand 5 minutes.  Add pie filling and drained pineapple; save juice.  Mix 1/2 cup juice with softened cream cheese.   Take cherry pie and Jell-O mixture and put 1/2 into pan.  Let set.  Add 1/2 cream cheese mixture on top and let set.  Add rest of cherry pie mixture and let set.  Add rest of cream cheese mixture.  Sprinkle with nuts.
name: CHERRY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  8 oz. pkg. cream cheese chopped nuts

individualIngredient: can pineapple chunks in its own juice
container sour cream lettuce leaves dark green outer ones
recipeInstructions: Mix coconut, sour cream and the entire bag of marshmallows, torn into halves.  Drain pineapple chunks, reserving juice.  Add pineapple.  Drain mandarin oranges and discard juice.  Add oranges to mixture, reserving about 1 dozen to garnish.  Blend together gently.  Add some juice and mix again.  Refrigerate.
To Serve:  Add a bit more juice if too thick.  Stir.  Line bowl with lettuce leaves; pile salad inside.  Garnish with mandarin oranges.
name: MARSHMALLOW SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  20 oz. can pineapple chunks in its own juice
1   16 oz. container sour cream lettuce leaves dark green outer ones

recipeInstructions: Put salad in fridge until cool.
name: FRUIT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. sugar juice and rind of

recipeInstructions: Drain oranges and pineapple chunks; reserve 1 1/3 cups of liquid.  Cook pudding and reserved liquid until very thick.  Cool thoroughly!  Add drained fruit and bananas.  Serves 6 to 8.
name: GLAZED FRUIT SALAD

recipeInstructions: Chill Eagle Brand milk for several hours.  Drain pineapple. Beat Eagle Brand milk with electric mixer for 15 minutes.  Fold in thawed Cool Whip.  Add pie filling and pineapple.  Enjoy!
name: CREAMY CHERRY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 large can chunk or crushed pineapple

recipeInstructions: Take orange jello (dry) and cottage cheese and stir together. Add Cool Whip and cans of Mandarin oranges.  Stir all together. Refrigerate.
name: ORANGE JELLO SALAD

individualIngredient: can crushed pineapple do not drain
recipeInstructions: Heat sugar and pineapple to a boil.  Add jello and cool in refrigerator.  Whip cream cheese and milk.  Whip Dream Whip as directed.  Whip jello and cream cheese mixture.  Fold in Dream Whip.  Set overnight.
name: APRICOT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 large can crushed pineapple do not drain

recipeInstructions: Boil water and pour over jello.  Stir in drained pineapple and orange juice.  Add strawberries.  Chill until jelled.  Top with Cool Whip, if desired.  (Add 1/2 cup sugar if strawberries aren't sweetened.)
name: ROSY SPRING SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix jello with 2 cups boiling water.  Add frozen strawberries. Add drained pineapple, banana and marshmallows.  Pour 1/2 in jello mold or salad bowl.  Allow time to set in refrigerator.  Top with sour cream.  Pour remaining salad mixture on top.  Refrigerate several hours.   Unmold on pretty plate or serve from bowl.
name: STRAWBERRY SALAD

individualIngredient: low-calorie Hidden Valley Ranch dressing, made with mayonnaise
recipeInstructions: Mix first 4 ingredients.  Just before serving, add remaining ingredients.
name: TEQUILA BERRY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. low-calorie Hidden Valley Ranch dressing, made with mayonnaise

recipeInstructions: Drain canned fruit.  Mix into bowl with bananas.  Mix in cherry pie filling.  Chill.
name: EASY FRUIT SALAD

recipeInstructions: Cream together cream cheese, sugar and Cool Whip.  Gently fold in remaining optional ingredients.  Serve as soon as possible. (All fruit is optional.)
name: LUSCIOUS FRUIT SALAD

individualIngredient: can chunk pineapple in own juice
recipeInstructions: Wash and core apples.  Do not peel.  Cut into bite sized pieces.  Add undrained pineapple chunks.  Peel and cut oranges and bananas into bite sized chunks.  Add fresh or frozen strawberries and nuts.  Mix well.  Great for a large crowd.  Refrigerate unused portion.
name: HEALTHY FRUIT COMPOTE
recipeIngredient: 1  20 oz. can chunk pineapple in own juice

individualIngredient: Italian seasoning less if you don't want it as strong
recipeInstructions: Bring all ingredients to boil.  Simmer 4 to 6 hours.
This is a good sauce to use any time you need a tomato-hamburger sauce.  I use it for spaghetti and lasagna.
name: SPAGHETTI SAUCE
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. Italian seasoning less if you don't want it as strong

recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients and bring to boil.  Simmer 5 to 10 minutes.  I like to add garlic powder.  This is good on chicken, pork or hamburgers.
name: HONEY-QUE BARBECUE SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Mix and baste.
name: BARBECUE SAUCE

individualIngredient: water salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients; cook slowly for 15 minutes.  Pour over ribs that have been browned.  Pork spareribs or beef short ribs both are good.  Bake slowly for 2 hours or until done at 325°.
name: BARBECUE SAUCE FOR SPARERIBS
recipeIngredient: 1 c. water salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Simmer for about 1 hour.  Bottle and keep refrigerated.
name: BARBECUE SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients in blender and process on mix until thoroughly blended.  Pour over cooked, thinly sliced beef or pork. Simmer for 15 minutes.  Serve hot.
name: QUICK BARBECUE SAUCE
recipeIngredient: 3/4 c. tomato catsup or chili sauce

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine in small saucepan; remove from heat.  Add cornstarch and turmeric and mix.  Stir in remaining ingredients and mix well.  Return to stove and bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.  Boil for 1 minute.  Use as a basting sauce or a dip.
name: HONEY MUSTARD SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Blend well in blender.
name: FRENCH DRESSING

recipeInstructions: In blender, grate onion, garlic and vinegar.  Add all remaining ingredients and mix well.  Store in fridge.
name: FRENCH SALAD DRESSING

recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients into blender.  Process on mix until thoroughly blended.  Store in fridge.
name: RUSSIAN SALAD DRESSING

recipeInstructions: In skillet over medium heat, cook chicken in 1 tablespoon margarine for 10 minutes or until browned on both sides.  Remove chicken and keep warm.  In same skillet, add remaining margarine, broccoli, carrots and mushrooms.  Cook 5 minutes, stirring often. Stir in soup, milk and pepper.  Heat to boiling.  Return chicken to skillet.  Reduce heat to low; simmer 5 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender.
name: CHICKEN VEGETABLE SAUTE

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except bread crumbs and butter.  Place chicken breasts in sour cream mixture.  Cover and marinate in refrigerator for at least 8 hours.  Heat oven to 350°.  Remove chicken from sour cream mixture and roll in bread crumbs.  Place chicken in 9 x 13-inch greased pan.  Bake for 45 minutes.  Drizzle melted butter over chicken and bake for 10 to 15 more minutes. Makes 8 servings.
name: CHICKEN BREAST SUPREME
recipeIngredient: 4 chicken breasts, halved, boned and skinned

recipeInstructions: Put a slice of cheese on each breast.  Spoon soup over cheese and a slice of tomato over soup.  Sprinkle crouton mixture on top. Bake at 400° for 45 minutes.
name: CRUNCHY CHICKEN BREASTS
recipeIngredient: 1 can cream of chicken soup tomato
1 c. crushed croutons, mixed with butter

recipeInstructions: In shallow pan, combine 1/3 cup soup and 1/4 cup milk; set aside.  On waxed paper, lightly coat chicken with flour.  Dip into soup mixture.  On another piece of waxed paper, coat chicken with stuffing.
On baking sheet, arrange chicken.  Drizzle with margarine. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
In 1-quart saucepan, combine remaining soup, 1/4 cup milk, parsley and lemon juice.  Over low heat, heat through, stirring constantly.  Pour over chicken when serving.
name: CHICKEN CRUNCH
recipeIngredient: 1  10 3/4 oz. can cream of chicken soup
1 1/2 c. herb seasoned stuffing, crushed fine

recipeInstructions: Dip chicken in 1 tablespoon melted butter, then in the Parmesan cheese.  Melt remaining butter in shallow pie plate. Bake in a hot oven (400°) about 50 minutes or until chicken is tender.  Spoon drippings over chicken once or twice during baking. Cover with foil the last 15 minutes to prevent overbrowning. Serves 2.
name: CHEESE BAKED CHICKEN

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of vegetable, chicken, celery or mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: Arrange chicken in single layer (skin-side down) in shallow baking dish (12 x 8 x 2-inch).  Dribble butter or oleo over chicken.  Bake in a 400° oven 20 minutes.  Turn chicken; bake 20 minutes more.                  Stir soup; pour over chicken. Sprinkle parsley on top.  Bake 20 minutes more.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.
name: GOLDEN CHICKEN BAKE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of vegetable, chicken, celery or mushroom soup

recipeInstructions: Heat a small amount of oil in a large skillet; fry chicken until browned.  Drain; place chicken in 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In saucepan, saute onions in butter until tender.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes.  Pour over chicken.  Bake at 350° about 1 hour or until chicken is done, basting occasionally.
name: OVEN BARBECUED CHICKEN

recipeInstructions: Crush Rice Krispies in blender.  Melt 1 stick of margarine. Take chicken pieces and dip in butter and then in Rice Krispies. Put on a cookie sheet or baking pan.  Salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours (time may vary according to size of the chicken pieces).
name: RICE KRISPIE CHICKEN

individualIngredient: grated Parmesan cheese dash of salt and pepper
recipeInstructions: Brush chicken with Miracle Whip; coat with combination of remaining ingredients.  Place in 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until meat is tender.
name: CRISPY BAKED CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 3 lb. chicken, cut up and skinned
2 oz. grated Parmesan cheese dash of salt and pepper

individualIngredient: Parmesan cheese melted butter or oleo
recipeInstructions: Combine bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese.  Roll wings in melted butter, then in bread crumbs mixture.  Bake at 350° on cookie sheet for 1 hour.
name: CHICKEN WINGS
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese melted butter or oleo

individualIngredient: lemon juice grated cheese bread crumbs butter
recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli according to package.  Boil chicken, bone and cut up.  Place broccoli and chicken in 9 x 13-inch pan.   Mix together soup, mayonnaise and juice.  Spread over chicken and broccoli.
Top with shredded cheese and sprinkle with bread crumbs.  Top with several pats of butter.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: CHICKEN BROCCOLI CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. lemon juice grated cheese bread crumbs butter

recipeInstructions: Sprinkle rice in a greased 13 x 9-inch pan; cover with dry onion soup.  Mix chicken soup with water.  Pour 1/2 soup mixture over rice and onion soup.  Put chicken on top.  Dissolve bouillon cubes in remaining soup and water mixture.  Pour over top of chicken.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.
name: CHICKEN GLAMOROUS

recipeInstructions: Mix cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup and  3 cups of water.  Add onion soup mix into the mixture.
In 13 x 9-inch pan, lay the rice on the bottom of the pan. Pour over 1/2 of the soup mixture over rice.  Place pieced chicken on top.  Cover with rest of soup mixture.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.
name: CHICKEN AND RICE

recipeInstructions: In Dutch oven, brown chicken in hot butter.  Add celery, onion, bay leaf, peppercorns, salt, bouillon and water.  Bring to boil; cover and simmer over low heat 20 minutes.  Add carrots and simmer 15 minutes or until just about tender.  Dissolve 3 tablespoons flour in 1/2 cup cold water.  Stir into chicken mixture and bring to a boil.  Spoon Fluffy Dumpling mixture over top of chicken mixture.  Cook, covered, 12 to 15 minutes or until dumplings are no longer doughy.
Dumplings:  In medium mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, nutmeg and parsley.  Add milk, egg and oil.  Stir only until dry ingredients are moistened.
name: SPEEDY CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of chicken soup
recipeInstructions: Combine soup, 1 cup water, celery, onion and seasonings in large heavy pan; add chicken.  Cover; cook over low heat 1 1/2 hours and stir often.  Add vegetables.  Cover; cook 45 minutes or until chicken and vegetables are tender.
To thicken, blend flour and remaining water; gradually stir into stew.  Cook 10 or 15 minutes; stir often.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.
name: DREAMY CHICKEN STEW
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of chicken soup

individualIngredient: butter, softened chopped onion to taste parsley to taste
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except crescent rolls.  Roll out crescent rolls to form 4 rectangles on floured surface.  Divide chicken in 4 and put 1/4 in the middle of each crescent roll.  Fold sides over and pinch shut.  Cook 25 minutes or until golden brown at 350°.
name: CHICKEN CRESCENT SQUARES
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. butter, softened chopped onion to taste parsley to taste

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate overnight.  Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, part of the time covered.  Remove cover last half hour so top will brown.
name: OVERNIGHT CHICKEN HOT DISH
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. minced onion small amount pimento

recipeInstructions: Set aside 1/2 can chow mein noodles.  Combine all ingredients and put in 2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle remaining noodles on top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: CASHEW CHICKEN CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli, butter and onion until tender-crisp.  Add soup and mix well.  Add rice and chicken and mix well.  Top with cheese.  Cover and bake at 350° until cheese melts.  Serves 4.
name: CHICKEN-RICE-BROCCOLI CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of chicken or mushroom soup
cubed, cooked chicken or turkey more meat is better
diced pimiento dash of pepper toast, mashed potatoes or noodles
recipeInstructions: Cook onion and green pepper in butter or oleo until tender. Blend in soup and milk.  Add chicken, pimiento and pepper.  Heat slowly; stir often.  Serve over toast, mashed potatoes or cooked egg noodles.  You may add 2 boiled eggs, cut, after you're finished cooking.  Makes 4 servings.
name: CHICKEN A LA KING
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of chicken or mushroom soup
1 c. cubed, cooked chicken or turkey more meat is better
2 Tbsp. diced pimiento dash of pepper toast, mashed potatoes or noodles

recipeInstructions: In a large skillet, saute green pepper, onion and mushrooms in olive oil for 4 to 5 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Place chicken breasts over the vegetables.  Combine tomato sauce and seasonings and pour over the chicken.  Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is tender and no longer pink.  Serve over spaghetti, if desired.  Serves 4.
name: CHICKEN CACCIATORE
recipeIngredient: 1 medium green pepper, cut into strips
1/4 tsp. garlic powder cooked spaghetti optional

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen vegetable blend broccoli, cauliflower and carrots
recipeInstructions: Cut turkey into 8 slices.  Place turkey in large skillet; may need to overlap slices.  Combine frozen vegetables and salad dressing.  Pour over turkey.  Bring to a boil.  Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Drain.  Makes 4 servings.
name: TURKEY-VEGETABLE MEDLEY
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. pkg. frozen vegetable blend broccoli, cauliflower and carrots

individualIngredient: pkg. white and wild rice mix
recipeInstructions: Using a 13 x 9-inch pan, combine uncooked rice with seasonings, celery, mushrooms and water.  Dot with butter.  Cut hens in half lengthwise.  Place, cut-side down, over rice mixture. Brush with melted butter.  Bake at 375° for 1 hour covered with foil.  Uncover and bake 30 minutes longer.   Makes 4 servings.
Can substitute 2 pounds chicken parts for game hens.
name: CORNISH HEN AND RICE BAKE
recipeIngredient: 1  6 oz. pkg. white and wild rice mix

individualIngredient: pepper salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Cut round steak into serving sizes and brown.  Add onion.  Mix the rest of the ingredients except green pepper together and pour over steak.  Add green pepper and simmer until done.
Before serving, take steak out of the pot and thicken with flour to make a gravy.  Great over mashed potatoes.
name: SWISS STEAK
recipeIngredient: 1 green pepper salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: round steak or stew meat pieces
recipeInstructions: Cut meat into bite size pieces.  In large frypan, brown meat in oil.  Add all remaining ingredients.  Stir together.  Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until meat is tender.  Serve with your favorite side dish.
name: ROUND STEAK BARBECUE
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. round steak or stew meat pieces

individualIngredient: sour cream dip with French onion
recipeInstructions: Combine sour cream dip, bread crumbs, salt and pepper.  Add ground beef or pork.  Mix well and shape into four 1/2-inch patties.  Grill over medium coals, turning once.  For beef, grill until desired doneness.  For pork, grill about 18 minutes or until well done.
name: GRILLED SOUR CREAM BURGERS
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. sour cream dip with French onion
1 lb. ground beef or ground pork
4 hamburger buns, split, buttered and toasted

recipeInstructions: Fry the meat; salt and pepper to taste.  Add the onions; cook until the onions are clear.  Drain the extra fat.  Add the mustard, catsup and soup.  Simmer for 20 minutes.  Add a little water if it becomes too dry.  Serve on buns.
name: SPOONBURGERS

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except hamburger in a saucepan.  Pull apart hamburger into small sections or balls and place into saucepan mixture.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
name: BEST EVER BARBECUES

recipeInstructions: Brown the meat and onions.  Add the rest of the ingredients and simmer for 1 hour.
name: BARBECUE

recipeInstructions: Cook chuck roast all day in a slow cooker.  Start it out by adding 1 cup of water.  Add envelope of Lipton onion soup to water.  When roast is falling apart, drain excess fat.  Take a fork and shred the roast.  Add your beef consomme and mix into your roast.  Serve on a fresh dinner roll.
name: HOT BEEF SANDWICHES

recipeInstructions: Prepare stuffing according to package directions.  Combine evaporated milk and meat and divide into 5 patties.  On wax paper, pat each into a 6-inch circle.  Put 1/4 cup stuffing in center of each.  Draw meat over stuffing.  Seal.  Place in 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Combine remaining ingredients.  Pour over meat.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
name: BURGER BUNDLES
recipeIngredient: 1 c. packaged herb seasoned stuffing or

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger; salt and pepper to taste.  Put in 5-quart Dutch oven the noodles, hamburger, peas, corn, tomato soup, ketchup and barbecue sauce.  Cook at 325° for 1 hour.
name: HAMBURGER CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Cook beef in oil until crumbly.  Add onion, salt, rice, soup and water.  Mix well.  Place cabbage in a casserole dish and pour meat mixture over cabbage.  Do not stir.  Cover and bake in a slow oven at 300° for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
name: GROUND BEEF-CABBAGE CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Fry hamburger and drain off fat.  Rinse and drain sauerkraut. Add all ingredients.  Bake 1 1/2 hours at 350°.
name: SAUERKRAUT HOT DISH

recipeInstructions: Brown beef in butter.  Add garlic, sugar, salt, pepper and tomato sauce.  Cook over low heat for 15 minutes.  Cook noodles according to package directions; drain.  Mix onions with cream cheese and sour cream.  Cool meat mixture and noodles.  Grease 2-quart casserole dish.  Alternate layers of noodles, cheese mixture and meat mixture.  Repeat.  Sprinkle top with grated cheese.  Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is bubbly in 350° oven.
name: BEEF NOODLE CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Cook noodles; drain.  Mix spaghetti sauce, cheese from macaroni and cheese and water in casserole dish; add noodles. Brown ground chuck, drain and add to rest of mixture.  Stir in 1/2 of Mozzarella cheese.  Sprinkle rest of Mozzarella on top.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: MAC AND CHEESE CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Sprinkle meat with tenderizer; pierce each piece with a fork. Cover and put in fridge for 2 to 24 hours.  In large skillet, brown meat in oil over medium heat.  Reduce heat and stir in gravy. Cover lightly and simmer for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook noodles as directed on package; drain.  Serve beef and gravy on noodles with your favorite vegetable.
name: BEEF MUSHROOM
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. beef stew meat, cut into

individualIngredient: cream of chicken soup little milk
recipeInstructions: Put French fries in bottom of 9 x 12-inch pan.  Cook hamburger with onions, salt and pepper.  Add corn, mushroom soup, chicken soup and milk.  Pour over French fries.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: FRENCH FRY HOT DISH
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. hamburger onions salt and pepper
1 can cream of chicken soup little milk

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, baking powder and salt.  Add shortening, water, lemon juice and egg yolk.  Mix into each other.  Roll out 6 pasties and fill with hamburger, carrots, onions and a few potatoes.  Salt and pepper.  Add a little cream of mushroom soup. Fold over and bake at 400° for 3/4 hour.
name: PASTIES

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger and onion.  Drain.  In large bowl, combine all remaining ingredients except pie crusts.  Mix well.  Add hamburger and onion.  Mix. Pour into one pie crust.  Top with second pie crust.  Pinch edges.  Bake at 375° for 1 hour until golden brown.
name: HAMBURGER PASTIES PIE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/4 tsp. poultry seasoning dash of pepper

recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, pour milk over bread crumbs.  Mix in rest of ingredients and shape into loaf.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours. Serves 8.
name: MEAT LOAF

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Combine all ingredients; mix lightly but thoroughly.  Press into 8 x 4-inch loaf pan.  Bake 1 hour.  Drain and let stand 5 minutes.
name: WINNING MEAT LOAF

recipeInstructions: Mix all together and bake at 350° for 2 hours or until done.
name: MEAT LOAF

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine in small skillet.  Add onions and celery and cook until tender.  Remove from heat.  Combine celery, water, croutons, broccoli, cheese and egg in bowl and mix well.  Set aside.  Combine meat and 2/3 cup evaporated milk and mix well. Divide into 8 portions.  Pat each portion into a 6-inch circle. Place 1/8 stuffing in center of each circle.  Form meat over stuffing.  Seal, forming small loaves.  Place in slightly greased baking dish and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Drain off fat. Combine soup and 1/3 cup evaporated milk in saucepan.  Heat on low heat and pour sauce over loaves.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes longer. Serve.
name: MINI BEEF LOAVES

recipeInstructions: Mix first 8 ingredients together.  Form into balls; roll in flakes (optional).  Brown.  Place in baking dish.  Mix mushroom soup and water.  Pour over meatballs.  Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
name: SWEDISH MEATBALLS

recipeInstructions: Mix together first 4 ingredients and shape into small meatballs.  Bake in oven on jelly roll pan at 450° for 15 minutes.
name: MEATBALLS

individualIngredient: garlic salt salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Meatballs:  Mix all ingredients together.  Shape into balls and fry.
Sauce:  Mix all ingredients together and simmer for 1 hour before adding meatballs.
Serves 6.
name: JULIE'S MEATBALLS
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. garlic salt salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Cook noodles as directed.  Rinse and drain.  Brown meat.  Add remaining ingredients.  May add cubed cheese in hot dish.  Put all in large casserole.  Add enough tomato juice to moisten.  Bake, covered, at 375° to 400° about 1/2 hour.   Reduce heat to 350° for another 1/2 hour.  Cover with cheese and bake until browned.  Do not overcook noodles.
name: MOM'S HOT DISH

recipeInstructions: Lightly brown onion in shortening.  Add remaining ingredients except cheese.  Pour into a 1-quart casserole.  Top with cheese. Bake in a 375° oven 25 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Makes 4 servings.
Variation:  If desired, 1/2 pound ground beef can be browned with the onion and substituted for the cooked beef.
name: TOMATO BEEF CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Brown beef roast.  Add bouillon, peppercorns and oregano. Bake at 350° for 3 hours.  Slice thinly.  Serve on buns.
name: ITALIAN BEEF

recipeInstructions: Cook noodles.  Then make Mushroom Sauce.  Combine ingredients. Cook until simmering.  Layer noodles in a pan.  Top with Mushroom Sauce, chicken, then cheese.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: THREE CHEESE BAKE LASAGNA

individualIngredient: tomatoes lasagna noodles sliced Mozzarella cheese cottage cheese Parmesan cheese salt, pepper and oregano
recipeInstructions: Saute hamburger and garlic in oil.  Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, pepper and oregano and simmer 20 minutes.  While it simmers, cook the noodles in boiling salt water for 15 minutes. Butter a casserole dish and alternate layers of noodles, cheese, meat sauce and Parmesan, ending with a layer of sauce and Parmesan.  Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 20 minutes.
name: LASAGNA
recipeIngredient: 2 can tomatoes lasagna noodles sliced Mozzarella cheese cottage cheese Parmesan cheese salt, pepper and oregano

individualIngredient: chopped onion oregano Italian seasoning salt pepper lasagna noodles
recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger and onion; drain well.  Add tomato sauce, oregano and light seasoning to taste.  Add salt and pepper.   Mix cottage cheese, sour cream and egg.  Blend well.  Grate Mozzarella cheese.  Grease 9 x 13-inch pan.  Put tomato and hamburger mixture in layer first, then noodles, then tomato and hamburger, sour cream, cottage cheese and egg.  Continue layers.  Top with noodles and Mozzarella cheese.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
name: LASAGNA
recipeIngredient: 1 egg chopped onion oregano Italian seasoning salt pepper lasagna noodles

recipeInstructions: Brown meat; drain.  Add tomatoes, sauce and spaghetti sauce mix.  Simmer 30 minutes.  Boil noodles; rinse and drain.  Layer in 13 x 9-inch pan.
Start layering with meat mixture, then noodles, Mozzarella cheese, Ricotta cheese and end with meat mixture.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.  Cook a few minutes before cutting into squares.
name: LASAGNA

individualIngredient: Stove Top chicken flavored stuffing mix
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Brown meat in skillet; drain fat.  Add 1 cup of the spaghetti sauce and the water.  Bring to a boil.  Add stuffing mix; stir to moisten.  Remove from heat.  Beat egg in a medium bowl; stir in Ricotta and Parmesan cheese.  Spoon in 1/2 of the stuffing mixture evenly in an 8 x 8-inch pan.  Spoon 1/2 the cheese mixture on top of the stuffing.  Top with 1/2 cup each of the Mozzarella cheese and the spaghetti sauce.  Repeat the layers. Bake 40 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
name: STUFFING LASAGNA
recipeIngredient: 3 c. Stove Top chicken flavored stuffing mix

recipeInstructions: Brown first 4 ingredients together; drain off fat.  Add soups and corn.  Heat thoroughly.  Then add noodles and cheese.  Heat until melted.
name: ITALIAN DELIGHT
recipeIngredient: 1 bell pepper, diced salt to taste

recipeInstructions: Saute bacon, olive oil and garlic.  (Bacon should be done, but not crisp.)  Drain off fat, leaving 1 to 2 tablespoons.   Beat eggs and add milk.  Cook and drain pasta.  Pour bacon over pasta. Add cheese and stir.  Add eggs and stir until combined.
name: SPAGHETTI CARBONARA
recipeIngredient: 3/4 lb. bacon small amount olive oil

individualIngredient: Cheddar or Mozzarella cheese, grated or sliced
recipeInstructions: Prepare macaroni; drain.  Brown hamburger and onion; drain. Add tomato sauce, 1/2 teaspoon salt and other seasonings.  Simmer 5 to 10 minutes.  Beat milk, egg and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Blend with macaroni.  Spread in greased 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Cover with meat; top with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes, then cut.  Makes 6 servings.
Can also be made with leftover roast beef, lunch meat, hot dogs, bacon and sausage.
name: PIZZA MACARONI
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. Cheddar or Mozzarella cheese, grated or sliced

individualIngredient: chili powder salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook macaroni; drain.  Cook in frypan the meat, celery, onions, green pepper and all other ingredients.  Mix together.  Put 1/2 ingredients in baking dish, then 1 package cheese; place other 1/2 ingredients on top, then other package cheese.  Bake at 350° for 1/2 to 3/4 hour.
name: PIZZA HOT DISH
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. chili powder salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Brown beef.  Cook macaroni.  Place in layers in large casserole beef, tomato sauce, macaroni; repeat.  Place cheese over all. Cover with pizza sauce.  Bake, covered, about 45 minutes at 350°.
name: PIZZA HOT DISH

individualIngredient: chips, crushed lettuce tomato black olives
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Bake pie crust for 10 minutes.  Turn temperature down to 350°.  Brown the ground beef, onions and seasoning according to package.  In a bowl, combine refried beans and salsa.  Take 1/2 the refried beans mixture and put in the bottom of the pie crust; then put 1/2 the ground beef and 1/2 the cheese.  Then repeat with the rest of the ingredients.  Bake on cookie sheet 20 to 25 minutes.  Garnish with lettuce, tomato and black olives.
name: TACO PIE
recipeIngredient: 12 tortilla chips, crushed lettuce tomato black olives

recipeInstructions: Brown the hamburger, onion and green pepper.  Add taco seasoning and stir completely.  Add soups.  Cook 10 to 15 minutes. Serve in taco shells with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese and sour cream.
name: MEXICALI TACOS

recipeInstructions: Brown beef and onion in skillet; drain fat.  Stir in seasoning mix packet, broth and water.  Simmer 15 minutes.  Stir in mushrooms and set aside.  Preheat oven to 350°.  In saucepan, combine milk and cheese; cook over low heat until cheese is melted.  Remove tortillas from plastic bag; warm in microwave. Put about 1/2 cup meat mixture on each tortilla; fold over and fold in ends.  Place seam-side down in 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Pour cheese sauce over all.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.  Serve with taco sauce.
name: BURRITO BEEF BAKE
recipeIngredient: 2 c. shredded American cheese taco sauce

recipeInstructions: Put first 5 ingredients into pan.  Mix remaining ingredients. Pour over meat.  Add vegetables.  Cover and bake 4 hours at 250°.
name: SUMMER BEEF STEW

recipeInstructions: Do not brown meat.  Mix together.  Cover and bake at 250° for 5 hours.
name: PAUL HORNICK STEW
recipeIngredient: 1 slice bread, cubed salt and pepper

recipeInstructions: In medium bowl, combine ground beef, crumbs, herbs, egg and garlic.  Mix thoroughly and shape into 20 meatballs.  In 10-inch skillet over medium heat, cook meatballs until brown on all sides. Pour off fat.

Stir soup and water into skillet.  Stir in potatoes, vegetables and onion.  Heat to boiling.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender, adding more water, if needed.  Serves 4.
name: MEATBALL STEW
recipeIngredient: 1 medium onion, cut into thin wedges

recipeInstructions: Brown meat in bacon grease or bacon.  Add onions, celery, seasoned salt and pepper.  Cover with desired amount of water and cook 1 hour.  Add bay leaves.  Check to see when meat is tender. Add carrots and cook a bit before adding potatoes.  Then add potatoes and cook until tender.  Thicken with flour or cornstarch to make gravy.  Best when cooked in cast-iron Dutch oven!
name: CAMPFIRE VENISON STEW

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen chopped spinach, cooked and drained
recipeInstructions: Mix potatoes, sour cream, spinach and pepper.  Turn into 10 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
Dip and coat fish.  Fold fillets in half.  Place on top of potato mixture.  Drizzle with melted butter.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
name: FISH AND CHIP BAKE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped spinach, cooked and drained

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen broccoli, thawed, drained and cut into bite-size pieces
recipeInstructions: Combine soup and milk; set aside.  Combine tuna, broccoli, 1/2 cup cheese and 1/2 can onions.  Stir in 3/4 cup soup mixture. Divide tuna mixture evenly on each tortilla and roll; place seam-side down in a lightly greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Stir tomato into remaining soup and pour over tortillas.  Cover and bake at 350° for 35 minutes.  Top with remaining cheese and onions and bake, uncovered, 5 minutes longer.
name: BROCCOLI TUNA ROLL-UPS
recipeIngredient: 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1  10 oz. can tuna, drained and flaked
1  10 oz. pkg. frozen broccoli, thawed, drained and cut into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions: Cook noodles until tender; drain.  Mix everything together except chips in a 5-quart baking dish.  Crush chips and sprinkle on top of casserole.  Cook at 325° for 1/2 hour.
name: TUNA CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1  26 oz. can cream of mushroom soup

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of vegetable, celery, chicken or mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: In 1-quart casserole, blend soup  and milk.  Stir in tuna, eggs and peas.  Top with chips.  Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes.  Makes 3 to 4 servings.
name: PERFECT TUNA
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of vegetable, celery, chicken or mushroom soup
1  7 oz. can tuna, drained and flaked

recipeInstructions: Separate crescent rolls into 8 triangles.  Press dough around the bottom and up the edges of muffin tins.  Mix remaining ingredients; spoon mixture into dough-lined cups.   Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 375°.
name: CRESCENT TUNA CUPS

recipeInstructions: Mix Bisquick, mayonnaise and egg.  Stir in remaining ingredients except bread.  Spread ingredients evenly over 6 slices bread.  Bake at 450° for 10 minutes or until puffy and golden brown.
name: MAGIC PUFF TUNA SANDWICH

recipeInstructions: Mix all together after chopping eggs.  Put in hamburger buns. Cover each with aluminum foil.  Pierce foil with fork.  Bake at 250° for 30 minutes.  Makes approximately 6.
name: HOT TUNA-EGG SANDWICH

individualIngredient: crackers, crushed salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Mix salmon, eggs and crackers; form patties.  Salt and pepper and fry in pan.
name: SALMON PATTIES
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pkg. crackers, crushed salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Mix all ingredients except 1/2 cup cheese and croutons.  Spoon into 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese and croutons.  Bake 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.
name: CHEESY HAM CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: In large bowl, blend cheese, soup and milk.  Cook broccoli according to package directions.  Drain; cook onions in butter until tender.  Add onions, broccoli, ham, uncooked rice and Worcestershire sauce.  Mix all together.  Turn into 2 (1 1/2-quart) casseroles.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
name: HAM, BROCCOLI BAKE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Arrange cauliflower in rectangular baking dish.  Sprinkle with ham.  Beat soup and milk until smooth; pour over ham.  Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly.  Sprinkle over soup mixture.  Bake until topping is golden brown, about 20 minutes.  Serves 8.
name: CAULIFLOWER-HAM AU GRATIN
recipeIngredient: 20 oz. pkg. frozen, thawed and drained
1  11 oz. can condensed Cheddar cheese soup

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  On floured surface, separate dough into 4 rectangles.  Gently pinch perforations together on each rectangle.  Roll each into a 7 x 5-inch rectangle.  Arrange ham and cheese on dough, leaving 1/2-inch rim of dough all around.  Spread mustard on each one.  Brush rim of dough with egg.  Fold dough and filling over so the 5-inch sides meet.  Seal edges.  Place on cookie sheet and bake 12 to 15 minutes until brown.  Serves 4.
name: HAM AND SWISS BUNS

recipeInstructions: Simmer pork steaks until tender.  Drain can of sauerkraut. Cook noodles as directed.
Add first 6 ingredients together in casserole.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Add French fried onions the last 10 minutes of baking time.
name: SAUERKRAUT HOT DISH

individualIngredient: cream of chicken soup with water
recipeInstructions: Dice pork and brown it.  Cook noodles and drain.  Mix all together.  Cover with buttered cracker crumbs.  Bake 1 hour at 325°.
name: PORK CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 small diced onion salt and pepper
2 cans cream of chicken soup with water

recipeInstructions: In skillet, brown pork chops in oil.  Remove from pan.  Peel and thinly slice onion.  Saute in skillet.  Blend in flour and mustard.  Add beef broth and cook for 5 minutes.
Return chops to skillet.  Cook 45 minutes or until chops are well done and sauce is thickened.
name: ONION CHOPS

individualIngredient: chops vegetable oil Durkee seasoned salt
pkg. frozen O'Brien or hash brown potatoes, thawed
recipeInstructions: Brown pork chops in lightly greased skillet.  Sprinkle with salt and set aside.  Combine soup, milk, sour cream, pepper and 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt.  Stir in potatoes, 1/2 cup cheese and 1/2 can onions.  Spoon mixture into 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Arrange chops over potatoes.  Bake, uncovered, for 40 minutes at 350°.  Top with remaining cheese and onions.  Bake 5 minutes longer.
name: PORK CHOP 'N POTATO BAKE
recipeIngredient: 6 pork chops vegetable oil Durkee seasoned salt
1 can condensed cream of celery soup
1  24 oz. pkg. frozen O'Brien or hash brown potatoes, thawed
8 oz. can Durkee French fried onions

recipeInstructions: In 1-quart pan, melt butter.  Saute onions until tender.  Blend in sugar, salt, chili powder and mustard.  Stir in pineapple juice, lemon juice, catsup and chili, soy and A.1. sauces.  Heat to boiling, lower heat and simmer 30 minutes.

Cut ribs into smaller pieces.  Place in roasting pan, meaty side up.  Cover pan tightly with aluminum foil.  Bake 1 hour, uncover and bake 30 minutes, turning to brown evenly.  Drain fat from pan.  Pour sauce over ribs.  Bake 1 hour or until well done, basting ribs with sauce every 10 minutes.
name: LUAU BARBECUED RIBS

recipeInstructions: Brown frankfurters and cook onion in butter or oleo until tender.  Combine with noodles, soup, water and mustard in 1 1/2-quart casserole; top with crumbs.  Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes.  Makes 4 servings.
name: YANKEE NOODLE BAKE

individualIngredient: ground beef brown until color is gone
recipeInstructions: Mix the above ingredients in a bowl.  Put in a casserole and bake 1 hour at 350°.  Sprinkle chow mein noodles on top.  Bake 1/2 hour longer or until the liquid is absorbed.
name: CHOP SUEY
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 lb. ground beef brown until color is gone

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger and put into casserole dish.  Add all other ingredients.  Top with chow mein noodles.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: CHINESE CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: ground beef or chop suey meat
recipeInstructions: Brown meat with onion.  Mix in other ingredients except noodles.  Top with chow mein noodles.  Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.
name: CHOP SUEY CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 lb. ground beef or chop suey meat

recipeInstructions: Brown and season hamburger, celery and onion in frying pan. Cook rice.  Mix everything together and bake until heated real well.
name: CHOP SUEY CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Brown the first 3 ingredients.  Cook noodles and mix everything together in a big roasting pan.  Cover and bake 1 hour at 325°.
name: POLISH CHOP SUEY

individualIngredient: mushrooms, drained sliced pepper sliced onion sliced celery diced bacon, fried seasoned salt
recipeInstructions: Saute pepper, onion and celery.  Mix all ingredients.  Bake in 350° oven until heated through.
name: WILD RICE CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 can mushrooms, drained sliced pepper sliced onion sliced celery diced bacon, fried seasoned salt

recipeInstructions: Mix all together and bake, covered, for 30 minutes at 350°.
name: WILD RICE HOT DISH

individualIngredient: size potatoes, boiled, peeled and diced or use leftover boiled potatoes
chopped fine salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together and pour into a greased casserole dish.  Mixture will be sloppy.  Bake in a 350° oven for 1 hour or until firm and crusty.  Serves 4.
name: CORNED BEEF HASH
recipeIngredient: 4 medium size potatoes, boiled, peeled and diced or use leftover boiled potatoes
1 onion, chopped fine salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 325°.  Beat eggs, milk and salt.  Tear ham into small pieces and drop into egg mixture.  Stir in cheese and onion. Pour into greased baking dish, 8 x 8 x 2-inch.  Bake, uncovered, 40 to 45 minutes or until omelet is set and top is golden brown.
You can prepare mixture and refrigerate until cooking.  Great idea for a late evening supper.
name: HAM AND CHEESE OVEN OMELET

recipeInstructions: Beat eggs with milk and butter.  Pour in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle vegetables and bacon onto eggs.  Heat soup (do not add milk or water) to soften it.  Spread over egg dish.  Sprinkle cheese on top.  Cover with foil.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
name: TEXAS EGGS

recipeInstructions: Brown sausage and drain.  Mix eggs, milk and seasonings.  Stir in bread, sausage and cheese.  Put in greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Refrigerate overnight, covered.  Remove cover and bake at 350° for 50 minutes to 1 hour.
Serves 8 to 12.  Muffins, fruit salad and juice go good with this one.
name: BRUNCH SPECIAL

individualIngredient: grated cheese salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook sausage and drain.  Cube bread; put bread in 9 x 13-inch pan and place sausage and cheese on top.  Mix eggs and half and half.  Pour over top.  Chill overnight.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.
name: EGG SAUSAGE BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. grated cheese salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: grated sharp Cheddar cheese chopped onion amount to your taste
recipeInstructions: Saute sausage and drain.  Beat eggs with milk.  Add salt and mustard.  Layer bread, sausage and cheese in 9 x 13-inch baking dish.  Pour egg mixture over the top.  Refrigerate overnight.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: EGG SAUSAGE CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese chopped onion amount to your taste

recipeInstructions: Use any kind of shallow, 3-inch pan (iron frying pan, glass, ceramic, etc.).  Select recipe proportions to fit your pan.  Put butter in pan and set into 425° oven.  Mix batter while butter melts.  Put eggs in blender and whirl at high speed for 1 minute. With motor running, gradually pour in milk, then slowly add flour; whirl for 30 seconds.  Remove pan from oven and pour batter into hot melted butter.  Return to oven and bake until puffy and well browned, 20 to 25 minutes.  Dust with nutmeg and serve with syrups, powdered sugar, fresh fruit, hot fruit or canned pie filling.
name: DUTCH BABIES

recipeInstructions: In 9 x 13-inch pan, melt butter,  then beat eggs.  Mix together with flour, milk, salt and baking powder.  Then add spinach and cheese.  Mix together.  Pour into pan.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
name: QUICHE
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. spinach frozen , drained and thawed

individualIngredient: flour salt pepper bacon ham mushrooms onion broccoli spinach
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and pour in pie shell.  Bake 45 minutes at 375°.
name: QUICHE
recipeIngredient: 3 Tbsp. flour salt pepper bacon ham mushrooms onion broccoli spinach

recipeInstructions: Press hash browns between paper towels to remove excess moisture.  Press into the bottom and up the sides of an ungreased 9-inch pie plate.  Drizzle with butter.  Bake at 425° for 25 minutes.  Combine the ham, cheese and green pepper.  Spoon over crust.  In a small bowl, beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper and pour over ham mixture.
Reduce heat to 350° and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.  Let stand for 10 minutes.
name: HASH BROWN QUICHE
recipeIngredient: 3 c. frozen shredded hash browns, thawed

recipeInstructions: Cook zucchini in 2 cups boiling water until tender.  Brown beef and onion.  Mix first 8 ingredients together.  Pour into casserole dish.  Dot with butter and cover with bread or cracker crumbs. Bake 1 hour at 350°.
name: ZUCCHINI CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: grated Parmesan cheese salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Pour butter into a 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch baking pan.  In a plastic bag, combine flour, cheese, salt and pepper.  Shake a few potato slices at a time in the bag to coat with the flour mixture. Place potatoes in a single layer over the butter.  Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.  Turn slices and sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Bake 30 minutes more or until tender.
name: PARMESAN POTATO ROUNDS
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: Lipton Recipe Secrets onion soup mix
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 450°.  In large plastic bag or bowl, add all ingredients.  Close bag and shake or toss in bowl until potatoes are evenly coated.  Empty potatoes into shallow baking or roasting pan.  Bake, stirring occasionally, 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.
name: ONION-ROASTED POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 1 envelope Lipton Recipe Secrets onion soup mix
2 lb. potatoes, cut into large chunks

individualIngredient: white potatoes, boiled with jackets on salt and pepper to taste
fresh green onions, thinly sliced using part of tops also
recipeInstructions: Peel potatoes and grate.  Add salt and pepper.  Lightly toss potatoes, sour cream, Cheddar cheese (save a little for the top) and the onions.  Put in a greased casserole dish.   Put dobs of butter on top and sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 45 minutes.  Serves 6.
name: PARTY POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 5 large white potatoes, boiled with jackets on salt and pepper to taste
1 bunch fresh green onions, thinly sliced using part of tops also

recipeInstructions: Slice potatoes 1/8-inch thick.  Put half in crock-pot.  Add half of soup, half of ham and half of onion.  Put other half of potatoes, soup, ham and onion.  Pour milk over top.  Stir slightly. Cook on low for 8 to 9 hours or on high 4 to 5. Can add 1/2 cup grated cheese before serving.
name: CHEESY SCALLOPED POTATOES

recipeInstructions: Cook potatoes; drain and mash.  Add sour cream, butter and egg.  Beat until fluffy.  Add onion, seasoning and a little milk (if it needs thinning).  Place in buttered casserole.  Combine cornflakes, cheese and melted butter.  Sprinkle over potatoes. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
name: CRUNCHY POTATO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. chopped onion salt and pepper

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients in a large bowl.  Pour into cake pan. Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.  May also sprinkle cheese on top and bake also.
name: CHEESE POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. carton sour half and half

individualIngredient: bag frozen diced hash browns, thawed
recipeInstructions: Mix together; place in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: CHEESY POTATO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. bag frozen diced hash browns, thawed

recipeInstructions: Mix first 3 ingredients plus 8 ounces of Cheddar cheese. Spread in 9 x 12-inch baking pan.  Sprinkle remaining cheese on top the last 5 to 10 minutes.  Bake at 300° at least 1 hour.
name: HASH BROWNS

recipeInstructions: Mix together.  Top with 2 cups crushed corn flakes, mixed with 1/4 cup melted butter.  Bake in 11 x 12-inch pan at 350° until light brown on top, 1/2 to 3/4 hour.
name: HASH BROWN POTATO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. hash browns frozen, Southern style

individualIngredient: chopped chives or green onion tops
pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained
recipeInstructions: In large bowl, combine all ingredients except cheese.  Spoon into a greased 2-quart casserole.  Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes at 400°.  Top with cheese and bake another 5 minutes.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.
name: POTATO SPINACH CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 8 large potatoes, peeled, cooked and mashed
2 Tbsp. chopped chives or green onion tops
1  10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and well drained

recipeInstructions: Mix yams and milk; pat into greased pan.  Dot yams with butter.  Combine remaining ingredients.  Sprinkle over yams.  Bake in 350° oven for 20 to 25 minutes.  Makes 25 servings.
name: CRISPY YAM CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Cook carrots and onion until tender; drain.  Melt margarine and cheese.  Mix carrot mixture, cheese and parsley.  Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Cover with crushed chips.  Bake for 20 minutes or until golden in color.
name: CARROT CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. chopped parsley crushed potato chips

individualIngredient: ground ginger chopped parsley to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook carrots in boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender; drain.  Melt butter; stir in syrup and ginger; cook 1 minute. Pour glaze over carrots.  Stir and garnish with parsley.  Makes 4 servings.
name: GLAZED CARROTS
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. ground ginger chopped parsley to taste

recipeInstructions: Shred cabbage very fine and cook 9 minutes in boiling salted water.  Drain well and place in buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.  Melt butter in saucepan and stir in flour and salt until smooth.  Add milk gradually; continue stirring until thickened. Pour sauce over cabbage.  Sprinkle with crumbs over top.  Bake at 325° for 15 minutes.
name: BAKED CREAMED CABBAGE
