recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. bread crumbs or cracker crumbs

recipeInstructions: Cook cabbage.  Fry bacon; drain grease and mix in cooked cabbage.  Mix together vinegar and sugar and thicken with flour. Pour over cabbage and bacon and simmer until hot.
name: SWEET AND SOUR CABBAGE

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in medium saucepan.  Cover and simmer for about 1 hour (until cabbage is tender).  Stir occasionally. Makes 5 to 6 servings.  This recipe can be cooled and put into the freezer.
name: SWEET-SOUR RED CABBAGE

recipeInstructions: In frypan, melt butter; add remaining ingredients.  Mix, cover and cook for about 10 minutes until cabbage is tender.
name: SAUTEED CABBAGE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. dill weed dash of pepper

recipeInstructions: Cook asparagus just 5 minutes, then place in casserole dish. Blend butter and flour.  Add milk gradually and cook slowly until thickened, stirring constantly.  Add cheese and salt.  Pour sauce over asparagus; sprinkle with crumbs.   Dot with butter and bake in slow oven at 325° for 30 minutes.
name: ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Make white sauce with milk, butter and flour.  Simmer until thick.  Add salt, sugar and eggs and mix well.  Mix in drained corn.  Pour into greased baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: BAKED CORN

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of vegetable, celery, chicken or mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: Combine soup, onion and pepper.  In 1-quart casserole, arrange alternate layers of corn, soup mixture and crackers; dot with butter or oleo.  Bake in a 400° oven for 25 minutes.  Makes 6 servings.
name: CREAMY CORN SCALLOP
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of vegetable, celery, chicken or mushroom soup
1 Tbsp. minced onion dash of pepper
1  1 lb. can whole kernel corn, drained

individualIngredient: small pieces ham, bacon or shrimp
recipeInstructions: Remove stems from 12 or more huge fresh mushrooms.  Chop for salad or add to stuffing mixture for volume.  Pour melted butter into 7 x 11-inch pan and place mushrooms in one layer.  Mix stuffing ingredients.  If more volume needed, add croutons or chopped mushroom stems.  Stuff tightly into mushrooms.  Put dab of butter in center and arrange croutons around top.  Bake in moderate oven (350°) with foil, covering pan tightly.
name: STUFFED MUSHROOMS
recipeIngredient: 2/3 c. small pieces ham, bacon or shrimp
1/4 c. chopped green or black olives

recipeInstructions: Clean mushrooms.  Drain and snap off stems.  Fry and drain sausage.  Fill caps with mixture.  Bake for 10 minutes at 350°. Put under broiler for 3 minutes.  Serve hot.
name: STUFFED MUSHROOMS

recipeInstructions: Cook vegetables.  Mix all ingredients and top with onion rings.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
name: BROCCOLI AND CAULIFLOWER BAKE

individualIngredient: frozen packages chopped broccoli, cooked and drained
recipeInstructions: Mix cooked broccoli with mushroom soup and Velveeta.  Pour in casserole and top with buttered, unseasoned croutons.  Warm thoroughly in 350° oven.
name: BROCCOLI BAKE
recipeIngredient: 2   10 oz. frozen packages chopped broccoli, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions: Thaw broccoli in boiling water, then add remaining ingredients. Mix. Pour in casserole.  Top with 1 stick melted oleo.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.
name: BROCCOLI BAKE

recipeInstructions: Melt butter, cheese and soup together.  Cook broccoli and drain.  Mix broccoli, celery, onions and rice.  Add cheese mixture. Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes.
name: BROCCOLI RICE CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: Velveeta cheese, chopped or Cheddar, Colby, etc.
recipeInstructions: Saute the onion in the oleo.  Mix all ingredients together. Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.
name: BROCCOLI AND RICE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, cooked
1/4 lb. Velveeta cheese, chopped or Cheddar, Colby, etc.

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli; drain.  Melt butter in casserole dish.  Add Cheez Whiz, soup, rice and onions.  Stir well.  Add broccoli. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.  If you're having company, double this recipe.
name: BROCCOLI RICE CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: chopped parsley salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients in large mixing bowl.  Mix well.  Put in greased 8-inch square pan.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.   Serve as a vegetable or instead of potatoes.
name: ZUCCHINI SQUARES
recipeIngredient: 3 tsp. chopped parsley salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Cook whole zucchini in boiling salted water about 10 minutes or until tender; drain.  Cut in half lengthwise.  Scoop out centers, leaving a 1/4-inch shell.  Chop center portion and set aside.

Melt butter in large skillet; saute mushrooms about 3 minutes. Stir in flour and oregano.  Remove from heat; stir in cheese and pimento.  Stir in reserved chopped zucchini and heat through. Preheat broiler.  Fill zucchini shells with mixture.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Broil several inches from heat 3 to 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Can put together ahead of time and put in fridge.  Broil 5 to 7 minutes.
name: STUFFED ZUCCHINI

recipeInstructions: Cook squash and onion in boiling salt water until just tender. Drain well.  Combine soup and sour cream; stir in carrot.  Fold in drained squash and onion.
Melt butter and toss with stuffing mix.
Spread 1/2 stuffing mixture in baking dish.  Spoon vegetable mixture on top.  Sprinkle with remaining stuffing mixture.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until heated through.
name: SUMMER SQUASH CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions: Saute onion and margarine.  Blend in flour, salt and pepper. Add sour cream, stirring constantly.  Cook until smooth and thickened.  Add beans.  Put into deep casserole.   Top with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.  Serves 6.
name: GREEN BEAN SUPREME

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of chicken or mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: In 1-quart casserole, stir soup and soy sauce until smooth; mix in 1/2 can onions, beans and pepper.  Bake in a 350° oven for 20 minutes or until bubbling.  Top with remaining onions.  Bake 5 minutes more.  Makes 6 servings.
name: GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 1/2 oz. can condensed cream of chicken or mushroom soup
3 c. cooked French-style green beans or
2  1 lb. cans, drained dash of pepper

recipeInstructions: Cook beans as directed on package; drain.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix well.  (Cooked fresh or canned beans can also be used.)
name: SWEET BUTTERY BEANS

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except cheese; mix gently.  Place in a greased 2-quart casserole.  Bake, uncovered, at 475° for 15 minutes.  Reduce heat to 375°; bake 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Sprinkle with cheese; bake 15 minutes longer.
name: SPICY BAKED BEANS

recipeInstructions: Fry bacon; mix all ingredients well.  Add bacon.  Put in crock-pot on high for 3 hours or bake for 1 hour at 350°.
name: GRANDMA'S BAKED BEANS

recipeInstructions: Drain beans and put into slow cooker.  Brown hamburger; drain grease and add to beans.  Fry bacon and cut into 1/2-inch strips. Mix into beans.  Mix in rest of ingredients and cook on medium heat 1 1/2 hours.
name: BAKED BEANS

individualIngredient: bacon, cut with scissors, not browned
recipeInstructions: Do not add salt or pepper.  Bake at 350°, uncovered, 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes in 5-quart Dutch oven.
name: BEAN CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. bacon, cut with scissors, not browned

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger; drain.  In a casserole dish, add your hamburger, envelope of Lipton onion soup, water, ketchup, mustard, vinegar, B&M beans and red beans.  Stir all together.  Heat in 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes.  Great for a side dish for summer cookouts!
name: BEAN CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Brown bacon until crisp.  Drain on paper towel.  Brown ground chuck.  Rinse to drain off fat.  Add onion and bacon.  Cook until onion is tender.  Mix brown sugar, catsup, vinegar and mustard. Add kidney beans, butter beans and baked beans.  Mix together with bacon, onion and ground chuck.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.
name: BEAN BAKE

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger.  Add other ingredients.  Put in 2-quart casserole.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.
name: RANCHO BAKED BEANS

recipeInstructions: Place frozen vegetables in 2 1/2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle rice over vegetables.  Set aside.  Combine soup, cheese, onion, salt and milk.  Heat in microwave until cheese melts.  Stir occasionally.  Pour cheese sauce over vegetables.  Bake at 350°, uncovered, for 1 hour or microwave on High for 15 to 20 minutes. Top with 1 can (2.8 ounces) Durkee French fried onions (optional).
name: COMPANY VEGETABLE CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: dried onion flakes assorted raw vegies: tomatoes, olives, green pepper, mushrooms, carrots, cauliflower and broccoli
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 400°.  Separate dough and pat into a greased 9 x 13-inch baking sheet.  Bake for 10 to 15 minutes.  Cool.  Beat cream cheese, mayonnaise, dill and onion.  Spread over cooled crust.  Top with vegies.  Cut and serve.
name: RAW VEGIE PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 tsp. dried onion flakes assorted raw vegies: tomatoes, olives, green pepper, mushrooms, carrots, cauliflower and broccoli

individualIngredient: Hidden Valley Ranch dressing assorted raw veggies
recipeInstructions: Pat crescent rolls in cookie sheet; prick with fork.  Bake at 350° until golden brown.  Beat until blended the cream cheese, mayonnaise and Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix.  Spread over cooled crust.  Top with cauliflower, chopped onion, chopped cucumbers, green pepper, chopped tomatoes, grated carrots or any of your favorite veggies.  Sprinkle with grated cheese.  Chill.
name: VEGETABLE PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing assorted raw veggies

recipeInstructions: Mix 3 cups flour and butter or Crisco like pie crust.  Add milk and yeast to flour mixture.  Add beaten eggs and salt.  Add last cup of flour.  Knead well.  Refrigerate overnight.  Take out, divide into 6 parts and roll each like a pie crust.  Cut into 6 wedge-like pieces and roll large end towards the center to form crescent like shapes.  Let rise and bake until golden.  Makes 36 rolls.  Frost, if desired, with powdered sugar frosting.
name: CRESCENT ROLLS

recipeInstructions: Scald milk; stir in sugar, salt and butter.  Cool to lukewarm. Measure warm water into large warm bowl.  Sprinkle in yeast; stir until dissolved.  Add lukewarm milk mixture, eggs and 2 cups flour. Beat until smooth.  Stir in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Turn out onto lightly floured board; knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 to 10 minutes.  Place in greased bowl, turning to grease top.  Cover with cloth.  Let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.

Punch down.  Turn out onto lightly floured board.  With floured rolling pin, roll dough to 1/4-inch thick.  Using 9-inch pie pan as a pattern, cut dough into 9-inch circles.  Cut each circle into 12 wedges.  Brush melted butter on wedges.  Starting at edge opposite point, roll up each wedge.  Place on greased cookie sheet with center point underneath.  Curve ends to form crescents.  Let rise about 1/2 hour to 45 minutes until doubled.  Bake in preheated oven at 400° for about 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.
name: RICH CRESCENT DINNER ROLLS

recipeInstructions: Mix dry ingredients.  Cut in butter until crumbly; stir in milk.  Pat out on floured surface.  Cut with biscuit cutter.  Bake 12 minutes in 450° oven on greased cookie sheet until golden brown.
name: BAKING POWDER BISCUITS

individualIngredient: frozen bread dough, thawed not raised
recipeInstructions: Grease bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Put nuts on bottom.  Pull first loaf of bread apart and put on top of nuts.  Sprinkle cinnamon on bread.  Melt margarine; mix in pudding, sugar and milk.  Pour over first loaf of bread dough.  Pull second loaf of bread dough apart and place on top pudding mixture.  Let raise.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Flip upside down on cookie sheet immediately.
name: FROZEN BREAD ROLLS
recipeIngredient: 2 loaves frozen bread dough, thawed not raised

recipeInstructions: Thaw dough.  Blend other ingredients.  Cut walnut-sized pieces of dough.  Dip into butter mixture.  Place in well-greased loaf pan.  Let rise until doubled in size.  Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.  Brush with remaining butter mixture.
name: GARLIC BUBBLE BREAD

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Generously grease bottom of loaf pan or 8 x 8-inch pan.  Stir all ingredients in pan with fork until moistened.  Beat vigorously 1 minute.  Bake for 55 to 65 minutes. Cool 5 minutes.  Run knife around sides of pan to loosen.  Remove from pan.
name: ONE PAN BANANA BREAD

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour pan (bread pan).  In large bowl, add strawberries, sugar, oil and eggs.  Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes.  Add remaining dry ingredients.  Mix and pour into pan.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Frost with powdered sugar glaze.
name: BERRY DELICIOUS BREAD

recipeInstructions: Sift dry ingredients in a bowl.  Make a well and pour eggs, oil and strawberries in center.  Mix gently until well mixed. Pour batter into 2 greased and floured loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or longer.  Use a toothpick inserted into middle to check.
name: STRAWBERRY BREAD

recipeInstructions: Grease and flour one loaf pan.  In mixing bowl, stir berries, eggs and oil.  Add remaining ingredients, stirring between each addition until well blended.  Pour into pan and bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
name: STRAWBERRY BREAD

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and sugar.  Add blueberries, egg, orange rind and orange juice to dry ingredients.  Mix until moistened.  Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch pan.  Bake for 55 to 65 minutes until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Makes 1 loaf.
name: BLUEBERRY LOAF

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Mix together all ingredients.  Separate batter evenly in 2 bread pans.  Bake for 45 minutes.  Outside of bread gets real brown.
name: POPPY SEED BREAD

individualIngredient: pkg. white or yellow cake mix
recipeInstructions: Blend all ingredients.  Beat 4 minutes.  Pour into 2 greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pans or 3 small loaf pans.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.
name: POPPY SEED LEMON BREAD
recipeIngredient: 25 oz. pkg. white or yellow cake mix

recipeInstructions: Beat together oil, sugar and eggs.  Sift together dry ingredients.  Add to mixture.  Add water and pumpkin.  Beat well. Pour into 2 greased 9 1/2 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pans.
name: PUMPKIN BREAD

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except topping.  Pour into 2 bread pans.  Mix topping ingredients together.  Sprinkle over batter. Bake at 325° for 60 minutes.  Do not overbake.
name: RHUBARB NUT BREAD

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Pour in 10 x 5 x 3-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.
name: PINEAPPLE NUT BREAD

individualIngredient: grated zucchini or zucchini and carrots
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Spray 2 loaf pans with Pam.  Mix flour, cinnamon, salt, soda and baking powder.  Set aside.
Mix eggs, sugars, liquid Butter Buds and vanilla.  Add flour mixture and zucchini.  Put in loaf pans and bake 60 to 70 minutes. Can add 1 cup cocoa also with flour mixture.
Very low-fat, no cholesterol (with Egg Beaters) and low calorie.
name: ZUCCHINI BREAD
recipeIngredient: 2 c. grated zucchini or zucchini and carrots

recipeInstructions: Grease and flour 2 bread pans.  Beat eggs.  Add sugar and oil; mix well.  Add vanilla and dry ingredients and blend well.  Add zucchini and mix well.  Pour into pans and bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Shut off oven and leave in for 10 more minutes.
name: ZUCCHINI BREAD

recipeInstructions: Mix and add 2 cups raw zucchini, grated.  (Add 1 cup nuts, if desired.)  Bake at 325° for about 55 to 60 minutes.
name: ZUCCHINI BREAD

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.

Combine flour and sugar.  Mix well.  Add beer.  Stir until moist; don't overstir.  Scrape batter into regular size bread pan. Bake for 50 minutes.  Pour melted butter on top of bread. Continue baking for 10 minutes.  Remove bread from pan and cool for 10 minutes before cutting.  Serve warm and enjoy!
name: BEER BREAD

recipeInstructions: Combine first 4 ingredients.  Mix well.  Spread margarine mixture over bread slices.  Lightly sprinkle cheese over top of bread slices.  Broil bread 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 servings.
name: ONION GARLIC BREAD

recipeInstructions: Combine all dry ingredients.  Stir in the cheese.  Combine milk and eggs.  Add to mixture, mixing just until moist.
Pour into greased 9-inch square pan.  Bake at 425° for 20 minutes.
name: CHEDDAR CORNBREAD

recipeInstructions: Combine brown sugar, oil and egg; beat until creamy.  In separate bowl, mix milk, soda and vanilla.  Let stand a few minutes.  Add sugar mixture with dry ingredients to milk mixture. Fold in apples.  Pour into muffin tins.  Mix topping ingredients. Top muffins with mixture and bake at 425° for 15 minutes.
name: APPLE OR RHUBARB MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. apples, diced with skins or

recipeInstructions: Partially thaw frozen raspberries.  In bowl, stir together flour, bran, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Make a well in the center of mixture.
In a small bowl, combine egg, milk and oil.  Pour into well of mixture.  Stir together until well mixed.  Fold in raspberries. Fill muffin cups 2/3 full.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.
name: RASPBERRY BRAN MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Honey Spread:  Beat margarine or butter and honey until fluffy.

Heat oven to 400°.  Grease bottoms of 12 medium muffin cups. Mix baking mix, 2 tablespoons sugar, egg, peel and juice.  Beat vigorously for 30 seconds.  Fill muffin cups about 2/3 full.  Mix 2 tablespoons sugar with spices.  Sprinkle each muffin with about 1/2 teaspoon of sugar mixture.  Bake for 15 minutes.  Serve warm with honey spread.
name: ORANGE JUICE MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  In another bowl, combine egg, milk, oil and orange peel.  Add to cornmeal mixture, stirring just until ingredients are combined. Fill greased muffin tins 2/3 full.  Bake at 425° for 15 minutes or until lightly brown.  Serve warm.
Can be frozen after cooled.  Substitute lemon peel for orange for lemon muffins.
name: ORANGE CORN MUFFINS

individualIngredient: old-fashioned or quick cooking oats, uncooked
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Grease muffin tins.  In small bowl, mix 1/2 cup walnuts and 2 tablespoons oats; set aside.  Mix remaining nuts and oats with flour, baking powder, soda and salt.  In another bowl, mash bananas.  Beat in milk, honey, melted butter and egg until blended.  Stir banana mixture into flour mixture just until blended.  Batter will be lumpy.  Spoon batter into muffin tins; sprinkle with nut-oat mixture.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes until golden and toothpick inserted comes out clean.  Immediately remove muffins from pan.  Serve warm or cool.
name: BANANA-NUT MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. old-fashioned or quick cooking oats, uncooked

recipeInstructions: Mix and store up to 7 weeks in refrigerator.  Bake in greased muffin tins at 375° for 12 to 17 minutes.
name: 7 WEEK BRAN MUFFINS

individualIngredient: frozen bread dough, thawed walnuts cinnamon
recipeInstructions: Grease 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle walnuts in bottom of pan. Break 1 loaf of bread in small pieces and place over nuts. Sprinkle with cinnamon.  Mix brown sugar, margarine, pudding and milk.  Pour over bread.  Break last loaf in small pieces and place over all other ingredients.  Let raise 2 to 2 1/2 hours.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.  Turn rolls out on a wax paper covered cookie sheet.
name: SIMPLE CARAMEL ROLLS
recipeIngredient: 2 loaves frozen bread dough, thawed walnuts cinnamon
3 oz. each vanilla pudding cook type

recipeInstructions: In bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, salt and soda. Beat eggs and sugar together until thick.  Stir in oil and vanilla. Add dry ingredients and buttermilk alternately to egg mixture. Beat just until blended.  Roll dough on floured surface to 1/2-inch thickness.  Cut with doughnut cutter.  Fry in deep hot grease (375°) about 1 1/2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper toweling.  Cool slightly.  Dust with powdered sugar.
name: BUTTERMILK DOUGHNUTS

recipeInstructions: Sift flour, baking powder, soda and salt together.  Combine egg, buttermilk and shortening and add to dry ingredients.  Mix until just well moistened.  Fry on hot griddle until bubbles appear on surface; turn and fry until brown.
name: BUTTERMILK PANCAKES

recipeInstructions: Melt oleo in 9 x 13-inch glass dish or 2 pie dishes.

Beat eggs and add 1/2 cup milk.  Gradually add flour, salt and another 1/2 cup milk.  Beat hard with spoon until thick and smooth.  Mix in remaining milk.  Pour over oleo.  Bake at 450° for 30 minutes until golden.  Sprinkle 2 tablespoons sugar over top when done.  Serve with syrup or more sugar.
name: PANNUKAKKA

recipeInstructions: In bowl, mix all ingredients except flour.  When blended, add flour.  Blend well.  Heat 8-inch skillet over medium heat.  Brush with shortening.  Pour batter 2 tablespoons at a time into skillet. Tilt pan to make a 6-inch round thin pancake.  Brown about 1 minute, then turn to brown on the other side.  Serve immediately with butter and syrup.  Makes 14 to 16 pancakes.
name: THIN PANCAKES

recipeInstructions: Preheat waffle iron.  Place egg yolks in large mixing bowl and whites in small bowl.  To yolks, add buttermilk; beat well.  Add flour, baking powder, soda and salt.  Beat until smooth.  Stir in melted butter.  Beat egg whites until soft peaks form.  Fold into batter.  Bake in preheated waffle iron set at medium heat 5 or 8 minutes or until steaming stops and waffle is golden brown.
name: WAFFLES

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Cream butter and cheese together. Blend in flour, salt and paprika.  Knead with hands to form a soft dough.  Form small balls with mixture and place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Press balls down slightly.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool.  Makes 2 dozen.
name: CHEDDAR CRISPS

individualIngredient: active dry yeast or fast-rising yeast
recipeInstructions: Dissolve yeast in 3/4 cup very warm water in glass measuring cup.  In large bowl, stir flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt and yeast mixture until blended.  Cover bowl with waxed paper; let dough stand for 5 minutes.  Lightly brush pizza pan with salad oil and sprinkle with cornmeal.  Pat dough onto pizza pan, shaping a ridge around edge of pan.  Put on pizza ingredients.  Bake at 425° for 20 minutes.
name: BASIC PIZZA DOUGH
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. active dry yeast or fast-rising yeast

recipeInstructions: In medium bowl, mix with fork all ingredients until texture of coarse crumbs.  Sprinkle 3 to 4 tablespoons of cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, into flour mixture.  Mix lightly with fork after each addition until pastry is moist.  Divide pastry evenly. Dampen countertop with water.  Place piece of waxed paper, about 12 square-inches, on surface.  Put half of dough on this.  Cover with a second piece of waxed paper.  Roll out dough until about 1-inch larger in circumference than pie pan.  Remove top waxed paper. Place pie pan face down on dough.  Quickly flip dough over by grasping bottom waxed paper, 1 hand opposite the other.  Slowly peel off waxed paper and ease crust into pan.  Crust will break easily but it also patches easy and doesn't show like normal crusts.  Repeat rolling technique for top crust.  Peel off top paper, then carefully flip top crust onto pie.  Be sure to seal crusts well with prongs of fork.
For baked pie crust, be sure to prick bottom of crust in several places to avoid bubbling during baking.  Bake at 425° for 15 minutes.
name: FLAKY OIL PIE PASTRY

recipeInstructions: 1.  To keep pie bottom from getting mushy, brush the unbaked bottom crust of your pie with well beaten egg whites.
2. To keep juices from running out of pie, sprinkle 2 rounded tablespoons of fine bread crumbs; use one on crust bottom and one in the front.
name: DOUBLE PIE CRUST

recipeInstructions: Mix pie ingredients together.  Sprinkle topping over pie. Bake at 350° until golden brown and bubbly.
name: SOUR CREAM APPLE PIE

recipeInstructions: Grease pie pan, then heap with apples.  Mix together brown sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over apples.  Blend together the flour, sugar, margarine and egg.  Spread over apples.  Top with chopped nuts.  Bake for 40 minutes in 350° oven.  Serve warm or cold.
name: SWEDISH APPLE PIE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Combine apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and lemon juice.  Toss lightly to mix.  Pour into unbaked pie crust.  Dot with butter.
Combine flour, sugar and cinnamon.  Cut in butter until crumbly.  Sprinkle over fruit filling.  Bake for 40 to 45 minutes.
name: YUMMY APPLE PIE

individualIngredient: pkg. sweet chocolate, melted and cooled
recipeInstructions: In large bowl, stir eggs, corn syrup, chocolate, sugar, butter and vanilla until well blended.  Stir in pecans.  Pour into pastry shell.  Bake in 350° oven 50 to 60 minutes or until knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean.  Cool on wire rack.  Makes 8 servings.
name: CHOCOLATE PECAN PIE
recipeIngredient: 1  4 oz. pkg. sweet chocolate, melted and cooled

recipeInstructions: Spread butter evenly over bottom and sides of 9-inch pie pan. Press 1 1/3 cups coconut into butter, forming a shell.  Mix 1 cup coconut, the eggs, sugar, cheese and lemon juice.  Blend until smooth, about 1 1/2 minutes.  Pour into coconut shell.  Sprinkle remaining coconut in a ring around top and in center.  Bake at 325° for 30 minutes.  Refrigerate any leftovers.
name: COCONUT CHEESE PIE

individualIngredient: cracker or Oreo cookie chocolate pie crust
recipeInstructions: Mix peanut butter, cream cheese, vanilla and butter.  Mix well.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Spread into crust.  Chill.
Mix ingredients.  Press into pie pan.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
name: PEANUT BUTTER PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 graham cracker or Oreo cookie chocolate pie crust

individualIngredient: size pkg. Jell-O vanilla instant pudding
recipeInstructions: Pour milk and pie filling into large bowl; beat with wire whisk until well blended, about 1 minute.  Let stand for 5 minutes.

Fold in Cool Whip, pecans, gingersnaps, pumpkin and spice. Spoon into crust.  Freeze until firm, about 6 hours or overnight. Remove from freezer and let stand for about 10 minutes before serving.  Store any leftovers in freezer.
name: PUMPKIN GINGERSNAP PIE
recipeIngredient: 1  4 -serving size pkg. Jell-O vanilla instant pudding

individualIngredient: vanilla ice cream chocolate topping or flavor of your choice peanuts whipped cream maraschino cherries
recipeInstructions: Allow ice cream to soften slightly.  Spoon into crust.  Cover and freeze until firm (about 3 hours).  Serve pie wedges with chocolate topping, whipped cream, nuts and a cherry.
name: ICE CREAM SUNDAE PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 qt. vanilla ice cream chocolate topping or flavor of your choice peanuts whipped cream maraschino cherries

recipeInstructions: Cake:  Grease and flour two 8-inch or 9-inch layer pans.  Mix and bake the cake, following the package directions.  When the cake is cool, frost.
Frosting:  Mix together pudding mix, topping mix and milk. Beat at low speed.  Blend in flavor and food coloring.  Beat at high speed 2 to 3 minutes until stiff.
Optional:  Cut slivers of chocolate-covered creme de menthe wafers (like Andes) over the top for garnish.  Serves 12.
name: LOW-FAT MINT CHOCOLATE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix first 3 ingredients and cool.  Beat eggs.  Add sugar and dry ingredients.  Then add oatmeal mixture.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch greased and floured pan.  Sprinkle brown sugar and chocolate chips over batter before baking.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or more.
name: CHOCOLATE CHIP CAKE

recipeInstructions: Melt caramels, milk and butter over low heat.  Set aside.  Mix cake mix according to package directions.  Pour half of batter into a 9 x 13-inch pan which has been greased.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Remove from oven and spread caramel mixture on top. Sprinkle nuts and chips on caramel mixture.  Pour remaining batter on top and return to oven.  Bake for 20 minutes at 350°.  You can use milk chocolate chips instead of semi-sweet chips.
name: TURTLE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Combine and let cool dates, soda and boiling water.  Cream together sugar, shortening and eggs.  Combine the dry ingredients with the creamed and water mixtures.  Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle with sugar, nuts and chocolate chips.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
name: CHOCOLATE CHIP DATE CAKE

individualIngredient: salt whipped cream optional fresh raspberries optional
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Grease and flour a Bundt pan or 10-inch tube pan.  In a heavy medium saucepan, combine the chocolate, butter and coffee.  Cook over low heat, stirring until melted and smooth.  Remove the pan from the heat and cool for 15 minutes. Beat in the eggs.

In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt.  Stir in the chocolate mixture and beat until well blended. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 55 to 60 minutes.  Cool on wire rack for 15 minutes.  Turn cake out and cool completely.  Serve with raspberries and whipped cream, if desired.
name: CHOCOLATE RASPBERRY CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. salt whipped cream optional fresh raspberries optional

recipeInstructions: Mix cake mix, eggs and pie filling.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
Frosting:  Boil sugar, butter and milk 1 minute.  Stir in chips.  Beat well.  Immediately spread over warm cake.
name: CHERRY CHOCOLATE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Cream margarine with sugar.  Add next 7 ingredients.  Mix well; pour into a greased 13 x 9-inch pan.  Sprinkle last 3 ingredients over unbaked cake.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
name: CHOCOLATE-APPLESAUCE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, butter and eggs.  Add milk, vanilla and flour. Pour in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.  Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar.  Spread cherry filling (or your favorite filling) on top. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.  Drizzle powdered sugar frosting (powdered sugar and milk) on top.
name: CHERRY COFFEE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Beat eggs well.  Slowly add the sugar.  Add the baking powder to the flour.  Add alternately with the oil.  Beat on low.  Add vanilla and salt.  Put all but 1 cup in greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Spoon on pie filling.  Spoon rest of dough on top.
Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.  Frost lightly with powdered sugar frosting.
name: CHERRY COFFEECAKE

individualIngredient: sour half and half or sour cream
recipeInstructions: Cream well shortening and sugar.  Add eggs and vanilla.  Sift together 3 times and add to shortening and egg mixture: flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Add half and half or sour cream.  Drop batter into well-greased bread pans in layers. Between each layer, sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon mix (3 parts sugar, 1 part cinnamon).  Bake at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes.
name: SOUR CREAM COFFEE CAKE
recipeIngredient: 4 c. sour half and half or sour cream

recipeInstructions: Beat egg.  Add sugar, flour and baking soda, then add well drained fruit cocktail.  Spread into greased 8 x 8-inch cake pan. Sprinkle with brown sugar and nuts.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
name: FRUIT COCKTAIL COFFEE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Beat 4 minutes.  Pour 1/2 of batter in angel food pan.  Slice apples (paper thin).  Sprinkle cinnamon, 1/2 cup sugar and nuts. Pour rest of batter over cinnamon, sugar and nuts.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: APPLE COFFEE CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. yellow cake mix without pudding

recipeInstructions: Mix shortening, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, flour, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg and baking soda.  Add apples and nuts.  Bake in 13 x 9-inch pan at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.
Sauce:  Melt butter.  Blend in sugars.  Stir in cream.  Simmer 3 to 4 minutes or boil 2 minutes.  Spoon over a piece of cake.  Top with Cool Whip and cherry.
name: APPLE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 300°.  Reserve 1 cup of dry cake mix.  In large bowl, combine remaining cake mix, 1 egg and oil.  Press crust mixture evenly into bottom and 3/4 way up sides of a greased 13 x 9-inch pan.  In same bowl, blend cream cheese and sugar.  Add 3 eggs and reserved cake mix.  Beat 1 minute at medium speed.  At low speed, slowly add milk and lemon juice.  Mix until smooth. Pour into crust.  Bake 45 to 55 minutes until center is firm.  Top with filling.
name: EASY CHEESE CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. yellow or butter cake mix

recipeInstructions: Mix cake mix, eggs, oil and 7-Up for 4 minutes.  Fold in nuts. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
Frosting:  Dissolve 1 package instant pudding in 1/2 cup milk. Fold in one 8 ounce package Cool Whip.  Keep refrigerated.
name: PISTACHIO CAKE

recipeInstructions: Soak the poppy seed in the hot water for a couple of hours. Mix all ingredients together and beat.  Pour into a floured 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.  Cool completely.
I frost cake with lemon pie filling, then put the cream cheese frosting on top.
name: GRANDMA HOPPE'S POPPY SEED CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together for 5 minutes.  Put in a greased 13 x 9-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.  While still hot, poke holes 1-inch apart with fork.  Dribble top of cake with juice of 2 lemons and 2 cups powdered sugar mixed until smooth.
name: LEMON PLUS CAKE

individualIngredient: Betty Crocker SuperMoist white cake mix
recipeInstructions: Take cake mix and bake according to directions.  Let cake cool.  Take a large fork and poke holes throughout cake.  Take jello (mix as directed) and pour over top of cake.  Take the lemon pie filling and spread over the cake.  Top with Cool Whip. Refrigerate.
name: JELLO-LEMON CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 box Betty Crocker SuperMoist white cake mix

individualIngredient: angel food cake mix one step method
recipeInstructions: Mix together cake mix and 1 can pie filling.  Pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.  Cool completely.  Top with 1 can lemon pie filling.  Top with Cool Whip a few hours before serving.
name: LEMON DESSERT
recipeIngredient: 1 box angel food cake mix one step method

individualIngredient: vanilla Cool Whip or ice cream
recipeInstructions: In 9 x 13-inch greased pan, spread rhubarb in pan.  Sprinkle sugar over top and jello (dry).  Make batter of flour, salt, baking powder, sugar, oil, milk and vanilla.  Beat well.  Spoon over rhubarb.
Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.  Cut in squares and serve upside down with Cool Whip or ice cream.
name: RHUBARB UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. vanilla Cool Whip or ice cream

recipeInstructions: Cream together sugar and oil.  Add carrots, eggs and pineapple. Sift rest of dry ingredients and add all ingredients together. Bake at 375° for 45 minutes.
name: CARROT CAKE

recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients in bowl.  Stir well.  Put into greased 9 x 13-inch baking pan.  Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.  Cool frosting and then refrigerate.
Mix altogether and frost.
name: SWEDISH CAKE

recipeInstructions: Break 1/2 cake into 50 cent size chunks and place in bottom of 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Cover with 1 Cool Whip.  Sprinkle 3 Butterfinger candy bars (crushed) on top.  Repeat.  Top with maraschino cherries.
name: BUTTERFINGER CAKE

recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients in a bowl and beat 10 minutes.  Put into well-greased and floured angel food pan and bake for 50 minutes at 350° to 375°.  Serve with whipped cream or powdered sugar.
name: POPPY SEED CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix cake ingredients well.  Pour in a well-greased 13 x 9-inch pan and bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes.  Cool completely.  Mix frosting ingredients and spoon over cake.  Refrigerate overnight.
name: PEA PICKING CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 small can mandarin oranges with juice

recipeInstructions: Topping:  Mix and spread on top of cake.
Beat eggs.  Mix together first 3 ingredients.  Spread 1/2 of batter in cake pan.  Add pie filling.  Spoon rest of cake on top of pie filling.  Spread on topping and bake 30 minutes at 375°.
name: YELLOW CHERRY CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix and bake cake mix according to package directions in a 13 x 9-inch pan.  Cool.  Slice in half lengthwise.  Bring milk and flour to boil, stirring constantly.  Cool well.  Cream remaining ingredients and add to milk and flour mixture.  Beat until fluffy. Spread on bottom layer and top with other half of cake.  You can refrigerate 2 days before eating.  You can cut cake into individual pieces, wrap in Saran Wrap and put in freezer.  Good to take out and put in lunch pails.
name: TWINKIE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Bake cake according to package directions in two round 8 or 9-inch pans.  Cool.  Place one cake in bottom of a trifle dish. Poke holes in top of cake with a fork.  Pour Kahlua (according to taste preference) over cake.  Make pudding and pour half over cake. Layer 1/2 Cool Whip.  Sprinkle 1/2 crushed candy bars over Cool Whip.  Repeat layers.
name: KAHLUA CAKE

recipeInstructions: Melt butter, marshmallows and oil.  Pour over popcorn and add M&M's.  Put into pan and let cool.
name: POPCORN CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix required cake for each recipe according to package directions, adding extra ingredients.
name: BEST CAKE FROSTING

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients well.  Roll into balls and then in sugar. Put on pan.  Bake 12 minutes at 350°.
name: GINGERSNAPS

recipeInstructions: Combine shortening and sugar.  Mix well.  Add molasses and egg.  Combine dry ingredients.  Add to shortening mixture.  Make into balls the size of a walnut.  Dip in sugar and bake in a 350° oven for 8 to 10 minutes.
name: GINGERSNAP COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Stir all ingredients together in bowl.  Make into balls like marbles.  Dip into sugar.  Put on greased pan and bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.
name: GINGERSNAPS

recipeInstructions: In large bowl, mix sugar and butter.  Beat in egg and molasses.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Roll dough on well-floured board.  Cut into desired shapes.  Place on greased baking sheet.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool.  Decorate as desired.  Makes about 15 (6-inch) cookies.
name: GINGERBREAD PEOPLE
recipeIngredient: 3/4 c. firmly packed dark brown sugar

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients.  Bake at 375° for 8 to 10 minutes.
name: CHOCOLATE PUDDING COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Cookies:  Preheat oven to 350°.  Mix butter and sugar together until creamy.  Stir in egg and vanilla.  Add milk; sift together flour, baking powder , baking soda, salt and cocoa and add to other ingredients until just well blended.   Use a teaspoon to measure out each cookie onto a greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 8 minutes.

Slime:  Mix all ingredients together very well.  Add a few extra drops of green food coloring for a greener slime.  When cookies are cooled, spread with one heaping teaspoon of slime and make sandwich cookie.
name: SLIME-FILLED CHOCOLATE SANDWICH COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine flour, baking soda and salt in separate bowl.  Mix sugars, eggs, vanilla and butter until creamy. Mix in flour mixture.  Stir in mini bits.  Drop by teaspoonfuls on cookie sheets.  Bake until golden brown.
Pan Recipe:  Spread batter in greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan. Bake in 375° oven for 20 minutes.
name: MINI BIT COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Cream together shortening and peanut butter.  Gradually add white sugar and firmly packed brown sugar.  Cream well.   Add egg, milk and vanilla.  Blend in flour, baking soda and salt.  Mix well.  Shape into small balls and roll in white sugar.  Place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 8 minutes.  Remove from oven and place solid milk chocolate candy kiss on top of each cookie, pressing down so that cookie cracks around the edges. Return to oven; bake 2 to 4 minutes longer.
name: PEANUT BLOSSOMS

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt.  Set aside.  In a separate bowl, cream peanut butter, margarine and sugars.  Add eggs and vanilla.  Mix well. Add flour mixture slowly, stirring well.  Add chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Makes approximately 6 dozen cookies.
name: PEANUT BUTTER/CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES

recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, combine butter, sugars and peanut butter until light and fluffy.  Blend in eggs and vanilla.  Mix in flour, baking soda and salt.  Add chips.  Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes at 350° or until lightly browned.  Cool 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheets onto wire racks to cool completely.
name: PEANUT BUTTER AND CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Cream shortening, sugars and peanut butter.  Add unbeaten eggs. Beat well; add flour, soda and salt sifted together.  Form into balls and flatten with a fork dipped into sugar.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
name: PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Cream sugars, shortening and peanut butter together.  Add eggs and vanilla and mix well.  In a separate bowl, sift together, soda, flour and salt.  Add half at a time to creamed mixture until all mixed in.  Bake in 350° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
name: PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Chill for a short time.  Roll in balls and dip in sugar.  Bake at 375° for 10 minutes.
name: MOLASSES SUGAR COOKIES

individualIngredient: Quaker oats quick or old fashioned , uncooked
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Grease cookie sheet.  In medium bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, soda, salt and nutmeg.  In large bowl, beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy.  Blend in eggs and vanilla.  Add dry ingredients; mix well.  Stir in oats, raisins and nuts.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet.  Bake about 8 minutes or until a light brown.  Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire cooling rack.  Makes about 4 1/2 dozen cookies.
name: RAISIN SPICE DROPS
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 c. Quaker oats quick or old fashioned , uncooked

individualIngredient: Quaker oats quick or old fashioned , uncooked
recipeInstructions: In large bowl, beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy.  Blend in eggs and vanilla.  Add remaining ingredients; mix well.  Shape dough to form two 12-inch long rolls; wrap in wax paper.  Freeze several hours or overnight.  Heat oven to 350°. Cut each roll into 1/4-inch thick slices; bake on ungreased cookie sheets 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly brown.  Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet, then remove to wire cooling rack.  Makes about 6 1/2 dozen cookies.
name: BROWN SUGAR CRISPIES
recipeIngredient: 3 c. Quaker oats quick or old fashioned , uncooked

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  In large bowl, combine butter and sugar; cream together, then beat in egg and vanilla.  Next, add baking powder and flour, one cup at a time.  Roll out and cut.
name: ROLL OUT SUGAR COOKIES

individualIngredient: flour more if sticky chocolate kisses
recipeInstructions: Cream butter, cheese and sugar until smooth.  Beat in egg yolks.  Add vanilla and flour.  Roll into balls.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Do not overbake.  Remove from oven and press in chocolate kisses.
name: CREAM CHEESE COOKIES
recipeIngredient: 5 c. flour more if sticky chocolate kisses

individualIngredient: margarine pinch of salt nuts optional
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Roll into balls and then press down with fork.  Bake at 350° until light golden brown.
name: POTATO CHIP COOKIES
recipeIngredient: 1 c. margarine pinch of salt nuts optional

recipeInstructions: Beat together shortening, vanilla and sugar.  In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add eggs to sugar mixture and beat together.  Alternately add dry ingredients and sour cream to the sugar mixture.  Roll out on floured surface and cut out cookies.  Bake at 425° for 8 minutes.
name: SOUR CREAM COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Mix in large bowl, roaster or dishpan in order given.  Drop by large spoon onto greased cookie sheet.  Flatten dough.  Bake at 350° for 12 minutes.  Let cool several minutes before removing from pan.
name: MONSTER COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Cream butter and 1 1/2 cups sugar.  Beat in eggs and vanilla.  Stir in flour, cream of tartar, soda and salt.  Shape dough into balls, using a rounded teaspoon.
Combine 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon.  Roll dough in sugar mixture.  Place about 2 inches apart on cookie sheet.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes. cookies will puff up and fall during baking.
name: SNICKERDOODLE COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Beat egg whites and salt until stiff.  Add gradually sugar at low speed of mixer.  Continue to beat 5 more minutes.  Fold in vanilla, chips and candy.
Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 250° for 45 minutes.  Makes 2 dozen.
name: PEPPERMINT MERINGUES

recipeInstructions: Mix together sugar, powdered sugar, oil and margarine.  Then add vanilla and eggs and beat again.  Then add dry ingredients: flour, salt, cream of tartar and baking soda.  Mix again.
Roll in ball and flatten with bottom of sugared glass.  Bake at 350° until lightly browned (at Christmas use colored sugars).
name: MELT AWAY COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven at least 15 minutes at 375°.  Beat egg whites until very stiff with salt and cream of tartar.  Add sugar gradually, beating continually.  Beat until glossy.  Add chips and vanilla.  Drop by spoonfuls (small) on ungreased cookie sheet. Put in oven and immediately turn oven off.  Leave in oven at least 5 hours or overnight.  Do not open oven until time is up!!
name: FORGOTTEN KISSES

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Mix sugars, margarine, vanilla and egg. Stir in flour and baking soda (dough will be stiff).  Stir in chocolate chips.  Spread or pat dough in ungreased 12-inch pizza pan or on cookie sheet.  Bake about 15 minutes or until golden brown; cool.  Just before serving, spread cookie with whipped cream.  Sprinkle with walnuts, coconut and chocolate candies.  Cut into wedges.  Refrigerate any remaining cookie.  Makes 16 servings.
*If using self-rising flour, omit baking soda.
**For 1 cup whipped cream, beat 1/2 cup (heavy) cream and 1 tablespoon granulated or powdered sugar in chilled bowl until stiff.
name: COOKIE PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1  6 oz. pkg. miniature semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/4 c. flaked or shredded coconut, toasted

recipeInstructions: Mix dry Jell-O into cottage cheese.  Add mandarin oranges and pineapple.  Fold in Cool Whip.
name: COTTAGE CHEESE DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 375°.  Grease 9 x 13-inch pan.  Place pie filling in pan.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Sprinkle over pie filling. Bake 30 minutes.  May be served warm or cool.
name: CHERRY CRISP

recipeInstructions: Combine first 4 ingredients.  Crumble margarine into flour mixture.  Beat eggs, milk and vanilla.  Add to flour mixture.  Put dough into 9 x 13-inch cake pan, saving some of mixture for top. Put cherry pie filling on dough.  Put remainder of dough dropped into spots on top of filling.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: CHERRY SWEET DOUGH

recipeInstructions: Mix together pineapple, pie filling and condensed milk.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.
name: CHERRY DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Save 6 cherries with stems for garnish. Remove stems and pits from all other cherries.  In 2-quart saucepan, stir water and cornstarch until blended.  Add cherries, lemon peel, cinnamon, 1/4 to 1/3 cup sugar (depending how sweet cherries are) and salt.  Over medium heat, cook cherries until soft and mixture thickens and boils, stirring frequently.  Spoon cherry mixture into custard cups.  Mix flour, powder, oil, egg, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/8 teaspoon salt until blended.  Spoon batter on top of cherry mixture.  Bake 15 minutes or until top is golden.  Serve with drop of whipping cream and garnish with cherry.
name: CHERRY COBBLER

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, butter, nuts and white sugar.  Press in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool, crumble and pat in pan.
Mix Cool Whip, cream cheese and powdered sugar.  Put on crust; top with cherries.
name: CHERRY TORTE

recipeInstructions: Mix crackers and butter or margarine together.  Press into a 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
Mix the rest of ingredients together and beat until smooth. Pour into the pan and bake at 350° until it is set (about 20 to 30 minutes).
When cool, pour over 1 to 1 1/2 cans cherry pie filling.  Top with Cool Whip when serving.
name: CHEESY CHEESE TORTE

individualIngredient: devil's food cake mix with added pudding
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour 15 x 10-inch jelly roll or 13 x 9-inch pan.  In large bowl, combine Base ingredients.  Stir by hand until well mixed.  Pour into pan.  Bake jelly roll pan 20 to 30 minutes or 13 x 9-inch pan 25 to 30 minutes.  In small saucepan, combine sugar, margarine and milk.  Boil, stirring constantly, 1 minute.  Remove from heat; stir in chocolate chips until smooth.  Pour over warm bars.  Makes about 3 dozen bars.
name: CHOCOLATE CHERRY BARS
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. devil's food cake mix with added pudding

recipeInstructions: Place pie filling in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Sprinkle with cinnamon.  Cover with dry cake mix.  Drizzle melted butter over cake mix.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.  (Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.)
name: EASY TORTE
recipeIngredient: 2 cans cherry or blueberry pie filling
1 pkg. white or yellow cake mix
1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted cinnamon

recipeInstructions: In large bowl, combine sugar, flour and spices.  Coat berries with sugar mixture.  Place mixture in a shallow 8 1/2-inch round casserole dish.  Sprinkle with lemon juice.  Dot with butter. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.
In the meantime, invert frozen pie crust onto waxed paper. Let thaw until flat.  Place flat crust over berries.  Bake about 30 minutes longer or until crust is brown and juice is bubbly.
name: BLUEBERRY COBBLER

recipeInstructions: Make as directed.  Bake only 15 to 18 minutes.  Put on jelly roll pan or cookie sheet with about 1-inch sides.
Cream everything together except milk.  Add milk to mixture. Whip until fluffy.  Spread over cooled cake (about 1 hour).  Heat 1 cup chocolate frosting.  Spread on top of cake.  Refrigerate.
name: CHOCOLATE HO HO'S

recipeInstructions: Cream shortening and add sugar.  Beat in eggs and blend in syrup.  Stir in flour and nuts.  Bake in 11 x 16-inch greased pan at 350° for 25 minutes.
name: FUDGE BROWNIES

recipeInstructions: Combine softened cream cheese, sugar, egg and almond extract. Melt chocolate and margarine; cool.  Beat eggs; add sugar and chocolate mixture.  Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to chocolate mixture and mix well.  Pour half of chocolate batter into greased 8-inch square pan; spread with cream cheese mixture.  Top with remaining batter.  Sprinkle with almonds.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: VIENNESE BROWNIES

recipeInstructions: Mix brownie mix as directed on package.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan or jelly roll size pan (as desired), greased.  Mix oleo, brown sugar and oatmeal; sprinkle over unbaked brownie batter and add M&M's over all.  Can use plain or peanut.  Bake at 350° for approximately 25 minutes.
name: M&M BROWNIES

recipeInstructions: Melt peanut butter and butter over low heat.  Add brown sugar. Mix until gooey but do not boil.  Take off heat and add powdered sugar.  Press in a 9 x 13-inch pan.  Top with melted chocolate chips.
name: PEANUT BUTTER BARS

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine and add powdered sugar, peanut butter, graham crackers and vanilla.  Mix well.  Press in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Melt chocolate chips.  Add 1 or 2 tablespoons peanut butter.  Pour over bars.  Refrigerate.
name: PEANUT BUTTER BARS UNBAKED

recipeInstructions: Mix cake mix and 3/4 cup evaporated milk.  Spread 1/2 of batter in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake 6 minutes at 350°.   Melt caramels and 1/3 cup evaporated milk in top of double boiler. Sprinkle chocolate chips over baked layer, then spread melted caramels.  Top with remaining cake batter.  Bake 18 minutes at 350°.  Makes 48 bars.
name: YUMMY CARAMEL BARS

recipeInstructions: Combine graham crackers and butter and pat into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 8 minutes.  Cool.  Mix milk and coconut and spread on cooled crust.  Bake 15 minutes.  Melt chips in a double boiler.  Spread on top of baked coconut layer.
name: MOUND BARS

individualIngredient: graham cracker crumbs Waverly crackers or Club crackers
recipeInstructions: Line bottom of 13 x 9-inch pan with crackers.  Mix first 5 ingredients.  Boil 5 minutes.  Pour 1/2 mixture over crackers. Layer 1 more time with crackers and pour remaining mixture over crackers.  Add 1 more layer of crackers.  Then melt last 3 ingredients.  Spread over top layer of crackers.  Refrigerate.
name: KIT-KAT BARS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. graham cracker crumbs Waverly crackers or Club crackers

recipeInstructions: Cream sugars and butter.  Blend in egg.  Add next 6 ingredients and spread onto a greased (9 x 13-inch) pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  While still hot, sprinkle chocolate chips on top.  Let melt and spread.  Cool.  Mix 1/4 cup peanut butter, powdered sugar and 2 to 4 tablespoons milk.  Spread over the chocolate.
name: BUTTERFINGER BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix graham cracker crumbs, nuts and melted oleo and pat into 13 x 9-inch pan.  In bowl, beat 5 egg whites, 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar and water until stiff.  Add sugar and beat until stiff. Pour and spread evenly over crust.  Bake 1 hour at 250°.  Cool. Crush Heath bars and divide into 2 parts.  Whip 2 packages Dream Whip and fold in one part candy.  Spread over dessert.  Sprinkle remaining candy on top.  Chill 1 hour.
name: HEATH BAR DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Blend together all ingredients until crumbly.  Press into bottom of greased 13 x 9-inch pan.  Sprinkle with 1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips and 2 cups miniature marshmallows. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Melt 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 1 tablespoon shortening.  Drizzle over marshmallows after baking.
name: S'MORE BARS

recipeInstructions: Butter a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.  Heat butter, syrup and chocolate chips to boiling in 3-quart pan; stir constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.  Pour over cereal in large mixing bowl.  Toss quickly until completely covered with chocolate.  Fold in marshmallows, 1 cup at a time.  Press mixture into pan with the back of a buttered spoon.  Let stand until firm, about 1 hour.  Cut into squares.
name: INDOOR S'MORES

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine and marshmallows.  Add Cocoa Krispies.  Quickly stir and put in greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
name: COCOA KRISPIE BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix peanut butter and corn syrup in 6-quart kettle on medium heat just until warm.  Add Rice Krispies; pour into buttered 13 x 9-inch pan.  Spread evenly.
Mix in saucepan chips and oil until melted and spread over bars.  Keep refrigerated.
name: RICE KRISPIE BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, cornstarch and sugar in a bowl.  Blend in butter until soft dough is formed.  If dough is too soft to handle, cover and chill.  Shape into 3/4-inch balls.  Roll in coconut.  Place 1 1/2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet.  Bake at 300° for 20 to 25 minutes.
name: MELTING MOMENTS

recipeInstructions: Line bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan with soda crackers.  Mix brown sugar, cracker crumbs, milk and butter.  Bring to a slow boil and cook 7 minutes.
Pour over soda crackers; top with soda crackers.  Cool.  Melt together vanilla, chocolate chips and butter.  Spread over soda crackers.
name: SODA CRACKER BARS

recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients.  Cut in 1 1/2 cups shortening or butter until crumbly.  Pat 2/3 of the crumbly mixture on the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch or 15 x 10 x 1-inch ungreased baking pan.  Spread with 2 cups of any kind of jam.  The jam will spread easier if you beat it with a fork before spreading.
Sprinkle jam with remaining crumbly mixture.  Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cut while still warm and cool completely.  Makes about 36 bars.
name: JAM BARS

recipeInstructions: Combine first 3 ingredients.  Sift next 4 dry ingredients.  Add to egg mixture alternately with baby food and nuts (nuts are optional).  Pour batter in greased and floured cookie sheet pan (18 x 12-inch).  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
Frosting:  Cream 4 last ingredients.
name: BABY FOOD BARS

recipeInstructions: Combine dry cake mix, butter and 1/3 cup evaporated milk together.  Add the chopped nuts (optional), stirring by hand. Press 1/2 of cake mixture in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 6 minutes.  Remove and cool.

Melt caramels in 1/3 cup evaporated milk in microwave.  Pour melted caramel over cake.  Sprinkle chocolate chips.  Drop rest of cake mixture by teaspoon.  Bake at 15 to 20 minutes.  Cut when cool.  Yummy!
name: GERMAN CHOCOLATE CARAMEL BARS

recipeInstructions: First Layer:  Mix flour and butter; stir in nuts.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.  Cool.
Second Layer:  Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar and 1 cup Cool Whip.  Spread over crust.
Third Layer:  Mix instant pudding and milk.  Spread over cream cheese layer.
Fourth Layer:  Frost with remaining Cool Whip.  Sprinkle with chopped nuts.  Chill at least 4 hours.
name: CHOCOLATE BREEZE

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  In medium bowl, mix flour and sugar.  Cut in margarine until crumbly.  Stir in 1/2 cup chocolate chips; press on bottom of 13 x 9-inch pan.  Bake 15 minutes.  Combine milk, egg and vanilla.  Stir in remaining chocolate chips and nuts.  Spread evenly over crust.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes until light brown.  Cool and cut into bars.
name: CHOCOLATE CHIP BARS

recipeInstructions: Spread over firm frosting.  Chill until topping is firm.
name: CHOCOLATE MINT BARS

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 325°.  In large bowl, combine flour and remaining crust ingredients; mix well.  Press mixture in bottom of ungreased 9-inch square pan or 11 x 7-inch pan.

In large bowl, beat sugar, brown sugar, margarine and cream cheese until smooth.  Add remaining filling ingredients; blend well.  Spread over crust.  Bake at 325° for 38 to 43 minutes or until edges are light golden brown and set.  Cool 30 minutes.

In small saucepan over low heat, melt all glaze ingredients, stirring constantly, until smooth.  Drizzle over warm bars. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.  Cut into bars.  Store in refrigerator.  Makes 36 bars.
name: BLACK BOTTOM CREAM CHEESE BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt and sugar.  Form a well and add oil, eggs and pumpkin.  Bake in a jelly roll pan for 15 to 20 minutes at 350°.  Cool and frost.
name: PUMPKIN BARS

recipeInstructions: Grease 9 x 12-inch pan.  Beat eggs and sugar.  Add pumpkin, pie spice, vanilla and milk.  Pour in pan.
Topping:  Mix cake mix and oleo together until crumbly. Sprinkle over pumpkin mixture.
Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.  Cool.  Cover with Cool Whip. Refrigerate.
name: PUMPKIN TORTE
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. white or yellow cake mix

recipeInstructions: Put graham cracker crust in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
Combine first set of ingredients and spread over crust.
Combine second set of ingredients and pour on top.
Bake at 350° for 35 to 45 minutes.  Top with whipped cream.
name: PUMPKIN TORTE

recipeInstructions: Mix flour and 2 tablespoons brown sugar.  Cut in 6 tablespoons butter.  Pat mixture into an ungreased 11 x 7-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Beat eggs slightly.  Stir in 1/2 cup brown sugar, pecans, corn syrup, 2 tablespoons melted butter, vanilla and salt.  Pour over baked layer.  Bake at 350° about 25 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.
name: PECAN PIE BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar and oil.  Add eggs, then combine them with the rest of the ingredients.  Bake in a floured pan at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
name: ZUCCHINI BARS

recipeInstructions: Combine and pour over baked crust.  Bake 25 minutes at 350°. Sprinkle with powdered sugar when cooled.
name: LEMON BARS

recipeInstructions: Blend flour, powdered sugar and margarine to crumb stage. Press into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Beat remaining ingredients.  Pour over crust.  Bake 20 minutes at 350°.
name: LEMON BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, oleo and sugar and press into 13 x 9-inch pan.  Bake 15 minutes at 350°.  Cool.  Break up, crumble and press down again. Whip cream cheese.  Add Dream Whip and powdered sugar.  Put on first layer.  Spread pudding over dessert.  Top with whipped cream and chill.
name: LEMON TORTE

recipeInstructions: Place Twinkies in a 13 x 9-inch pan.  Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add 7-Up, pineapple and ice cream.  Let thicken. Pour over Twinkies.  Spread Cool Whip on top.  Sprinkle with nuts.
name: TWINKIE DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Melt marshmallows in milk over slow fire.  Cool.  Drain juice of pineapple and combine with marshmallow mixture.  Whip the cream and add to the rest.  Put half of graham crackers in pan; sprinkle remainder on top.  Put in refrigerator to set.
name: MARSHMALLOW TORTE

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, butter, salt and sugar as for pastry.  Add pecans. Put in bottom of pan (9 x 13-inch).  Bake in preheated oven at 350° for 15 minutes.  Cool.
Blend cream cheese and powdered sugar.  Blend in Cool Whip. Spread on cool crust.  Beat together pudding and milk until creamy.  Carefully spread over cream cheese mixture.
Top with Cool Whip.  Garnish with chopped pecans. Refrigerate.  Will keep several days.
name: WONDERFUL DESSERT
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. pecans, chopped pinch of salt

recipeInstructions: Take 1 stick of margarine, flour and sugar and combine in mixing bowl.  Mix like pie crust.  Press into cake pan (13 x 9-inch).  Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.  Let cool.  Take cream cheese and cream together with 1 cup of powdered sugar.  Beat in 1 cup of Cool Whip.  Spread this mixture on top of crust.  Take chocolate and French vanilla puddings.  Mix together with 3 cups of milk.  Spread over cream cheese mixture.  Top with remaining Cool Whip.  Refrigerate.
name: "FANTASY" DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, sugar, oleo and nuts and press into a 13 x 9-inch pan.  Bake at 375° for 15 minutes.  Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar.  Fold in 1/2 of a large container of Cool Whip.  Spread on first layer.  Cook 2 small packages of coconut pudding with milk.  Cook until thick, then cool.  Spread over other layers.  Spread remaining Cool Whip on top.  Sprinkle with toasted coconut.
name: HOLLY'S DELIGHT

recipeInstructions: Bring to boil jello, sugar and pineapple with juice.  Chill until thick.  Beat cream cheese with milk.  Add to jello mixture. Beat Dream Whip and add to mixture.  Refrigerate.
name: APRICOT JELLO DESSERT

recipeInstructions: In a 9 x 9-inch square pan sprayed with nonstick spray, pour a can of pie filling (I like cherry or blueberry).  Cover that with Jiffy cake mix.  Melt one stick of oleo and pour over all.  Bake until brown.  Serve with Cool Whip.
name: EASY DESSERT

individualIngredient: salt powdered sugar vanilla ice cream
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 375°.  Line jelly roll pan, 15 1/2 x 10 x 1-inch with aluminum foil or waxed paper; grease generously.  Beat eggs in bowl on high speed until very thick and lemon colored, about 5 minutes.  Pour eggs into large mixer bowl.  Beat in granulated sugar gradually.  Beat in water and vanilla on low speed.  Add flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt, gradually beating just until batter is smooth.  Pour into pan.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes. Immediately loosen cake from edges of pan; invert on towel sprinkled generously with powdered sugar.  Carefully remove foil. While hot, roll cake and towel from narrow end.  Cool on wire rack at least 30 minutes.  Unroll cake; remove towel.  Spread ice cream on cake.  Roll up.  Frost with frosting below.

Chocolate Glaze:  Heat chocolate and margarine over low heat until melted.  Remove from heat; stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.  Stir in water, 1 teaspoon at a time, until glaze is of desired consistency.
name: CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM ROLL
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. salt powdered sugar vanilla ice cream

recipeInstructions: Melt sweet chocolate and semi-sweet chocolate chips in double boiler and let it cool down.  When cool, add 1/2 pint whipped whipping cream.  Mix well.  Add nuts now if you want, then pour it into a well-greased pan.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar.  Cut into cubes and enjoy.
name: ICE CUBES

recipeInstructions: Combine first 4 ingredients and roll into balls.  Dip in chocolate coating and put on wax paper to set.
name: PEANUT BUTTER BONBONS

recipeInstructions: Cook sugar and corn syrup over medium heat until it boils. Remove from heat; add peanut butter and mix well.  Add Special K and stir.  Press mixture into buttered 13 x 9-inch pan.  Cool. Melt both chips together.  Remove from heat and spread over Special K mixture.  Cool until firm.
name: FROSTED CHEWIES

recipeInstructions: Mix first 4 ingredients well.  Shape into balls; roll in coconut (optional) or pat flat in a pan as fudge.  Refrigerate if not eaten right away.
name: PEANUT BUTTER BALLS
recipeIngredient: 1 c. toasted wheat germ or bran

recipeInstructions: Melt chocolate in saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.  Add sugar, 1 egg and milk; beat until smooth. Chill until firm enough to handle, about 30 minutes.  Shape into 1/2-inch balls, ovals or logs.  Roll in decorations.  Makes about 5 dozen.
name: CHOCOLATE CREAMS
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. chocolate decors or colored sugar

recipeInstructions: Press cookie dough into bottom of 13 x 9-inch or jelly roll pan, ungreased.  Bake according to package directions.   Cool completely.
Add pudding to cold milk.  Stir briskly.  Let stand about 5 minutes to thicken.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Spread on cookie crust. Top with your favorite fruit.  Refrigerate.
name: FRUIT PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1 c. thawed Cool Whip fresh fruit

recipeInstructions: Toast oatmeal for 10 minutes in a 350° oven.  Combine with peanuts, coconut, powdered milk, wheat germ, raisins and prunes. Add honey, oil, vanilla, egg and milk.  Mix well.  Press firmly on well-greased 10 x 15-inch pan.  Bake until brown, about 23 minutes at 350°.  Cut immediately and refrigerate overnight.  Bake again at 345° for 40 minutes.
name: GRANOLA BARS

recipeInstructions: Mix together.  Pat into a 9-inch square pan.  Bake 30 minutes at 300°.  Cool very slightly.
In the meantime, combine topping ingredients.  Boil 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly (careful not to scorch).  Cut hot pudding into serving size, put desired amount of topping on and enjoy.
name: CRANBERRY PUDDING

recipeInstructions: Combine all in blender and blend well.
name: BANANA JULIES

individualIngredient: each Ocean Spray cranberry juice, chilled
can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed
can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
recipeInstructions: In large punch bowl, mix all ingredients except ginger ale. Chill.  Just before serving, add ginger ale.  Garnish with lemon and orange slices.  Makes 144 ounces.
name: CRANBERRY CITRUS PUNCH
recipeIngredient: 32 oz. each Ocean Spray cranberry juice, chilled
1  12 oz. can frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed
1  6 oz. can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except ginger ale.  Pour over ice cubes.  Add ginger ale just before serving.
name: FRUIT GINGER ALE PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Mix diet white soda and pineapple juice together.  Mix diet Kool-Aid powder and water.  Stir well; add to soda and juice mixture.  Add ice.  Kids love this.
name: FRUIT PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Combine in blender.  Cover and blend until smooth and frothy.
name: ORANGE JULIUS PUNCH

recipeInstructions: In a large punch bowl, mix Kool-Aid, sugar and water.  Add juice and ice.  Put ginger ale in just before serving.
name: PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Mix all juices, soda and water.  Then add last 2 ingredients.
name: SUNSHINE PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Pour all ingredients together.
name: PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Evenly scoop ice cream into 4 tall glasses.  Fill each with orange soda.  Serve with licorice stick as a straw.  Great for Halloween.  Makes 4 servings.
name: ORANGE DREAM SODA
recipeIngredient: 4 black licorice sticks with tips removed

recipeInstructions: Mix first 4 ingredients in blender.  Drop in 1 or 2 ice cubes into mixture.  Chop in blender with speed on mix.  Continue until all ice cubes are crushed.  Serve in tall glass.
name: ORANGE JULIUS
recipeIngredient: 1  6 oz. can frozen orange juice, undiluted

recipeInstructions: Mix together and freeze in an empty ice cream pail.  To serve, place 2 to 3 scoops of slush in glass and fill with 7-Up.
name: PINA COLADA SLUSH
recipeIngredient: 1 qt. bottle Jero pina colada mix

recipeInstructions: Blend pineapple and ice cubes at low speed until ice melts. Add remaining ingredients.  Blend 30 seconds at high speed.
name: PINEAPPLE ORANGE FROST

recipeInstructions: Mix all together; freeze 24 to 48 hours.  To serve, fill glass 1/2 to 3/4 full, then add 7-Up.
name: PINK ELEPHANT SLUSH
recipeIngredient: 3  6 oz. cans frozen pink lemonade concentrate

recipeInstructions: Mix together water, sugar and Jell-O until dissolved.  Then add in lemon juice, pineapple juice and vodka (optional) and freeze. Scoop into cup and add 7-Up or ginger ale before serving.  Makes 1 gallon.
name: RASPBERRY SLUSH

recipeInstructions: In blender container, combine lemon juice, sugar and water. Add ice to make 4 cups.  Blend until smooth.  Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.
name: SLUSHY LEMONADE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. bottled lemon juice from concentrate

individualIngredient: liquor brandy, bourbon, rye whiskey, rum, Scotch
recipeInstructions: In a blender, combine all ingredients.  Blend until smooth. Serve over ice, if desired.  Store, tightly covered, in refrigerator up to one month.  Stir before serving.
name: HOMEMADE IRISH CREME LIQUOR
recipeIngredient: 1 c. liquor brandy, bourbon, rye whiskey, rum, Scotch

recipeInstructions: Microwave butter on High 45 to 60 seconds until melted.  Add cocoa, blend well; beat in sugar, baking powder, salt, eggs and vanilla.  Stir in flour and nuts.  Refrigerate at least 8 hours until firm.

Shape dough into balls (1-inch).  Roll in powdered sugar. Cover microwave plate with wax paper.  Place 8 balls 2 inches apart in circular shape.  Microwave 1 to 2 minutes or until surface of cookies is dry, but cookies are soft to touch.  Cool on wax paper. Sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.
name: MICROWAVE CHOCOLATE CRACKLES

individualIngredient: light corn syrup few grains salt
recipeInstructions: Mix peanuts, sugar, syrup and salt in a glass mixing bowl. Cook 7 to 9 minutes on High; mixture should be bubbling and peanuts browned.  Quickly stir in butter and vanilla.  Cook 2 to 3 minutes longer.  Add baking soda and stir quickly, just until mixture is foamy.  Pour immediately onto greased cookie sheet. Let cool 30 minutes.  Break up peanut brittle and store in an airtight container.
name: MICROWAVE PEANUT BRITTLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. light corn syrup few grains salt

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen Brussels sprouts or broccoli
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except vegetable in a 2-quart glass casserole.  Mix well and cover with glass lid.  Microwave for 30 minutes on High.  Add vegetable and re-cover.  Continue cooking for 8 to 10 minutes on High.  Stir to combine vegetables.  Let stand, covered, 5 minutes before serving.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.
name: MICROWAVE HAM VEGETABLE BAKE
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. pkg. frozen Brussels sprouts or broccoli

recipeInstructions: In a 1-quart glass casserole, combine all ingredients.  Heat, uncovered, in microwave on High for 6 minutes.  Rotate.  Heat for 3 minutes.  Stir.  Heat for 1 1/2 minutes.  Stir.  Heat for last 1 1/2 minutes and stir.  Place in desired bowls; cool and serve.
name: MICROWAVE RICE PUDDING
recipeIngredient: 1  3 oz. pkg. vanilla pudding not instant

recipeInstructions: Let cheese and butter sit at room temperature until soft. Blend together with mixer.  Add other ingredients, one at a time, mixing each thoroughly.  Eventually you may have to mix by hand as it gets too stiff for the beater.  Spread into 9 x 13-inch buttered pan.  Keep in refrigerator.
name: CHEESE FUDGE

recipeInstructions: Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl, then add eggs and shortening.  Mix well.  Add walnuts.  Pour into pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
name: FUDGE SQUARE

individualIngredient: marshmallow cream real milk chocolate, grated about
recipeInstructions: Combine butter, milk and sugar.  Boil 5 1/2 minutes.  Remove from heat; add all remaining ingredients except walnuts.  Stir until mixed well.  Add nuts.  Pour into buttered 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan.  Makes about 5 pounds.
name: FUDGE
recipeIngredient: 1 c. marshmallow cream real milk chocolate, grated about

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, butter and evaporated milk in kettle and bring to a boil.  Boil 7 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and add remaining items.  Put in 9 x 12-inch pan and cool.
name: MILLION DOLLAR FUDGE

individualIngredient: white Karo syrup few grains salt
recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, syrup and salt together to 245° (candy thermometer) or until mixture is very thick.  Add butter until melts.  Add milk gradually to mixture, keeping mixture boiling at all times.  Stir constantly.  Cook rapidly to 242° or until a few drops form a firm ball when dropped in cold water.  The mixture will be very thick and sticks easily.  Remove from heat.  Add vanilla and pour into greased 9-inch square pan.  Cool thoroughly before cutting.  Wrap each piece in waxed paper.  Makes 7 dozen pieces.
name: CARAMELS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. white Karo syrup few grains salt
2 c. whipping cream do not whip

recipeInstructions: Boil first 3 ingredients until syrup cracks when dropped from teaspoon in cold water (about 262° on candy thermometer).  Pour slowly into beaten egg whites and beat until desired firmness. You will have to beat the last with a spoon.  Drop by spoonfuls on wax paper.  Flavorings or nuts may be added during the final beating.
name: SEAFOAM

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar and corn syrup well.  Microwave on High for 4 minutes.  Mix in peanuts and microwave on High for 3 1/2 minutes. Mix in vanilla and butter; microwave on High for 1 1/2 minutes. Mix in baking soda until foamy.  Quickly spread onto a buttered cookie sheet.
name: PEANUT BRITTLE

recipeInstructions: Butter baking sheet.  Melt butter in a 2-quart saucepan over low heat.  Add sugar; heat to boiling, stirring constantly.  Stir in water and corn syrup.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, to 290° on candy thermometer.

Remove from heat; stir in nuts.  Pour candy mixture onto baking sheet and spread about 1/4-inch thick.  As crunch cools, loosen from baking sheet 2 or 3 times with spatula.  Melt chocolate pieces over hot water.  Spread half the chocolate over cooled crunch. When firm, turn crunch and spread with chocolate.  When firm, break into pieces.  Store in tightly covered container in cool place.
name: BUTTER CRUNCH

recipeInstructions: Mash cream cheese.  Add powdered sugar gradually until the candy mixture becomes like stiff pie dough, approximately 3 1/4 cups.  Add desired flavorings like mint or peppermint and any colors.  Roll in granulated sugar, put on wax paper and flatten with a fork.
name: CREAM CHEESE CANDY MINTS
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. powdered sugar flavorings and colorings

recipeInstructions: Place 2 pecan halves and a date half in clusters on a lightly buttered baking sheet.  Melt caramels in saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth.  Spoon caramel mixture over each cluster, leaving ends of pecans uncovered.  Let stand until set, about 30 minutes.  Spread chocolate over caramel.  Makes about 2 dozen.
name: CHEWY CHOCOLATES

recipeInstructions: Line 18 mini muffin cups with double thickness paper cups. Set aside.  Melt chips with shortening in heavy, small saucepan over very low heat, stirring constantly.

Spoon 1/2 of chocolate mixture into each cup.  Spoon 1 tablespoon of marshmallow cream into each chocolate cup (using spoon dipped into hot water).  Spread with small spatula.  Spoon about 1/2 tablespoon of remaining chocolate over each marshmallow cup.  Refrigerate until firm.  Makes 18 cups.
name: MARSHMALLOW CUPS

individualIngredient: anise extract few gtts food coloring of your choice
recipeInstructions: Use candy thermometer.
Mix first 3 ingredients and boil to 300°.  Add anise and food coloring.  Pour on buttered cookie sheet.  Crack when completely cooled.
name: ANISE CANDY
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. anise extract few gtts food coloring of your choice

recipeInstructions: Heat margarine in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat until melted.  Stir in sugar.  Stir frequently with wooden spoon, 4 to 5 minutes while mixture melts and begins to turn a golden color. Continue cooking 1 to 2 minutes longer, stirring constantly.  (Do not overcook; mixture will go from granular to smooth and margarine and sugar may begin to separate.)  Remove from heat.  Quickly add cereal and mix until coated; immediately spread on cookie sheet. Cool.  Break into bite-size pieces.
name: CARAMEL CLUSTER

recipeInstructions: Mix and cook everything except popcorn.  Cook on medium heat until mixture bubbles on edge.  Cook for 5 minutes longer.  Take off heat.  Stir in 1/2 teaspoon baking soda.  Mixture will foam. Put popcorn in roasting pan.  Pour mixture over popcorn.  Mix well.  Bake in oven at 200° for 1 hour; mix every 15 minutes.
name: CARAMEL POPCORN

recipeInstructions: Rinse seeds well and for each 2 cups of seeds, place in a saucepan with 1 quart of water and about 2 tablespoons of salt (most of salt will be discarded later).  Simmer for 10 minutes; drain well and pat dry on paper toweling.  Preheat oven to 350°. Toss seeds with 1 tablespoon melted butter in bowl until seeds are evenly coated.  Spread out on cookie sheet with sides.  Bake for 30 minutes, tossing occasionally until crisp and golden brown.  Cool and store in an airtight container.
name: ROASTED PUMPKIN SEEDS

individualIngredient: pkg. instant pudding mix any flavor
recipeInstructions: Beat all ingredients together with electric mixer for 2 minutes.  Pour into popsicle molds.  Insert sticks or straws. Freeze solid.
name: PUDDING POPS
recipeIngredient: 1 small pkg. instant pudding mix any flavor

individualIngredient: tomato soup mix or cream of chicken soup mix
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together and coat chicken.  Oven bake or deep fry.
name: CHICKEN BREADING
recipeIngredient: 2 envelopes tomato soup mix or cream of chicken soup mix

recipeInstructions: Mix dry ingredients well and cut in shortening until crumbly. Store in airtight container.
name: HERBED BREAD COATING

recipeInstructions: Beat well all ingredients.  Can use with fish, chicken, shrimp, etc.  Deep fry.
name: BEER BATTER
