individualIngredient: pkg. cream cheese, cubed and softened
recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients into blender and process on grind until smooth.  Spread on bread or crackers.
name: DRIED BEEF SANDWICH FILLING
recipeIngredient: 1  3 oz. pkg. cream cheese, cubed and softened

recipeInstructions: Mix rhubarb and sugar.  Let stand until it makes its own juice.  Then boil 10 minutes.  Add 2 small packages jello and pie filling.  Heat again and put in jars.  Let cool and freeze in glass jam jars or small plastic containers.  Will keep in refrigerator up to 3 weeks.
name: RHUBARB-CHERRY JAM
recipeIngredient: 7 c. finely chopped or cut rhubarb
1 can cherry pie filling cut cherries

recipeInstructions: Melt oleo, chocolate chips and peanut butter together.  Put cereal into a large bowl.  Pour mixture over cereal and mix well. Pour some powdered sugar in the bottom of a double grocery bag. Add some of the cereal mixture, then more powdered sugar and shake well.  Keep alternating until all are added.
name: HUMAN PUPPY CHOW

recipeInstructions: Melt butter in large roaster pan.  Pour in all remaining ingredients.  Mix well.  Set oven at 200°.  Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.  Store in tightly covered container.
name: NUTS AND BOLTS

recipeInstructions: Beat egg whites with dash of salt until stiff.  Gradually add sugar.  Mash cranberries with fork.  Whip the cream.  Add flavoring.  Fold all together.  Pour in dish.  Cover.  Put in freezer.  Take out of freezer 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
name: CRANBERRY MOUSSE

recipeInstructions: Melt chocolate in bowl.  Whip egg whites until stiff.  Add sugar to yolks.  Add chocolate to sugar and yolks.  Fold in egg whites slowly.
name: CHOCOLATE MOUSSE

recipeInstructions: They keep longer if you store them in the refrigerator in paper bags.  Do not remove the outside leaves until ready to use.
Line the bottom of the vegetable compartment with paper toweling.  This absorbs the excess moisture and keeps all vegetables and fruits fresher for a longer period of time.
name: BEST EVER PLAY DOUGH

recipeInstructions: Pour in drain.  After fizzing stops, follow with lots of boiling water.  For grease in sinks, use 1 cup salt and 1 cup baking soda, followed by boiling water.
name: UNPLUG DRAIN

recipeInstructions: Soak the garment in warm vinegar and water.
name: MILDEW ON SHOWER CURTAIN

recipeInstructions: Mix in a bucket of warm water.
name: WINDOW CLEANER

recipeInstructions: Clogged Shower Heads:  If your shower head is clogged, try boiling it in 1/2 cup vinegar and 1 quart water for 15 minutes.
For plastic shower heads, soak in equal amounts of hot vinegar and water.
Glass Shower Doors:  For a quick shine, rub with a sponge dampened in white vinegar.
Sweet Smells:  Place a fabric softener sheet in the waste paper basket.
Add your favorite perfume on a light bulb.  The heat releases the aroma.
name: ANT KILLER

recipeInstructions: Mix Bisquick, milk and margarine.  Roll out about 1/4-inch thick.  Spread on softened sausage.  Roll up. Put in freezer until firm but not frozen.  Slice and bake at 350° until light brown.
name: SAUSAGE SWIRLS

recipeInstructions: Heat soup with both cheeses until cheese is melted and add shrimp.  Serve with chips or crackers.
name: SHRIMP DIP

recipeInstructions: Mix ingredients and chill.  Great on fresh mushrooms especially.
name: DILL DIP

individualIngredient: dry mustard chopped pecans to garnish
recipeInstructions: Form ingredients into a ball.  Chill; roll in chopped pecans. Refrigerate until serving.
name: HAM CHEESE BALL
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. dry mustard chopped pecans to garnish

recipeInstructions: Drain artichoke hearts well.  Separate hearts and place in casserole dish.  Cube cheese, mix with mayonnaise and cover the artichoke with the mixture.  Bake in 350° oven for 1/2 hour or until brown.  Serve with crackers.
name: ARTICHOKE DIP

individualIngredient: green onions tops and bottoms , chopped
frozen, chopped spinach, thawed and drained do not cook
Worcestershire sauce dash of Tabasco or to taste salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Saute the onions and the garlic in butter or margarine until onions are soft.  Combine all other ingredients except Tabasco, salt and pepper; mix well.  Add to the onion mixture and heat slowly, stirring frequently, until mixture is hot.  Season to taste.  Pour into a chafing dish and serve with assorted crackers. Yields 3 cups.
name: HOT SHRIMP AND SPINACH DIP
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. green onions tops and bottoms , chopped
1 pkg. frozen, chopped spinach, thawed and drained do not cook
1  3 oz. can mushrooms pieces and stems
1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce dash of Tabasco or to taste salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Have cheeses at room temperature.  Mix cheeses, onion, Worcestershire sauce and m.s.g. together until thoroughly blended. Add 1/2 cup pecans and 1/4 cup parsley.  Shape the mixture into a ball.  Place in a bowl lined with waxed paper or foil and chill overnight.  About 1 hour before serving, roll the ball in a mixture of the remaining pecans and parsley.  Place on patter and surround with crisp crackers.
name: HOLIDAY CHEESE BALL
recipeIngredient: 2  5 oz. jars processed Cheddar cheese spread

recipeInstructions: Cut tortillas, several at a time, into 8 pie shaped wedges using kitchen shears.  Arrange in a single layer on cookie sheet. Bake at 350° until crisp and slightly browned (10 minutes).  Store in an airtight container.  Makes about 4 cups.
name: BAKED CORN CHIPS

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°. Split each pita bread into 2 round pieces (whole wheat pita bread has more fiber).  Cut each half into 6 triangles with kitchen scissors.  Arrange in a single layer on cookie sheet.  Sprinkle lightly with garlic powder, if desired. Bake for 8 minutes until chips are lightly browned and very crisp.  Store in an airtight container.
Makes about 8 cups.
name: PITA CHIPS

recipeInstructions: Pour crackers into large baking dish or roasting pan.  Whisk together oil, dry dressing mix and spices.  Pour over crackers, stirring well to coat all of the crackers.  Bake at 275° for 20 minutes, stirring once.  Cool on newspaper or paper toweling. Keeps for weeks if airtight.
name: HIDDEN VALLEY RANCH CRACKERS

individualIngredient: salt dash of cayenne caraway seed
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients; shape into long roll.  Wrap in wax paper and refrigerate until hard.  Slice 1/4-inch and place fairly far apart on cookie sheet.  Sprinkle a few caraway seeds in center of each wafer.  Bake 10 minutes at 400°.  Serve hot or cold. Makes 150 to 170.
name: CHEESE WAFERS
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. salt dash of cayenne caraway seed

recipeInstructions: Combine chilies, tomato sauce and onions and seasonings in a saucepan and cook until onions are tender.  Add beans and simmer until warmed through.  Serve either hot or cold.  Makes about 4 cups.
name: BEAN DIP

recipeInstructions: Drain artichokes and chop.  Mix all ingredients and microwave 3 minutes.  Mix and serve with crackers.
name: ARTICHOKE DIP

recipeInstructions: Heat soup with both cheeses until cheese is melted and add shrimp.  Serve with chips or crackers.
name: SHRIMP DIP

recipeInstructions: Mix and enjoy.
name: SHIRLEY'S MEAN BEAN DIP

individualIngredient: can Bush's black-eyed peas with a jalapenos
recipeInstructions: Put first 10 items together in a pan.  Cook over low heat until a boil.  Put next 7 items with first 10 items; simmer 30 minutes. Thicken after the 30 minutes of simmering by adding 1/4 cup bacon drippings and 3 tablespoons flour.  So hot!
name: "BLACK-EYED PEA" DIP
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. can Bush's black-eyed peas with a jalapenos

individualIngredient: rum extract optional fresh apple slices
recipeInstructions: In 2-quart pan, melt caramels and butter over low heat, stirring occasionally until caramels are melted (12 to 15 minutes).  Stir in nuts, milk and rum.
Stir vigorously to incorporate butter.  Keep warm; use as dip for fresh fruit.
name: CARAMEL APPLE DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. rum extract optional fresh apple slices

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients.  Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.  Good with all vegetables.
name: TANGY VEGETABLE DIP

recipeInstructions: Squeeze spinach until dry.  In medium bowl, stir together spinach, sour cream, mayonnaise, soup mix, water chestnuts and green onions.  Cover; refrigerate 2 hours.
If desired, serve with pumpernickel bread or crackers.  Makes 3 cups.
name: CLASSIC SPINACH DIP
recipeIngredient: 1  10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed
1  8 oz. can water chestnuts, finely chopped

recipeInstructions: Cook sausage; drain and crumble.  Add remaining ingredients, mixing well.  Serve with Doritos or tostadas.
name: HOT CHEESE AND SAUSAGE DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. Good Seasons salad dressing mix

individualIngredient: pkg. chipped beef dash of Worcestershire
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients except bread.  Slice off top of bread and carefully hollow out.  (Make sure there are no weak places in bread shell.)  Fill bread shell with beef mixture and put top back on.  Wrap in foil and bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.  Use soft bread from interior of loaf to dip in hot mixture.
name: SOURDOUGH - BEEF DIP
recipeIngredient: 4 oz. pkg. chipped beef dash of Worcestershire

recipeInstructions: Blend together and serve with sliced apples.  Strawberries are good as well.
name: FRUIT DIP

recipeInstructions: Mix and serve with fresh jicama slices or broccoli flowerets
name: CURRY DIP

recipeInstructions: Set aside 3 orange sections for garnish.  Chop remaining orange sections; set aside.  Stir together cream cheese, coconut and almonds until smooth.  Fold in chopped oranges.   Arrange reserved orange sections on top.  Chill.  Serve spread with assorted fruit breads and muffins.
name: AMBROSIA SPREAD
recipeIngredient: 8 oz. soft cream cheese with pineapple
1/4 c. slivered almonds, chopped and toasted

recipeInstructions: Beat cream cheese and Marshmallow Creme at medium speed with electric mixer until well blended.  Serve with fresh fruit.  Makes about 1 1/2 cups (12 servings at 2 tablespoons each).
Variation:  Add 1 tablespoon orange juice and 1 teaspoon grated orange peel to mixture.
Nutrition Information Per Serving:  120 calories, 1 gram protein, 14 grams carbohydrate, 7 grams fat, 20 miligrams cholesterol, 70 miligrams sodium.
name: MALLOW FRUIT DIP

recipeInstructions: Pull all in blender.  Refrigerate for 30 minutes.  Pass "Toppers" to be put on top of "soup."  A real great hot weather meal.
name: GAZPACHO
recipeIngredient: 3 Tbsp. Wesson oil or olive oil

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients and put in jars; seal.
name: BEET RELISH

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  In a bowl, mix cumin, chili powder, curry powder, garlic salt, cayenne pepper, ginger and cinnamon. Set aside.  Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over low heat.  Add spice mixture and mix well.  Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes.  Place nuts in a bowl.  Scrape spice mixture onto nuts and toss well. Spread nuts in one layer on a baking sheet.  Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. If desired, sprinkle with salt.  Cool for 2 hours. Store in airtight container.
name: SPICED HOLIDAY NUTS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. shelled whole almonds or pecans

recipeInstructions: Drain crab meat.  Blend softened cream cheese, chives, garlic powder and salt.  Fold in crab meat.  Shape into ball.  Roll in pecans.
name: CRAB BALL

individualIngredient: pkg. cream cheese chopped ripe olives green onions, chopped green chilies
recipeInstructions: May add anything you'd like.

Mix the cream cheese, olives, onions and green chilies together.  Spread thinly over tortillas, then roll the tortillas up tightly.  Refrigerate in plastic bag.  Before serving, slice in bite size pieces.  Serve with salsa for dipping.
name: TORTILLA ROLL-UPS
recipeIngredient: 1 large pkg. cream cheese chopped ripe olives green onions, chopped green chilies

individualIngredient: onions, chopped finely garlic salt to taste
recipeInstructions: Put approximately 1 tablespoon on each tortilla and spread it over tortilla.  Roll up and wrap in foil.  Refrigerate and slice just before serving.
name: CHILI PINWHEELS
recipeIngredient: 6 green onions, chopped finely garlic salt to taste

recipeInstructions: Brown sausage; drain and set aside.  Mix eggs with cottage cheese, chives, pepper and Parmesan cheese.  Set aside.  Divide each roll into 8 sections.  Thinly roll each section and press into greased miniature muffin tin cups.  Sprinkle each cup with sausage and top with egg mixture.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until light brown.
name: SAUSAGE BITES

recipeInstructions: Combine cheese, sour cream and butter; beat until smooth. Stir in chiles and pimiento.  Spread on fresh flour tortillas. Top with another flour tortilla to make sandwich.  Cut in wedges and serve with salsa or guacamole.   Makes 2 cups.
name: MEXICAN CHEESE WEDGES

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes.  Cool and enjoy.  (When storing, keep cloves with beets in juice to keep flavor.  Lasts forever!)
name: PICKLED BEETS

individualIngredient: bulk Italian sausage we prefer hot
can tomato paste can tomato sauce use small can if you like thick sauce, a large can for thinner sauce
recipeInstructions: Brown sausage, onion, green pepper and garlic; drain.  Add remaining ingredients.  Simmer uncovered 20 minutes.
name: SPAGHETTI SAUCE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. bulk Italian sausage we prefer hot
6 oz. can tomato paste can tomato sauce use small can if you like thick sauce, a large can for thinner sauce

recipeInstructions: Boil carrots, celery and green onions in water for 5 minutes. Saute white onion in margarine.  Add flour and broth.  Stir briskly into white onion mixture with a wire whisk.  Add Cheez Whiz, cayenne, salt and pepper (to taste).  Stir in mustard and the boiled vegetables including the water in which they were cooked.  Bring to a boil and serve immediately.  Serves 8.
name: CHEDDAR CHEESE SOUP

individualIngredient: cans ready to serve, no-salt added chicken broth*
shredded reduced fat Monterey Jack cheese
recipeInstructions: Sort and wash beans; place in a Dutch oven.  Cover with water 2-inches above beans; let soak 8 hours.  Drain beans and return to Dutch oven.  Add broth and next 4 ingredients. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally.  Add chicken and next 5 ingredients; cover and cook 30 minutes.  Spoon into serving bowls; top each with cheese (6 servings).
*Instead of buying canned broth, I stew the chicken with onion, carrot, bay leaf and chicken bouillon, then strain and use the amount of broth required.
name: WHITE CHILI
recipeIngredient: 3  10 1/2 oz. cans ready to serve, no-salt added chicken broth*
3/4 c. shredded reduced fat Monterey Jack cheese

recipeInstructions: Crust:  Mix pretzels, oleo and 2 tablespoons sugar; place in 9 x 13-inch pan and bake for 10 minutes at 400°.
Filling:  Mix cream cheese, Cool Whip and 1 cup sugar.  After mixing well, spread over crust that has cooled for 10 minutes. Let this set 10 minutes.
Topping:  Mix jello with boiling water. After mixing well, mix in frozen strawberries.  Spread on top of filling.  Chill 10 hours before serving.
name: PRETZEL SALAD

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.  Cover and chill.
name: FRUIT SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix pretzels, margarine and sugar together and place in 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake for 10 minutes at 350°.  Cool completely.  In separate bowl, mix together Cool Whip and Philly cheese.  Place this mixture on top of cooled pretzel mixture.  Pour can of pie filling on top and cover with shredded cheese.  Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.
name: PRETZEL SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 can pineapple pie filling shredded cheese

recipeInstructions: Dissolve gelatin in 1 cup hot water.  Add pineapple, apple and nuts.  Mix together cottage cheese, salad dressing and cream.  Add this to gelatin mixture.  Let set in refrigerator.  Apples will come to the top.
name: APPLE LIME GELATIN SALAD

individualIngredient: can crushed pineapple, drained, reserve juice
recipeInstructions: Dissolve jello in boiling water.  Add enough water to reserved fruit juices to make 1 1/2 cups and mix with gelatin.  Stir in blueberries and pineapple.  Pour into a 1-quart dish and chill until firm.  Blend cream cheese, sugar, sour cream and vanilla. Spread over congealed salad and sprinkle with pecans.
name: BLUEBERRY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  15 oz. can blueberries, drained, reserve juice
1  8 oz. can crushed pineapple, drained, reserve juice

recipeInstructions: Sift dry Jell-O on cottage cheese and stir.  Add fruit.  Mix in Cool Whip.  Chill overnight.
name: COTTAGE CHEESE SALAD

individualIngredient: stew meat I use beef tips salt and pepper to taste carrots onions celery
recipeInstructions: Place the stew meat into stew pan and season.  Add carrots, onions and celery (the amount you desire).  Pour chicken soup and water over all the ingredients.
Cover and cook 3 hours at 300°.  You may stir occasionally, but not necessary.
name: JEAN RAINONE'S OVEN STEW
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 lb. stew meat I use beef tips salt and pepper to taste carrots onions celery

individualIngredient: bag frozen Green Giant mixed vegetables
recipeInstructions: Cut beef into 1-inch or smaller cubes.  In a Dutch oven, add water, beef and bouillon.  Boil until beef is almost tender.  Add onions and potatoes; simmer 30 minutes.  Add spices and bag of vegetables and simmer until they are tender.  (Keep adding water to retain original water level.)  Serves 4 to 6.
name: BEEF STEW
recipeIngredient: 1 poly bag frozen Green Giant mixed vegetables

recipeInstructions: Saute celery and onion in melted butter.  Add chicken broth and simmer 15 minutes.  Stir in milk and seasonings; allow to heat.  Thicken by adding 3 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 6 tablespoons water.  Top with freshly chopped parsley.  Serves approximately 6.
name: CREAM OF CELERY SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. celery seed pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Heat to boil.  Thicken with cornstarch and water.
name: CHEESE BROCCOLI SOUP

recipeInstructions: Brown hamburger with onion.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix and simmer 5 hours in crock-pot or 2 hours on stove top.
name: HAMBURGER AND VEGETABLE SOUP

recipeInstructions: Mix beans and tomatoes in a large pot.  Add broth, spinach and orzo.  Bring to a boil, stirring to break up spinach.  Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until orzo is tender.  Makes 10 cups.
name: MINESTRONE
recipeIngredient: 16 oz. can cannellini white kidney beans

recipeInstructions: Mix all together and bring to a boil.  Let simmer until flavors blend.  This is delicious and will serve 8.
name: ZESTY SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 can Campbell's cream of potato with
1 can Campbell's French onion not diluted

individualIngredient: cooked chicken, cut in bite size pieces
curry powder fresh ground pepper to taste
lo-cal mayonnaise, thinned with skim milk
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients very lightly, reserving grapes for topping.  Chill several hours or overnight.  Serves 10 to 12.
*Cook rice in water flavored with 2 teaspoons instant powdered chicken bouillon.
Serve with salad greens.
name: DICK VAN HOLLAND'S FAVORITE CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 c. cooked chicken, cut in bite size pieces
3/4 tsp. curry powder fresh ground pepper to taste
1 1/4 c. lo-cal mayonnaise, thinned with skim milk

individualIngredient: balsamic vinegar or red wine vinegar
recipeInstructions: Combine first five ingredients.  Make a dressing with vinegar, oil, salt and pepper.  Combine and chill in refrigerator or serve at room temperature.
name: GREEK DELIGHT
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. balsamic vinegar or red wine vinegar
6 Tbsp. olive oil salt and pepper

individualIngredient: sugar chopped green onion salt and pepper
recipeInstructions: Cool and peel the potatoes.  Layer potatoes, sprinkle with chopped green onion tops, salt and pepper to taste.  Make a sauce of the mayonnaise, oil, vinegar and sugar.  Dot sauce around and repeat layers.
name: POTATO SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. sugar chopped green onion salt and pepper

recipeInstructions: Boil potatoes carefully so as not to split or crumble them. Cool slightly and cut into quarters.  Do not peel.  Pour wine over potatoes and toss gently.  Mix vinegar, oil, herbs and spices. Pour over potatoes and season.  Serve with still warm or chill. Makes 6 cups.
name: POTATO SALAD VINAIGRETTE

individualIngredient: jar real mayonnaise salt and pepper dash of garlic
recipeInstructions: Boil macaroni; drain and cool.  Mix with first five ingredients.  Blend mayonnaise with milk to a creamy sauce.   Add other ingredients.  Mix and refrigerate.  Chill for a day or two.
name: SEAFOOD SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 small jar real mayonnaise salt and pepper dash of garlic

recipeInstructions: Cut up and combine vegetables.  Mix mayonnaise, vinegar, salad oil and sugar; pour over vegetables.  Marinate for 24 hours in refrigerator.  Serve cold.
name: MARINATED VEGETABLES

recipeInstructions: Drain all canned vegetables.  Mix all vegetables together.  Heat sugar, oil, salt and vinegar until sugar has melted.  Pour over vegetables.  Chill thoroughly.
name: SHOE PEG CORN-VEGETABLE SALAD

individualIngredient: new potatoes big , cool and peel
recipeInstructions: Layer boiled potatoes; sprinkle with chopped green onion tops. Salt and pepper to taste, then dot sauce around; repeat layers.
name: POTATO SALAD
recipeIngredient: 8 boiled new potatoes big , cool and peel

recipeInstructions: Mix mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar.  Mix all at least 2 hours before serving and refrigerate.
name: BROCCOLI SALAD

recipeInstructions: Toss mushrooms with salad dressing.  Set aside.  Remove stems from spinach; wash leaves thoroughly and pat dry.  Tear into bite size pieces.  Combine spinach, mushrooms, raisins and pecans in a bowl.  Toss gently.  Grate egg over salad.  Serves 4.
name: SPINACH PECAN SALAD

recipeInstructions: In a 2-quart casserole or larger, layer the ingredients twice in this order:  cornbread, beans, vegetables and bacon.  Top with cheese.  Mix sour cream and salsa together and spread over entire top of dish so no air holes are showing.  Cover and chill 2 to 3 hours.
name: LOUISIANA CORNBREAD SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. cornbread mix, cooked and crumbled

recipeInstructions: Layer ingredients in recipe order, topping with Parmesan cheese.  In separate bowl, mix mayonnaise with sugar and pour on top of layered salad.  Do not mix together.  Refrigerate overnight.  Just before serving, mix together.
name: CAULIFLOWER SALAD

individualIngredient: onion, thinly sliced and separated into rings I use purple onion
recipeInstructions: Trim coarse stem ends and leaves from broccoli.  Wash and cut lengthwise into 1/2 to 3/4-inch thick strips.  Toss onion and pimento with broccoli.  Set aside.  Combine sugar, salt, pepper, oil, vinegar and garlic.  Mix thoroughly and pour over broccoli and onion mixture.  Marinate overnight, stirring occasionally. Drain.
name: MARINATED BROCCOLI
recipeIngredient: 1 medium onion, thinly sliced and separated into rings I use purple onion
3/4 c. red wine vinegar with garlic

individualIngredient: vermicelli, cook and blanch as directed
recipeInstructions: Marinate vermicelli overnight in Accent, lemon juice and oil. Next day, add celery, onions, peppers, pimento and black olives. Toss with mayonnaise and salt.
name: VERMICELLI SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 pkg. vermicelli, cook and blanch as directed

recipeInstructions: Dressing:  In large bowl, whisk all ingredients.  Add remaining ingredients to dressing; toss.  Serves 8.  Calories: 35 each.
name: JICAMA SLAW

recipeInstructions: Combine rice, celery, green pepper, onion, thyme, pepper, garlic salt, turkey ham, shrimp and tomato.  Fold in salad dressing until all ingredients are well moistened.  Cover and chill.  Add crumbled bacon and toss just before serving.  Serves 4 to 6.
name: JAMBALAYA SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate overnight.
name: MACARONI SALAD

recipeInstructions: Put in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch dish in the order given.  Cover tightly and chill at least 10 hours.  It is very pretty in a clear glass bowl.
name: TASTY GREEN SALAD

recipeInstructions: Combine everything but the bread crumbs.  Put in greased casserole.  Top with bread crumbs.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.
name: ARLEEN'S HOT CHICKEN SALAD

recipeInstructions: Mix together.
Mix dressing together and toss gently with salad until coated.
Optional: 1/4 cup crumbled Bleu cheese on top.
name: CURRIED CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  11 oz. can mandarin oranges green grapes

recipeInstructions: Cover breast with cold water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil.  Remove from heat.  Cover and let stand 1 hour.  Drain, skin and bone.  Cut into 1/2-inch cubes.  Blend mayonnaise and sour cream in medium bowl.  Stir in curry powder.  Mix in chicken, pineapple and walnuts.  Season with salt.  Chill until ready to serve.  Serves 2.
name: FESTIVE CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. pineapple chunks salt to taste

recipeInstructions: In large bowl, mix all ingredients.  Toss with the Italian dressing which has been made according to package directions.
Be sure tomatoes are very well drained.  Don't thaw or cook peas, just run under hot water.
Refrigerate overnight.
name: CHICKEN PASTA SALAD

recipeInstructions: In a skillet, using medium heat, melt the butter.  Add the flour and stirring constantly, cook the flour until it bubbles and becomes thick and smooth (approximately 5 minutes).
Add the milk and salt, and stirring constantly, cook until white sauce thickens approximately 5 minutes.
name: BASIC WHITE SAUCE

individualIngredient: large salad fruits with juice apples bananas nuts
recipeInstructions: Combine pie filling and can of fruit.  Mix in other fruits and nuts.  Keeps well in refrigerator for several days.  Almost eliminates dessert!!!
name: FAST AND FRUITY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 can large salad fruits with juice apples bananas nuts

individualIngredient: red and green grapes, cut in half
pecans, chopped oranges to taste apples to taste cherries to taste
recipeInstructions: Melt butter on low; add flour and mix well.  Add milk and cook until thick (make white sauce).  Pour in marshmallows and stir until melted.  Fold in remaining ingredients.  Will keep three days.  Makes 10 to 12 servings.
name: ANNA'S GREEN GRAPE SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. red and green grapes, cut in half
1 c. pecans, chopped oranges to taste apples to taste cherries to taste

individualIngredient: strawberries purple onion, thinly sliced optional
recipeInstructions: Shake dressing ingredients and chill, stirring occasionally. Pour over spinach before serving.
name: SPINACH STRAWBERRY SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 pt. strawberries purple onion, thinly sliced optional

individualIngredient: container Philly soft cream cheese with strawberries
each: blueberries, raspberries and sliced strawberries
recipeInstructions: Beat cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, milk and extract with mixer until well blended.  Refrigerate.  Spoon over fruit.  Makes 8 servings.
This salad is also wonderful with any unflavored variety of Philly or Philly soft cream cheese with pineapple.  Spoon over any fruit you like!
name: BERRY FRUIT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1   8 oz. container Philly soft cream cheese with strawberries
2 c. each: blueberries, raspberries and sliced strawberries

recipeInstructions: Mix mayonnaise 1/4 teaspoon curry and artichoke liquid.  Mix with other ingredients.  Refrigerate.  Best served next day.
name: ARTICHOKE CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 box chicken Rice-a-Roni, prepare as directed
1 jar marinated artichokes, chop, reserve liquid

recipeInstructions: Chop the cranberries in chopper or blender; coarse.  Add sugar and let sit in refrigerator overnight.  Add marshmallows, pineapple and pecans.  Whip the whipping cream and stir into mixture. Refrigerate until time to serve.  Serves a million and three people.  Keeps well for 2 or 3 days.  Excellent with any kind of meat dish.
name: CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD

individualIngredient: bacon, fried crisp Lawry's season salt to taste salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Put eggs through an egg slicer, then chop the slices up thoroughly.  Mix the chopped egg with the mayonnaise, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, Lawry's and salt and pepper.   Crumble the bacon into medium-sized bits and mix with other ingredients. Refrigerate and allow to sit for about 4 hours for flavors to blend well.  Serves 4.
name: EGG SALAD
recipeIngredient: 8 pieces bacon, fried crisp Lawry's season salt to taste salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: or pkg. dry onion soup mix
recipeInstructions: With hands lightly shape chuck into 1-inch balls.  In hot butter in a 6-quart pan.  Saute meatballs, turning until browned all over.  Drain off fat.  Add remaining ingredients and bring just to boiling.  Reduce heat and simmer covered 45 minutes, stirring occasionally to break up tomatoes.  Serve very hot.  Is better the second day.  Serves 6.
name: HEARTY MEATBALL SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 can or pkg. dry onion soup mix

individualIngredient: red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and deribbed
yellow onions, peeled and cut into
cider vinegar fresh ground black pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Finely chop pepper, onion and garlic in the food processor. Scrape into a 13 x 10 x 2-inch oval dish and stir in tomatoes, breaking up any whole tomatoes.  Cover tightly with microwave plastic wrap.  Cook at 100% for 9 minutes in a 650 to 700-watt oven. Prick plastic to release steam.

Remove from oven.  Uncover carefully and stir in beef and remaining ingredients except vinegar and black pepper.  Cover tightly with microwave plastic wrap.  Cook at 100% for 5 minutes. Prick plastic.
Remove from oven and uncover.  Stir in vinegar and pepper to taste.  Stir well, breaking up any large chunks of beef.   Serve over baked potatoes or rice.
name: SKINNY CHILI
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. red bell pepper, stemmed, seeded and deribbed
1/2 lb. yellow onions, peeled and cut into
2 c. canned Italian tomatoes with liquid
2 tsp. cider vinegar fresh ground black pepper to taste

individualIngredient: white wine vinegar salt, freshly ground white pepper
recipeInstructions: Cook potatoes with skins in boiling water in small pan until tender.  Drain; peel if desired, and dice into bite size pieces. Place in serving bowl along with capers and olives.
Stir together in small bowl mustard, olive oil and vinegar; season to taste with salt and pepper.  Pour dressing over potato mixture and stir gently but well.  Serve hot or tepid.  Makes 2 servings.
name: POTATO AND OLIVE SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. white wine vinegar salt, freshly ground white pepper

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and shake well.  Let set 24 hours before serving.  No refrigeration needed.  (If you don't have an oil and vinegar shaker a sterilized pint size milk jug works well.)
name: OIL AND VINEGAR DRESSING

recipeInstructions: Combine jello and hot water.  Let partially jell.  Boil pineapple and sugar for 5 minutes.  (Use juice; do not drain pineapple.)  Let cool.  Add Cool Whip, nuts and cheese to pineapple mixture.  Add this to thickened jello; fold in and refrigerate. Top with additional cheese and chopped nuts.
name: PINEAPPLE AND CHEESE SALAD

individualIngredient: can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
avocados, peeled and chopped shredded lettuce
recipeInstructions: Combine first 11 ingredients stirring well; cover and chill. At serving time, add avocado if desired.
Arrange lettuce on 8 individual serving plates; spoon about 1 cup chicken mixture onto each.  Top with chopped tomato and chips. Yields 8 servings.
name: MEXICAN CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1  4 oz. can chopped green chilies, chopped
2 medium avocados, peeled and chopped shredded lettuce

individualIngredient: chicken flavor Rice-A-Roni, cook according to directions
more whole chicken breasts, boned and chopped
recipeInstructions: Mix all and refrigerate overnight.  Serves 10 to 12.
name: ARTICHOKE CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 box chicken flavor Rice-A-Roni, cook according to directions
1  6 oz. jar marinated artichoke hearts, chopped
5 or more whole chicken breasts, boned and chopped

recipeInstructions: Cut meat into 1 1/2-inch cubes.  Place meat and vegetables in 11 x 7 x 1 1/2-inch pan.  Sprinkle with seasonings.  Add tomato juice.  Cover with foil, sealing edges tightly.  Bake at 250° for 4 hours.
name: LEAN BEEF STEW

individualIngredient: can peeled whole tomatoes or chopped tomatoes
sliced fresh mushrooms or more if you like margarine
marjoram dash of crushed basil leaf
recipeInstructions: Put all spices and seasonings in a bowl.  Saute onion, bell pepper and mushrooms in margarine.  In separate pan, brown ground beef and drain.  Break up ground beef in pan with vegetables.  Add tomatoes and tomato sauce to beef and vegetables.  Add bowl of spices and seasonings and crushed garlic.  Stir well to mix. Simmer slowly, stirring occasionally until desired thickness. Better if cooked a day ahead and stored in an airtight container in refrigerator.
*More or less to taste.
name: SUSAN ANTONELLI'S SPAGHETTI SAUCE
recipeIngredient: 1  1 lb. can peeled whole tomatoes or chopped tomatoes
1 c. sliced fresh mushrooms or more if you like margarine
1 tsp. marjoram dash of crushed basil leaf

recipeInstructions: Combine first 6 ingredients in glass jar.  Let stand overnight to develop flavors.  Make hero sandwiches with cold cuts and this party pleasing dressing.
name: SANDWICH DRESSING

recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients in a large pot or Dutch oven.  Stir together and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes.  Pour into sterile bottles or jars.  Keep refrigerated.
name: MRS. DULL'S BARBECUE SAUCE

individualIngredient: garlic powder dash of celery seed
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients.  Simmer on stove top for 30 to 40 minutes.
name: GEORGE-ANN'S HOT SAUCE FOR ROAST BEEF
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. garlic powder dash of celery seed

recipeInstructions: Mix together.  Let stand for 2 hours at room temperature before using.
name: TERIYAKI SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a large Dutch oven.  Cover and bring mixture to a boil.

Combine everything but beans and corn.  Mix well and shape into 1-inch balls.  Drop meatballs in to boiling soup and simmer 30 minutes.  Add beans and corn during last 10 minutes of cooking time.  Soup may be frozen for later use.   Yields 12 to 15 servings.
name: VEGETABLE AND MEATBALL SOUP

recipeInstructions: In a Dutch oven, saute onions in margarine until they are translucent but not yet beginning to brown.  Add water and all spices.  Simmer at least 30 minutes.  Under the broiler, toast the bread on both sides.  Put log of cheese in the bottom of each bowl. Ladle the soup into the bowls.  Float 1 piece of bread in each bowl.  Garnish each piece of toast with 1 ounce of cheese.  Serve immediately.  Serves 6.
name: FRENCH ONION SOUP

recipeInstructions: In a Dutch oven, boil until almost done potatoes, celery and onion.  Drain and return to Dutch oven.  Add enough milk to cover vegetables, plus 1/2-inch.  Add ham, margarine and spices.  Simmer until potatoes are tender and almost ready to flake apart.  May be made thicker with cornstarch/water or flour/water if desired.
Serves 6 as appetizer or 4 as main course.
name: CREAM OF POTATO SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. white pepper salt to taste

recipeInstructions: Cut vegetables to 1/2-inch pieces and cover with chicken stock.  Add marjoram, salt and pepper.  Simmer until the vegetables are cooked.  Put all ingredients through the blender. Return to saucepan.  Bring to a boil and add the cubed cheese. Heat just until the cheese is melted, but not thoroughly mixed into the soup.  Serves 4.
name: POTATO CHEESE SOUP

individualIngredient: head cauliflower, cooked and coarsely chopped
recipeInstructions: Saute onion in margarine until tender.  Blend in flour.  Cook 3 to 4 minutes without browning.  Add scalded milk, seasonings and cauliflower.  Cook until smooth and slightly thick, stirring frequently. Just before serving, add shredded cheese and stir until melted.
name: CAULIFLOWER SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 medium head cauliflower, cooked and coarsely chopped

individualIngredient: picante sauce salt and pepper fresh cilantro
instant rice garlic salt optional chili powder optional
recipeInstructions: When chicken and vegetables are done, add instant rice and cook until rice is done.  Add tortilla strips
To serve, put shredded Monterey Jack cheese in bottom of individual bowls along with slices of avocado.  Spoon hot soup on top.
name: TORTILLA SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. picante sauce salt and pepper fresh cilantro
1 c. instant rice garlic salt optional chili powder optional

recipeInstructions: Chop fresh spinach and steam in 2-inch water until tender; set aside.  Saute onion and celery in melted margarine.  Stir in flour. Add spinach (do not drain).  Simmer 15 minutes with onion and celery.  Add milk, cheese and seasonings; allow to heat.  Slowly stir in cream.  If thicker soup is desired, add 2 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in 4 tablespoons cold water.  Serves approximately 8.
name: CREAM OF SPINACH SOUP
recipeIngredient: 6 Tbsp. flour and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: chopped leftover cooked mixed vegetables such as broccoli, carrots and cauliflower
recipeInstructions: In a large kettle or Dutch oven, saute onion in butter until tender.  Add flour; cook and stir until bubbly.  Gradually add chicken broth.  Cook and stir until thickened about 5 minutes. Stir in the milk, cream, basil, salt, pepper and garlic powder. Add the vegetables; cook gently until heated through.  Yields 8 to 10 servings (about 3 quarts).
name: CREAM OF VEGETABLE SOUP
recipeIngredient: 2 oz. each condensed chicken broth or
5 c. chopped leftover cooked mixed vegetables such as broccoli, carrots and cauliflower

individualIngredient: grated Cheddar cheese salt, pepper and Tabasco to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook potatoes, celery, onions, bay leaves, basil and water until tender.  Add remaining ingredients except cheese and heat thoroughly.  Add cheese and continue cooking until cheese melts. Sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
name: CORN CHEESE CHOWDER
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese salt, pepper and Tabasco to taste

recipeInstructions: Add everything except carrots.  Cook to boiling.  Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 45 minutes.  Add carrots and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender.  Top with one cup of Swiss cheese and serve.
name: LENTIL BARLEY SOUP

individualIngredient: hot links, cut in bite size pieces
recipeInstructions: Start a pound or so of hot, smoked stuffed sausage in a quart of water.  Add shrimp and crabmeat.  Let this mixture simmer while you dice celery, bell peppers and onions.  Fry these in bacon fat over low heat until done but not brown.  (A covered skillet is best for this.)  When done, add to seafood mixture and continue simmering.  Add tomatoes and tomato paste.  In bacon fat, brown four heaping tablespoons flour until very, very brown.  This roux is one of the flavor secrets of a good gumbo.  Add roux to simmering mixture very carefully to avoid excessive steaming.  Add one tablespoon of powdered gumbo file and taste.  Add more file and/or salt to suit your taste.  Serve the gumbo in large bowls over fluffy white rice.  Garlic-buttered French bread and tossed green salad usually complete the meal for our gumbo crowd.  Serves about 10.
name: MAMA'S CAJUN GUMBO
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. hot links, cut in bite size pieces
2 lb. plus shrimp, peeled and cleaned

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar and cornstarch in saucepan.  Gradually stir in water.  Boil 1 minute stirring constantly.  Stir in butter and flavoring.  Makes 2 cups.
name: VANILLA SAUCE FOR APPLE DUMPLINGS
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. lemon juice with rind or

recipeInstructions: Cook sausage, drain and set aside.  In saucepan on stove or in microwave, melt butter.  Add Velveeta, stirring frequently to prevent sticking.  Add soup and sour cream.  Add cooked sausage. Place frozen hash browns in large oblong pan.  Pour cheese and soup mixture over hash browns.  (Casserole may be baked at this point or place in the refrigerator and baked the next morning.)  Bake at 375° for 1 hour, covered.  Sprinkle croutons on top and bake until brown.
name: HASH BROWN AND SAUSAGE CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 32 oz. frozen southern style hash browns

recipeInstructions: Mix bread crumbs with parsley, butter, salt and pepper.  Put dressing in center of steak.  Roll steak; tie securely.   Put 2 large tablespoons shortening in skillet and brown on both sides of roll.  Season with salt and pepper.  Add tomatoes and water. Cover and let simmer in 350° oven for 1 hour.
name: MOCK DUCK
recipeIngredient: 1 c. water salt, pepper, chopped parsley

recipeInstructions: Blend softened cream cheese and 2 tablespoons oleo until smooth.  Add next 6 ingredients.  Mix well.
Separate crescent dough into rectangles.  Put 1/2 cup meat mixture on dough and pull up corner to form a pocket.  Twist together.  Brush top with melted oleo and dip in crumbs.
name: SAVORY CRESCENT CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 8 oz. can Pillsbury quick crescent rolls

recipeInstructions: Combine in casserole dish and bake uncovered at 450° for 20 minutes.
name: HOT CHICKEN SALAD
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. can cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions: Cook sausage until done.  Drain, then crumble.  Make a 1 crust, uncooked, 9-inch pie shell.  Mix cheese and sausage. Sprinkle them into the shell.  Lightly beat eggs in bowl.  Combine remaining ingredients and add to egg mixture.  Pour into shell. Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.  Cool on wire rack 10 minutes. Yields 6 to 8 servings.
name: COUNTRY BREAKFAST PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 c. light cream half and half

recipeInstructions: Cook spaghetti.  Brown onion and green pepper in little oil. Mix tomatoes and spaghetti; add to mixture.  Mix well and put in large skillet or casserole.  Top with grated Cheddar.  Cover with heated chili.  Put on lid.  Put in slow oven and cook 30 minutes or longer if convenient.
name: CHILI AND SPAGHETTI

recipeInstructions: Bring stock to boil with water; add chicken cut into chunks, simmer 10 minutes, remove chicken.  Add potatoes, simmer 10 minutes; remove.  Add carrots, simmer 15 minutes; remove.  Add broccoli, simmer 3 minutes; remove.  Boil stock mixture to 2 cups. Melt butter in saucepan.  Add onion and saute 8 minutes.  Add flour; stir until golden (2 minutes).  Whisk in stock mixture. Mix in milk and thyme, cook until thick, 10 minutes.  Add chicken and veggies.  Season with salt and pepper.  Preheat oven to 425°. Line 2 (9-inch) glass dishes with crust.  Bake 10 minutes.  Fill crusts with filling and add top crust, brushed with egg.  Bake 25 minutes.
name: CHICKEN POT PIE

recipeInstructions: Mix and place in 9 x 13-inch pan.  You can substitute onion powder instead of onion.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: SAUERKRAUT CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 8 slices bacon, browned, drained and diced

recipeInstructions: Chop green olives, onions and jalapenos.  Mix sour cream and cream cheese.  Add other ingredients (except tortillas).  Spread on 12-inch flour tortillas.  Roll, pinching end tight.  Chill overnight.  Slice.  This also freezes well.
name: COLD BURRITOS

recipeInstructions: Mix baking mix, milk and eggs in greased baking dish (11 x 7 x 1 1/2-inch) with fork until uniform color (batter will be lumpy).

Stir in beef, onion and seasonings; spread evenly.  Bake until top springs back when touched lightly in center (25 to 30 minutes). Sprinkle with cheese and tomatoes.  Bake until cheese melts (1 to 2 minutes) serve with taco sauce.
name: ONE PAN MEXICAN STYLE BEEF BAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. ground beef, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions: Combine ham, asparagus, onions and rice.  Blend eggs, soup, milk, mayonnaise and seasonings.  Stir into ham mixture.  Turn into greased shallow 2-quart casserole.  Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: SCALLOPED HAM WITH ASPARAGUS
recipeIngredient: 2 oz. can asparagus and tips, drained

recipeInstructions: Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp; remove bacon, reserving drippings in skillet.  Crumble bacon and set aside.

Saute onion in drippings until tender; add ground beef and cook until meat is browned, stirring to crumble.  Drain off drippings, stir in tomatoes, green pepper, chili sauce, salt and pepper.  Cover and simmer 10 minutes.  Add noodles and water and bring to a boil.  Cover; reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes or until noodles are tender.  Stir in bacon; sprinkle with cheese. Yields 4 to 6 servings.
name: EASY BEEF AND NOODLES

individualIngredient: frozen mixed peas and carrots, thawed
recipeInstructions: Cook noodles, uncovered, in boiling water 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, drain.  Combine soup, milk, water and Cheddar cheese in 3-quart saucepan.  Cook and stir over medium heat until cheese melts and sauce is hot.  Stir in cooked noodles, turkey, peas, carrots and pimentos.  Spoon mixture into greased 11 3/4 x 7 1/2-inch baking dish.  Combine crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley.  Sprinkle over top.  Bake, uncovered, in 375° oven 30 minutes or until hot.  Makes 6 servings.
name: TURKEY TETRAZZINI
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. frozen mixed peas and carrots, thawed

recipeInstructions: Brown ground beef and onion in skillet; salt.  Blend in gravy mix and water.  Add basil and vegetables.  Simmer 5 minutes.  Pour into 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Fold cheese into potatoes. Spoon in ring on top of casserole.  Bake at 450° for 15 minutes.
name: SHEPHARD PIE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 oz. pkg. frozen peas and carrots

individualIngredient: whipping cream salt and pepper to taste
rigatoni, cooked al dente Parmesan cheese for topping
recipeInstructions: Saute garlic and onion in olive oil, just until clear.  Add the tomatoes and pepperoni.  Saute until tomatoes cook down a bit (about 3 minutes).  Add the cream, salt and pepper.  Toss with the rigatoni and top with the cheese.  Serves 4.
name: RIGATONI CON PEPPERONI
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. whipping cream salt and pepper to taste
1/2 lb. rigatoni, cooked al dente Parmesan cheese for topping

recipeInstructions: Cook sausage in a small skillet until browned; drain off drippings, reserving 1 1/2 tablespoons.  Crumble sausage and return it to the skillet.  Add zucchini and onion to sausage.  Cook until tender, stirring frequently.  Stir in tomato sauce, cook until thoroughly heated.  Place mixture in a serving dish and sprinkle with cheese.  Serves 2.
name: SAUTEED ZUCCHINI AND SAUSAGE

recipeInstructions: Arrange thawed broccoli spears in a 9 x 13-inch buttered baking dish.   Place chicken on top of broccoli.  Combine the soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice and wine. Pour mixture over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese, butter and bread crumbs.
Bake at 350° until it bubbles (approximately 20 minutes).
name: CHICKEN DIVAN

recipeInstructions: Brown ground beef and onion in 3-quart saucepan; drain.  Add chili powder and water.  Bring to a boil.  Stir in macaroni, tomatoes and corn.  Simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.  Stir in cheese packet.
name: SAVORY HAMBURGER SUPPER
recipeIngredient: 1  17 oz. can whole kernel corn, drained

recipeInstructions: Saute onion in 1/2 stick butter.  Low boil onion, soups and chiles.  Line 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan with 1/2 of tortillas.  Pour half of soup mixture over tortillas.  Layer half of chicken and then cheese.  Repeat.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Serve with jalapenos.
name: CHICKEN ENCHILADA CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 doz. flour tortillas, cut bite size
1 stewed chicken, bite size sliced jalapenos

recipeInstructions: Place 6 tortillas in bottom of long cake pan (13 x 9-inch). Brown meat.  Add chili powder.  Drain.  Spread meat over tortillas. Spread beans over meat.  Slice cheese thin and spread over beans. Cover with 6 tortillas.
Blend soup and Ro-Tel tomatoes well.  Pour over tortillas. Seal top of pan with foil.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour.  Serve with your choice of salad and fruit or lemon pie for dessert.  Will serve 6.
name: ONE DISH MEXICAN DINNER

recipeInstructions: In large pot, put in hamburger first and level.  Put in corn and level, put mashed potatoes in next.  Smooth them out.  Add grated cheese on top.  Cover.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
name: SHEPHERDS PIE

individualIngredient: ground beef or bulk pork sausage
recipeInstructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package directions; drain (should have about 3 cups spaghetti).  Stir butter or margarine into hot spaghetti.  Stir in Parmesan cheese and eggs.  Form spaghetti mixture into a "crust" in a buttered 10-inch pie plate. Spread cottage cheese over bottom of spaghetti crust.

In skillet, cook ground beef or pork sausage, onion and green pepper until vegetables are tender and meat is browned.  Drain off excess fat.  Stir in undrained tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, oregano and garlic salt; heat through.
Turn meat mixture into spaghetti crust.  Bake, uncovered, in 350° oven for 20 minutes.  Sprinkle the Mozzarella cheese atop. Bake 5 minuets longer or until cheese melts.  Makes 6 servings.
name: SPAGHETTI PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. ground beef or bulk pork sausage

recipeInstructions: Brown meat in frying pan, breaking up any lumps.  Add next four ingredients.  Bring to boil and simmer for 10 minutes.  In small mixing bowl, mix Ricotta or cottage cheese, egg and Parmesan cheese.  Put a little of the meat sauce in bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, then start alternating layers as follows:  layer of raw noodles, 1/3 meat sauce, 1/2 of cheese mixture, repeat and then top with last of 1/3 of meat sauce.
Sprinkle Mozzarella cheese on top and cover it with foil. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until noodles are tender.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.  Serves 8 to 10.
name: EASY LASAGNA
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. ground beef or sausage mixture

recipeInstructions: Remove meat from casing and break apart and brown meat; remove and saute chopped green pepper, onion and mushrooms.   Add spaghetti sauce.  Cook and drain pasta.  In Dutch oven, mix pasta sausage, sauce and chilies.  Put into large baking dish.  Cover with more Mozzarella.  Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.  (Makes enough for a small army.)
name: BAKED ZITI WITH SAUSAGE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Blend softened cream cheese and 4 tablespoons margarine.  Add chicken and spices; mix well.  Separate crescent rolls into triangles.  Place chicken filling on a triangle and top with another crescent triangle.  Twist.  Brush with margarine and top with crushed croutons.  Bake on cookie sheet and bake 10 to 15 minutes.
name: SAVORY CRESCENT CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 4 c. cooked cubed or ground chicken

individualIngredient: cream of celery soup Monterey Jack/Cheddar cheese
recipeInstructions: Saute onion in butter until clear.  Add chicken, soup and Ro-Tel; simmer 15 minutes.  Crumble tortilla chips and place in 13 x 9-inch pan.  Pour chicken mixture on top.  Cover with cheese. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
name: EASY CHICKEN ENCHILADAS
recipeIngredient: 1 can cream of celery soup Monterey Jack/Cheddar cheese

individualIngredient: frozen or equal amount of fresh broccoli
rice cream of mushroom soup cream of chicken soup
recipeInstructions: Chop and cook onion and celery in butter; saute.  Cook broccoli, cook rice.  Combine onions, celery, rice and broccoli. Add both cans of soup and jar of Cheez Whiz.  Top with crushed Ritz crackers.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
name: RICE AND BROCCOLI CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. frozen or equal amount of fresh broccoli
1 c. rice cream of mushroom soup cream of chicken soup
1  8 oz. jar Cheez Whiz Ritz crackers

individualIngredient: cream of mushroom or celery soup
recipeInstructions: Cut margarine into flour; add milk.  Stir to remove lumps. This crust topping will be thin.

Stew and then bone chicken.  Cut into chunks and season as desired.  Add chicken broth and soup.  Add peas and carrots.  Pour into 13 x 9-inch pan.  Pour crust evenly over chicken mixture.  Do not stir.  Bake at 350° until crusty and brown (about 1 1/4 hours).  (Three hard-boiled eggs may be substituted for the carrots and peas.)  Doubles easily and may be frozen before cooking.
name: OLD FASHIONED CHICKEN PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 can cream of mushroom or celery soup

individualIngredient: lean ground beef, browned, drained and crumbled
cans tomato sauce salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Mix the browned hamburger, spices, onion and tomato sauce in a large pot and simmer 15 minutes.   Mix the cooked noodles, cream cheese and sour cream; stir into the meat sauce.  Turn into a deep, greased casserole.  Top with mushrooms and grated cheese. Bake 45 minutes at 300°.
name: MARILYN MCCONNELL'S BEEF CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 lb. lean ground beef, browned, drained and crumbled
2 small cans tomato sauce salt and pepper to taste
8 oz. pkg. noodles, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions: Into pie crust put cubed cheeses, onion and green chilies. In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs, milk, marjoram and salt.  Pour mixture into pan.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.  This is a great brunch dish.
name: MARILYN'S GREEN CHILI QUICHE

recipeInstructions: Break spaghetti into 2-inch pieces.  Cook as directed and drain.  Chop chicken and combine with pimento, onion, salt, pepper, cheese and spaghetti.  Lightly toss until well mixed.  Put into baking dish and sprinkle with retained cheese.  Bake for 45 minutes at 350°.  (Will freeze.)
name: CHICKEN SPAGHETTI

recipeInstructions: Boil and chop chicken.  Combine with Veg-All and soups.  Pour mixture into a baking dish.  In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, milk and margarine.  Pour crust on top of chicken mixture.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: CHICKEN POT PIE

individualIngredient: leftover rare roast, beef, thinly sliced
recipeInstructions: Arrange in a casserole the layers of avocados, beef and onion, then repeat.  Mix other ingredients and warm in saucepan; pour over top.  Marinate several hours.
name: BEEF AND AVOCADOS DELUXE
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. leftover rare roast, beef, thinly sliced
1 sweet red onion, sliced very thin

individualIngredient: shredded Mozzarella cheese sliced green onions or
recipeInstructions: Layer sausage, mushrooms, cheese and onions in a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.  Combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the sausage mixture.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: EGG CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. shredded Mozzarella cheese sliced green onions or

individualIngredient: beef stock parsley sprigs bay leaves
recipeInstructions: Combine first 5 ingredients.  Cook ham at 325°.  Baste every 10 minutes.  When ham is done, remove skin from top and apply jam. Score.  Turn oven to 450°.  Brown.
For Gravy:  Boil down to decrease liquid and thicken with cornstarch.
name: HAM COOKED IN WINE
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 c. beef stock parsley sprigs bay leaves

individualIngredient: thin spaghetti or ready cut spaghetti
recipeInstructions: Cook chicken in water with salt, pepper, poultry seasoning and bay leaf.  Boil until tender.  Set aside to cool.  Save broth to cook spaghetti in.  Saute onion and celery in margarine.  Add mushrooms (juice too), all 3 cans of soup, chunk up the Velveeta and drop in mixture; stir until cheese melts.  Remove from heat. Cook spaghetti in broth from chicken.  Mix cooked spaghetti into other mixture.  Heat on stove top and serve.
name: CHICKEN SPAGHETTI
recipeIngredient: 3/4 lb. Velveeta cheese medium onion, chopped
1 pkg. thin spaghetti or ready cut spaghetti

individualIngredient: sirloin tip, sliced paper thin across grain
can water chestnuts, drained and thinly sliced
recipeInstructions: Heat oil in electric skillet to set at 375° to 400°.  Brown sirloin 2 to 3 minutes.  Combine sugar, flour, soy sauce and water.  Pour over beef; push to one side.  Add bamboo shoots and onions, keeping in separate groups.  Continue cooking while tossing each group 5 to 10 minutes, keeping vegetables separate. Push to side.  Add bean sprouts, water chestnuts and mushrooms, keeping in groups.  Cook about 2 minutes until heated through. Serve with hot fluffy rice.
name: SIMPLE SUKIYAKI
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. sirloin tip, sliced paper thin across grain
5 oz. can water chestnuts, drained and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions: Dredge steak in flour and brown with onion in 6 tablespoons butter.  Add water and seasonings.  Cover and simmer until almost tender, 45 to 60 minutes.  Stir occasionally.  Add soup and mushrooms; stir to mix.  Cook gently until beef is tender, about 30 minutes.  Meanwhile, cook noodles as directed on package; drain. Lightly brown 1/4 cup butter in skillet; add poppy seeds and almonds; mix well.  Add noodles and toss lightly to mix.  Before serving, remove meat from heat and stir in sour cream.  Serve over noodles.
name: BEEF STROGANOFF AND POPPY SEED NOODLES
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. round steak, cut in cubes

individualIngredient: can chopped green chilies hot pepper sauce to taste
Velveeta, cubed garlic salt to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook, drain, crumble and set aside sausage.  In a large Dutch oven, stir grits in to boiling water.  Return them to a boil, then reduce heat.  Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat.  Saute onion and margarine; add to grits to stir.  Add prepared sausage, chilies, pepper sauce, garlic salt and pimentos. Stir well.   Stir in eggs and cheese.  Pour into greased casserole dish.  Bake at 325° for 45 to 60 minutes or in microwave until bubbly (10 to 15 minutes).  May be frozen before baking.  Serves 20.
name: QUANTITY SAUSAGE CHEESE GRITS
recipeIngredient: 7 oz. can chopped green chilies hot pepper sauce to taste
2 lb. Velveeta, cubed garlic salt to taste

individualIngredient: onion, chopped garlic salt to taste
jar spaghetti sauce grated Parmesan cheese
recipeInstructions: Brown beef, onion and garlic salt until crumbly.  Drain off excess fat.  Stir in Mozzarella, bread crumbs, oregano and egg. Salt and pepper to taste.  Cook shells according to package directions and drain.  Stuff shells with meat mixture.  Spoon 1/4 of sauce over the bottom of 9 1/2 x 13 1/2-inch glass baking dish. Place shells in single layer.  Cover with remaining sauce and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Bake at 400° for 20 to 30 minutes.
name: STUFFED SEA SHELLS
recipeIngredient: 1 large onion, chopped garlic salt to taste
1 large jar spaghetti sauce grated Parmesan cheese

individualIngredient: can tomato sauce with bits, reserve for topping
recipeInstructions: Grease 13 x 9-inch pan.  Layer chiles, cheese until all are used (about 3 layers).  Combine rest of ingredients in bowl and mix well.  Pour egg mixture over chiles and cheeses.  Let set for 24 hours in refrigerator.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.  Remove from oven and pour on tomato sauce.  Bake for 10 more minutes.  Serves 12.
name: CHILE RELLENO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. can tomato sauce with bits, reserve for topping

individualIngredient: half and half salt cayenne pepper black pepper
recipeInstructions: Cook bacon and broccoli; chop onions.  Pour all in the pie shell.  Mix eggs, half and half, salt, nutmeg, both peppers (just a dash).  Add cheese.  Make a hole in the middle and pour the milk portion over it until it fills the pie.  Any leftover, toss out.
Heat oven to 375° and cook for 45 minutes or until brown and firm in center.  Let stand for 10 minutes and serve.  Any leftovers can be refrozen several times.
name: QUICHE
recipeIngredient: 1 small onion small pkg. Swiss cheese
1 1/2 c. half and half salt cayenne pepper black pepper

recipeInstructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine water, bouillon and spices.  Bring them to a boil.  Add mushrooms and boil 5 minutes. Add noodles to boiling stock and cook according to package directions plus 2 or 3 minutes.  Drain stock retaining 1 cup. Return noodles to pot and add cream cheese and margarine.  Stir over low heat until cheese is melted, adding enough stock to keep everything damp to wet.   (Serve immediately.)
name: CREAM CHEESE NOODLES
recipeIngredient: 4 oz. cream cheese regular or light

recipeInstructions: Make corn bread according to directions on the package.  After it has baked and cooled, chop corn bread and bread slices into 1/2-inch cubes.  In a large bowl, mix breads and vegetables.  In pot, combine broth and spices and bring to a bowl.  When broth has cooled, add egg and whisk together, then pour over bread mix and stir gently. Press dressing into greased baking dish and bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes. Can be doubled as needed.  Serves 8.
name: MAMA'S CORN BREAD DRESSING

recipeInstructions: Cook giblets in water until tender.  When cool, chop them fine.  Saute celery and onion in butter.  Mix all ingredients and add enough giblet water to moisten thoroughly.  This makes enough to stuff a 12 pound turkey or it may be cooked on top of the stove in a cast-iron skillet.  Stir continuously (add water or chicken broth as needed).  Dressing may get crispy on the bottom if you like.
name: BREAD DRESSING FOR CHICKEN OR TURKEY

recipeInstructions: Cut steak into 1-inch diagonal strips and marinate overnight. Broil or barbecue until done.  Serve with rice.
name: STEAK TERIYAKI

recipeInstructions: Place brisket in large cooking bag.  Sprinkle contents of soup mix and pour on liquid smoke over brisket.  Close bag and puncture holes in top.  Place in large roasting pan and cook at 250° for 8 hours.  (It cooks while I sleep.)
name: BRISKET

individualIngredient: liquid smoke celery salt garlic salt onion salt salt and pepper Worcestershire sauce bottle of barbecue sauce
recipeInstructions: Pour liquid smoke over the meat.  Salt meat on both sides with celery, garlic and onion salt.  Cover and refrigerate overnight. Drain.  Sprinkle with salt, pepper and Worcestershire sauce.  Bake at 275° covered for 4 hours.  For the fifth hour of baking, pour on 1 bottle barbecue sauce and bake uncovered.
Let stand awhile before baking.
name: BARBECUE BEEF BRISKET
recipeIngredient: 3 oz. liquid smoke celery salt garlic salt onion salt salt and pepper Worcestershire sauce bottle of barbecue sauce

recipeInstructions: Layer in baking dish: chicken breasts, sliced cheese, croutons (mixed with butter), soup mixture on top.
Bake uncovered at 325° for 2 hours.
name: BAKED CHICKEN AND CHEESE

recipeInstructions: Arrange chicken in large baking dish.  Mix ingredients together and pour over chicken.  Bake covered 1 hour at 350°; uncover and bake 1/2 hour longer.
name: SWEET AND SOUR CHICKEN

individualIngredient: breast portions salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Salt and pepper chicken; mix wine and spices.  Add chicken and marinate at room temperature for 1 hour turning occasionally in baking dish.  Sprinkle with cheese and paprika.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
Mushroom Rice Pilaf is a great side for this dish.
Can mushrooms may be substituted if necessary.
Place rice and salt in greased deep 2-quart casserole dish; set aside.  In a large saucepan, saute mushrooms and onions.  Add broth and boil.  Pour over rice and cover.
Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.  Let stand covered for 5 minutes.  Fluff with fork.
name: CHICKEN IN WINE
recipeIngredient: 4 chicken breast portions salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Sprinkle meat with seasonings, then marinate meat, onions and peppers in Italian dressing (the longer the better).  Cook meat until done, then cut.
Side Ideas:  Beans, cheese, guacamole, sour cream, tortillas.
name: BEEF FAJITAS (CHICKEN)

individualIngredient: stew meat, cut into small pieces salt to taste pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Brown stew meat in butter.  Add salt and pepper, onion salt and garlic salt.  Pour on 1/2 cup water and Worcestershire sauce. Cover and cook until tender.  When done, make a gravy using the flour and 1/2 cup water.  Pour gravy over beef.  Serve over rice.
name: BEEF TIPS AND RICE
recipeIngredient: 1   1 lb. stew meat, cut into small pieces salt to taste pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Mix together first 4 ingredients.  Shape mixture into balls, then layer balls in a large pot.  Mix together Karo and ketchup. Simmer at medium heat for 30 minutes.  Add lemon juice and simmer for 1 hour.  Stir gently after meatballs have firmed.
name: SWEET AND SOUR MEATBALLS
recipeIngredient: 2 eggs salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Cook chicken breasts for 30 minutes.  In water with celery, onion, salt, carrots and chicken bouillon cube.  Cool.

Place just the chicken in a buttered loaf pan.  Layer grated Swiss cheese on top.  Heat cream chicken soup, mushrooms and sour cream.  Pour over cheese.  Sprinkle almonds.  Melt margarine and toss with dry dressing mix.  Sprinkle on top of casserole.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.
name: CHICKEN BREAST A LA MARY
recipeIngredient: 4 halves chicken breast skinless and boneless
1/4 c. onions, diced salt to taste

recipeInstructions: Freeze brisket overnight.  Let it thaw a bit, then slice thinly against the grain. Mix the liquids and seasonings in a container and then add the strips of meat.  Shake or turn the container to coat all the strips thoroughly.  Marinate overnight. Put meat strips on a rack in the oven, set at its lowest temperature (warm for a gas oven, or lowest electric setting).  Be sure to use a drip pan or foil.  Check after about 5 hours of baking, but figure that it will take 6 or 7 hours to be completely done.  Take out before becoming too tough.
name: BEEF JERKY

recipeInstructions: Butterfly each trout by cutting down center until it lies flat.  Dot with butter.  Season to taste.  Place skin side down on greased broiler pan.  Broil 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Keep warm.  Serve with Creamy Olive Sauce.  Heat butter and sherry until bubbly; saute onions and mushrooms 1 minute.  Stir in olives, sour cream and seasonings. Heat just until hot.
name: RAINBOW TROUT AND RIPE OLIVES

individualIngredient: whole shrimp, shelled and deveined fresh cilantro salt and pepper to taste Mexican or wild rice
recipeInstructions: Saute onion, bell pepper and garlic in olive oil just until tender.  Add mushrooms, tomatoes and olives.  Cook slowly over low heat.  While vegetables are still crisp, add shrimp and cilantro. Season to taste.  Continue cooking just until shrimp are pink. Serve over rice.
name: SHRIMP VERA CRUZANO
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. whole shrimp, shelled and deveined fresh cilantro salt and pepper to taste Mexican or wild rice

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli as directed until tender; drain.  Arrange stalks in a greased oblong baking dish.  Place chicken over broccoli. Combine mayonnaise, soup, lemon juice and curry powder. Pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Combine crumbs and butter; sprinkle over all.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.  Serves 6.
name: EASY CHICKEN DIVAN

recipeInstructions: Place each chicken breast between 2 sheets of waxed paper; flatten to 1/4-inch thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin.
Combine breadcrumbs, 1/4 teaspoon basil and pepper.  Dip chicken pieces in egg; dredge in breadcrumb mixture.

Coat a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray; place over medium-high heat until hot.  Place chicken breasts in skillet and cook until lightly browned on both sides.  Remove from skillet and arrange chicken breasts in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish.

Combine tomato sauce, garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon basil; pour over chicken.  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Uncover and sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese; bake an additional 5 minutes.  Yields 4 servings (about 298 calories per serving).
name: PARMESAN CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 1 egg, slightly beaten vegetable cooking spray

individualIngredient: beef can be cheap cut or desired cut
recipeInstructions: Boil meat in water until it falls apart, approximately 3 hours.  Shred and add rest of ingredients.  Simmer 3 to 4 hours.
Freezes wonderfully!!  Tastes great hot, cold or however you like it.
name: BEEF BARBECUE
recipeIngredient: 4 lb. beef can be cheap cut or desired cut

recipeInstructions: Combine first 6 ingredients; add 1/2 cup tomato sauce and stir well.  Shape into a 12 x 7-inch loaf; place on a lightly greased rack of broiler pan.
Combine remaining tomato sauce and remaining ingredients in a saucepan; stir well.  Bring to a boil over medium heat.  Reduce heat; simmer about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Set aside.
Bake meat loaf at 350° for 1 1/2 hours, basting with barbecue sauce the last 30 minutes of baking.  Serve with remaining sauce. Yields about 6 servings.
name: BARBECUE MEAT LOAF

recipeInstructions: Add eggs and milk to first 5 ingredients.  Mix dough and take 1/4 of it and roll out thin on floured board.  Cut into 3-inch squares.  Put meat mixture in middle of square and fold up dough around meat.  Pinch the edges shut.  Continue with remaining dough.  Bake at 300° for about 45 minutes.  You can freeze what you don't bake.
name: PIG IN A BLANKET
recipeIngredient: 1 c. butter, cut into dry ingredients

recipeInstructions: Season fillets with salt.  Place in Corning Ware baking dish in which you have melted the butter, oil, parsley flakes and onion. Simmer about 15 minutes after adding wine.  Bake at 450° for about 15 minutes or until golden brown.
name: BAKED FISH FILLETS

individualIngredient: breasts, boneless flour, salt, pepper to brown chicken oil
recipeInstructions: Flour, salt and pepper chicken; brown in oil.  Place browned chicken in baking dish.  Pour off excess oil.  Brown flour in skillet.  Add broth.  Season gravy with salt and pepper to taste. Add mushrooms.  Pour gravy over chicken and cover with foil.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes.  Serve with rice.  May be prepared a day early or frozen.
name: COMPANY CHICKEN BREASTS
recipeIngredient: 8 chicken breasts, boneless flour, salt, pepper to brown chicken oil

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen broccoli or fresh equivalent
lemon juice dash of curry powder bread crumbs
recipeInstructions: Place cooked broccoli in 13 x 9-inch dish.  Top with cooked and sliced chicken.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Combine 2 soups, mayonnaise, lemon juice and curry powder.   Pour mixture over chicken.  Sprinkle top with bread crumbs and additional cheese if desired.
Bake in 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.
name: CHICKEN DIVAN
recipeIngredient: 1  16 oz. pkg. frozen broccoli or fresh equivalent
1 tsp. lemon juice dash of curry powder bread crumbs

recipeInstructions: Devein and shell shrimp leaving fantail.  Mix eggs, milk, baking powder and vinegar.  Marinate shrimp at least 1 hour.  Add seasoning liberally to flour.  Dip shrimp in flour, batter and flour again.  Fry in oil until brown, turning once, about 2 to 3 minutes.
name: FRIED SHRIMP

individualIngredient: jar button mushrooms jar pearl onions
recipeInstructions: Saute meat.  Stir in flour, pepper and thyme.  Pour in broth and wine.  Cover and cook at 225° to 350° for 2 hours.  Add mushrooms and onions.  Add equal parts of broth and wine as needed.  Cook until meat is tender.  Good over wild rice or noodles.
name: BEEF BOURGUIGNON
recipeIngredient: 1 large jar button mushrooms jar pearl onions

recipeInstructions: In a bowl, combine ham, pork, bread crumbs, eggs and pepper; mix well.  Chill.  Form into 10 balls; set aside.  Drain pineapple, reserving 1/2 cup of juice.  Place juice in a saucepan with sugar, vinegar and dry mustard; cook and stir over low heat until sugar is dissolved.  Arrange pineapple slices in the bottom of an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.  Place a ham ball on each pineapple slice.  Pour sugar mixture over all.  Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour or until ham balls are thoroughly cooked.  Yields 4 to 5 servings.
name: PINEAPPLE HAM BALLS

recipeInstructions: Mix meat with crumbs, eggs and milk; blend milk.  Make into large balls.  Place in glass baking dish in single layer.  Combine tomato soup, sugar, vinegar and mustard; pour over meatballs.
Bake at 350° for 1 hour or bake for 30 minutes and freeze for later.  (Defrost and bake for 30 to 40 minutes at 350°.)
name: HAM BALLS

recipeInstructions: Cook roast into 1 to 2-inch pieces.  Mix other ingredients; add meat and marinade at least 24 hours.  Grill on kabobs.  Great with grilled tomatoes, onions, green peppers, mushrooms, etc.  Makes enough marinade for 1 1/2 to 2 pounds meat.
name: MARINATED BEEF KABOBS

recipeInstructions: Cut the upper jawbone of the moose just below the eyes.  Put in a large kettle of scalding water and boil it for 45 minutes. Remove it and plunge it into cold water to cool.  Pick the hairs from the nose as you would feathers from a duck (the boiling loosens them) and wash the nose thoroughly.

Put the nose in a kettle and cover it with fresh water.  Add a sliced onion, a little garlic and pickling spices and boil it gently until the meat is tender.  Let it cool overnight in the cooking liquid.

In the morning, take the meat out of the broth and remove the bones and cartilage.  You will have two kinds of meat: the bulb of the nose is white and the thin strips along the bone and jouls are dark.  Slice the meat thinly.  Pack it into a high sided glass dish and cover it with juice.  You may add salt and pepper or other spices to the juice if they are needed.  Some people add vinegar to suit their own taste.  Refrigerate.
The mixture will jell and when it is firm, can be sliced for cold serving.
From:  Cooking Alaskan.
name: JELLIED MOOSE NOSE
recipeIngredient: 1 moose nose onion garlic pickling spices

recipeInstructions: Mix well beef, potatoes, onions, seasonings and cream.  Roll the mixture into marble size balls.  Chill them until cold.  Roll balls in mixture of flour and cheese.  Brown them in margarine and drain.  Place meatball and tomato wedge on a toothpick or skewer and serve with snacking sauce in a chafing dish.
Combine sour cream, onion soup and coffee cream in a saucepan over low heat.  Stir in parsley.
name: MEATBALLS WITH SNACKING SAUCE

recipeInstructions: Sprinkle veal chops with seasoning and pepper.  Coat large skillet with cooking spray.  Add oil and place over medium high heat until hot.  Add veal to skillet.  Cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side until browned.  Drain veal on paper towels.  Wipe skillet dry.  Add water, bouillon granules, wine and garlic to skillet. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve bouillon.  Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes.  Place onion in bottom of 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish; top with veal chops.  Pour wine mixture over veal. Sprinkle with mushrooms and rosemary.  Cover and bake for 25 minutes until tender.  Sprinkle with parsley.  Serve immediately.
name: SAVORY VEAL CHOPS

recipeInstructions: Melt butter in medium skillet.  Saute vegetables and garlic until tender.  To make cream and sauce; add flour and milk; cook to proper consistency.  Add whipping cream.  Add chopped, sauteed vegetables to cream sauce with dash of paprika.  Add Cheez Whiz and pimentos.  Stir in lump crabmeat.  Taste for proper seasoning. Pour in a round casserole.  Bake at 350° until bubbly.  Serve hot.
name: CRAB AU GRATIN
recipeIngredient: 1/4 pt. whipping cream dash of paprika

recipeInstructions: Sift together all dry ingredients.  Add milk, egg and oil. Mix together thoroughly.  Deep fry until golden brown.
name: BATTER DIPPED HOT DOGS

recipeInstructions: Add water to cover chicken and cook until tender.  Remove and debone.  Heat broth and add dumpling and the chunky chicken.
Blend shortening with other ingredients and roll 1/8-inch thick.  Cut into pieces and drop with broth.  Cook until tender.
name: STEWED CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS

individualIngredient: boiled and boned, save broth chopped onion
recipeInstructions: Mix chicken with onion, cheese, Ro-Tel, garlic salt and chili powder.  Soften tortillas in broth.  Layer 6 to 8 tortillas in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Add 1/2 of mixture and repeat.  Top with cans of soup.  Bake at 325° for 40 minutes.
name: MEXICAN CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 1 fryer, boiled and boned, save broth chopped onion

recipeInstructions: Combine in paper bag the flour, chili powder and salt.  Shake chicken pieces in mix.  Fry in oil.  When brown, remove and add onion, rice, Ro-Tel tomatoes, water, chili powder and salt. Arrange chicken over rice mixture.  Cover and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes until tender and rice is done.
name: MEXICAN FRIED CHICKEN

individualIngredient: French onion soup salt to taste pepper to taste
curry powder sprinkle garlic on hamburger
can tomato sauce bread crumbs dry
recipeInstructions: Mix well hamburger, egg, 1/2 can onion soup, salt, pepper, curry powder, garlic and bread; make a loaf.
Pour rest of onion soup on meat loaf and then pour tomato sauce on loaf.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
name: BEULAH'S MEAT LOAF
recipeIngredient: 1 c. French onion soup salt to taste pepper to taste
1 pinch curry powder sprinkle garlic on hamburger
1  8 oz. can tomato sauce bread crumbs dry

recipeInstructions: Undercook broccoli.  Combine and mix well.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Pour over broccoli.  Cover with Cheese Nips.  Bake in 2-quart casserole dish at 400° for 20 minutes.
name: BROCCOLI CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli and drain.  Cook onions in boiling salted water until tender and then drain.  In saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons of the margarine; blend in flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt and dash of pepper.  Add milk.  Cook and stir until thick and bubbly.  Reduce heat.  Blend in cream cheese until smooth.  Place broccoli and onion in a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.  Pour sauce over.  Mix lightly.  Top with cheese.  Melt remaining butter and toss with crumbs and set aside.
Bake casserole covered at 350° for 30 minutes.  Sprinkle crumbs on top and bake uncovered for another 30 minutes or until heated through.
name: BROCCOLI-ONION DELUXE

recipeInstructions: Cream cottage cheese in bowl and add unbeaten eggs.  Cut or grate cheese and butter in pieces; add flour and stir.  Add defrosted broccoli and bake 1 hour at 350°.  Serves 10 to 12.
name: BROCCOLI SOUFFLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. sharp cheese or Cracker Barrel

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli; drain and set aside.  Blend soup and cheese. Blend mayonnaise with milk and stir into soup.  Place broccoli in baking dish and cover with sauce.  Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and butter.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until bubbly.
name: BROCCOLI BAKE

recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli according to package directions.  Drain.  Add soup, cream cheese, chives and salt and pepper to taste.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
name: CREAMY BROCCOLI

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Butter and flour a 1-quart souffle dish and the top third of a foil collar, then place collar around dish. Cook broccoli and drain.  Melt butter in a saucepan and stir in flour and salt.  Remove from heat.  Stir in milk gradually and return to heat.  Cook until thick, stirring constantly. Add lemon juice, nutmeg and broccoli to sauce.  Beat egg yolks and add to cooled sauce.   Beat egg whites to the foamy stage.  Add cream of tartar and continue beating until whites just bend over.  Gently fold sauce and whites together using a spatula.  Put in souffle dish.  Reduce heat to 375°.  Bake 25 to 35 minutes.
name: BROCCOLI SOUFFLE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. lemon juice pinch of nutmeg
