recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Bake 4 to 5 hours at 250°. (Can be made in a crock-pot 4 to 5 hours.)
name: BAKED BEANS

recipeInstructions: Drain beans well.  Mix all ingredients together in a 2-quart baking dish.  Bake covered at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.  Can be baked 5 to 10 minutes in a microwave instead.
name: BARBECUE BAKED BEANS
recipeIngredient: 6 oz. KC Masterpiece bold barbecue sauce

individualIngredient: can pineapple chunks, drained and cut in half
recipeInstructions: Saute onion and garlic in bacon drippings in skillet until tender (do not brown).  Stir in celery, brown sugar, molasses, tomato sauce, chili sauce, salt, pepper and Tabasco sauce.  Simmer uncovered 20 minutes.
Combine with cooked navy beans, pineapple, pickles and olives. Turn into 3-quart casserole.  Cover.  Bake in moderate oven (350°) 1 hour.  Uncover; bake 15 minutes more.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.
name: SWEET AND SOUR BAKED BEANS
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. navy beans, cooked and drained
1  13 1/2 oz. can pineapple chunks, drained and cut in half

recipeInstructions: Mix in 2 to 3-quart casserole the well drained green beans, almonds, mushrooms and 1/3 of the onion rings.  In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the milk and soup until smooth.  Pour the soup mixture over the beans.  Cover casserole and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Remove lid.  Sprinkle remaining onion rings on surface of beans and bake another 10 minutes uncovered.  This recipe is very forgiving of time and temperature.  (Sliced water chestnuts may be substituted for almonds.)
name: HOLIDAY GREEN BEANS
recipeIngredient: 1 can Durkee French fried onion rings

individualIngredient: Worcestershire sauce dash of red pepper
recipeInstructions: Cook and drain spinach.  Remove 1/2 cup of the liquid.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix and top with Fritos, potato chips or bread crumbs.  Bake about 20 to 25 minutes at 350°.
name: MANDARIN SPINACH
recipeIngredient: 2 pkg. chopped spinach, cooked and drained
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce dash of red pepper

recipeInstructions: Combine veggies and spoon into 4-quart casserole.  In small saucepan, combine broth and herbs.  Pour over vegetables.  Cover and bake 40 minutes at 350°.
name: FRESH VEGETABLE BAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 large potato, peeled and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions: In 1 1/2-quart casserole pan, combine soup, milk, soy sauce and pepper.  Stir in green beans and 1/2 of can of the onions. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Top with remaining onions.  Bake 5 minutes.
name: CLASSIC GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. soy sauce dash of pepper

recipeInstructions: Boil squash and mash.  Saute onion in vegetable oil and add broth to squash.  Season with salt, pepper and sugar to taste. Place in casserole and cover with grated cheese.  Cook medium oven until cheese is melted and boiling.
name: DOROTHY'S GOLDEN CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: sack frozen hash brown potatoes, diced
recipeInstructions: Thaw potatoes about 1 hour before mixing.  Cook at 325° for 45 to 50 minutes in casserole dish.  Serves 8 to 12 usually.
name: SUPER SOUPY BAKED POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 1   2 lb. sack frozen hash brown potatoes, diced

recipeInstructions: Wash potatoes well and cut each into 8 wedges; set aside.

Combine Parmesan cheese and next 3 ingredients; stirring well. Dip potato wedges in melted butter; arrange in a single layer in a lightly greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan.  Sprinkle cheese mixture over potatoes.  Bake at 375°, uncovered, for 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and browned.  Yields 4 to 6 servings.
name: CHEESY OVEN FRIES

recipeInstructions: Sauce:  Combine all ingredients and sauce 45 minutes.

Filling:  Combine all ingredients for filling except peppers with 1 1/2 cups of sauce.  Mix well and stuff into pepper halves. Bake covered for 1 hour at 350°.  Top each pepper half equally with remaining sauce and Parmesan cheese.  Serves 6.
name: VEGETARIAN STUFFED PEPPERS

recipeInstructions: In a 2-quart casserole, layer beans, chili sauce, 4 strips of bacon, brown sugar and mustard.  Top with 4 strips bacon. Bake at 250° for 5 hours.  Serves 8 to 10.
name: SOUTHERN BAKED BEANS
recipeIngredient: 3  16 oz. cans Ranch Style pinto beans

individualIngredient: garlic, peeled coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
recipeInstructions: If desired peel potatoes.  Cut into 1-inch cubes and set aside in bowl with water to cover until ready to cook.  When ready, drain potato cubes and pat dry with paper towels.  In large skillet over high heat, heat olive oil with butter until very hot. Add garlic cloves and potato cubes and season to taste with salt and pepper.  Cover; reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.  Remove cover; raise heat to high and cook, stirring occasionally until potatoes are golden and crisp, about 5 minutes longer.  Discard garlic, if desired.  Serves 4.
name: PAN ROASTED GARLIC POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 2 cloves garlic, peeled coarse salt and freshly ground pepper

individualIngredient: beer active or flat , cold, or at room temperature
recipeInstructions: Make a batter by combining flour and beer in a large bowl; blend thoroughly.  Cover the bowl and allow the batter to sit at room temperature for no less than 3 hours.  Preheat oven to 200°. Carefully peel the onions and cut into 1/4-inch thick slices. Separate the slices into rings and set aside.  Melt enough shortening in a 10-inch skillet to come to a 2-inch depth.  Heat the shortening to 375°.  Dip onion rings into the batter and place in hot fat.  Fry rings, turning once or twice, until they are a golden color.  Drain on paper towels.  To keep warm, place on middle shelf of preheated oven.
To freeze, arrange on a cookie sheet.  When frozen, pack in plastic bags.  To reheat, arrange on cookie sheets and place in a preheated 400° oven for 4 to 6 minutes.  Serves 6.
name: FRIED ONION RINGS
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. beer active or flat , cold, or at room temperature

recipeInstructions: Husk corn and set aside.  Into a large pan or pot, pour the water, milk and sugar; bring to a boil.  Now add the corn and cook for 3 minutes.  Drain corn, roll in melted butter and sprinkle with the chili powder.  (At this point, the corn can be left covered in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.)  Right before serving, cook on grill, directly over hot coals, for 2 minutes on each side.  Serves 8.
name: TWICE COOKED CORN
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. chili powder or to taste

individualIngredient: finely chopped fresh mint garnish: fresh mint sprigs
recipeInstructions: Cook carrots in a small amount of boiling water 6 to 8 minutes or until tender.  Drain and set aside.  Combine butter and honey in a large skillet.  Cook over medium low heat until butter melts. Stir in chopped mint; cook 1 minute.  Add cooked carrots and toss gently until carrots are glazed.  Cook just until carrots are thoroughly heated.   Transfer to a serving platter and garnish with fresh mint sprigs.
name: HONEY MINT CARROTS
recipeIngredient: 3 Tbsp. finely chopped fresh mint garnish: fresh mint sprigs

recipeInstructions: Slice zucchini and yellow squash diagonally (use a crinkle cutter if you have one).  Saute vegetables in olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat 3 minutes or until crisp-tender.  Add cheese and remaining ingredients; toss gently.  Serve immediately.
name: PARMESAN SQUASH TOSS

individualIngredient: caraway seed salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Shred cabbage.  Melt butter in a large heavy skillet.  Add cabbage.  Cover and cook, stirring until tender.  Add lemon juice, caraway seed, salt and pepper.  Serves 6.
name: BUTTER CRISP CABBAGE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. caraway seed salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: hock with some ham on it
recipeInstructions: Wash and soak beans overnight or from 4 to 6 hours.  Pour off water and refill pot with water, allowing plenty of room to simmer. Add ham bone and ham and all other ingredients.  Simmer 1 1/2 to 3 hours or until creamy (water may added if necessary).  Large sausage, sliced in 1-inch lengths may be added the last hour. (Should be thick and creamy.)  Serve over fluffy rice.  This is a typical New Orleans lunch dish.  Leftover beans may be frozen for future use.
name: NEW ORLEANS RED BEANS
recipeIngredient: 1 ham hock with some ham on it
1/2 tsp. cayenne dash of pepper sauce

recipeInstructions: Slice and cook carrots.  Saute onion in butter.  Layer carrots, onion and slices of cheese in casserole and top with bread crumbs.  Bake in 350° oven for about 20 minutes.
name: CARROT CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. butter Velveeta cheese bread crumbs

recipeInstructions: Cut peeled eggplant into 1-inch cubes and soak in salt water in refrigerator overnight or minimum of 6 hours.  Drain eggplant and place in pan.  Cover with water and simmer until tender.

Soak bread crumbs in milk.  Saute onions, green peppers and celery in melted butter for about 15 minutes or until tender. Combine cooked eggplant, bread crumbs and sauteed vegetables.  Add eggs, pimiento and seasonings.  Blend thoroughly.
Place in greased baking dish and bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Top with grated cheese and return to oven until cheese melts.
name: WYATT CAFETERIA BAKED EGGPLANT

individualIngredient: chopped scallions or mild onions additional oil
recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, sugar and salt.  Stir in cornmeal.  In another bowl, lightly beat eggs.  Add buttermilk, oil, corn, chiles, cilantro and scallions.  Add to dry ingredients and stir until combined. Place a griddle or skillet over medium high heat.  When hot, brush with oil, then drop batter by large tablespoonfuls onto griddle. Cook until tiny holes form on each pancake.  Turn pancakes and brown on other side.
Serve with salsa and sour cream and green salad.
name: CILANTRO CORN PANCAKES
recipeIngredient: 1 c. cooked and drained corn kernels
1/3 c. chopped scallions or mild onions additional oil

recipeInstructions: Soak beans.  Add ham hock and cook 1 hour.  Take out ham and dice.  Return to beans.  Add paste, onion, sugar and chiles. Simmer until done.
name: COWBOY BEANS

recipeInstructions: Rinse mushrooms and pat dry.  Trim and remove stems and chop. Dip outside of caps in salad oil and place in greased baking dish. Saute chopped stems and minced onion in butter.  Stir in bread crumbs, dill weed and Worcestershire.  Stuff caps with mixture and bake 15 minutes at 325°
name: STUFFED MUSHROOM CAPS

individualIngredient: peeled and grated salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Saute bacon and onion until bacon is crisp.  Mix potatoes with all other ingredients and pour in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.  Bake at 375° for 1 hour or until the top is browned.
name: BAKED POTATO PUDDING
recipeIngredient: 4 potatoes, peeled and grated salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Bake potatoes at 350° for 1 hour.  Slice off top of potatoes. Spoon out potato being careful to keep shells whole.  Combine potato, butter, salt and garlic salt.  Mash, adding enough milk to make fluffy.  Fold in cream cheese, onion, parsley and spoon potato mixture back into potato shells.  Place on baking sheet.  Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.  Dust with paprika.  Refrigerate overnight. Put into 450° oven for 25 minutes.  Serve.
name: GOLDEN POTATOES

recipeInstructions: Whip all the ingredients until very fluffy.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch dish.
Mix these ingredients together and crumble onto the potato mixture.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.  Delicious!
name: SOUTHERN SWEET POTATO SOUFFLE

individualIngredient: can condensed cream of mushroom soup
can French fried onion rings, divided
jar Hormel real bacon bits, divided
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  In bowl, combine beans, soup, milk, 1/2 can onions, 1/2 jar Hormel real bacon bits and pepper; pour into 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Bake 30 minutes.  Top with remaining onions and bacon bits.  Bake 5 minutes longer.  Serves 6.

Flavor Variation:  Bacon Cheddar Green Bean Casserole: Prepare as before but replace mushroom soup with 1 (11 ounce) can condensed Cheddar cheese soup.  Replace 3/4 cup milk with 1/3 cup of milk; complete recipe directions.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Top with remaining onions and bacon bits.  Bake 5 minutes longer. Serves 6.
name: BACON AND GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE DELUXE
recipeIngredient: 1  10 3/4 oz. can condensed cream of mushroom soup
8 oz. can French fried onion rings, divided
1  2 oz. jar Hormel real bacon bits, divided

recipeInstructions: Saute squash with celery and onion in 1 tablespoon oleo. Crumble cornbread and cracker together.  Add 1/8 cup melted oleo. Beat eggs and add to crumbs.  Add can soup mixed with little water.  Add squash, etc.  Season to taste.  Stir.  Add cheese. Pour last 1/8 cup oleo over.
Bake 325° for 45 to 60 minutes.  Should be lightly brown.
name: SQUASH CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. grated cheese seasoned salt pepper

recipeInstructions: Combine squash, water and salt in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil.  Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until squash is tender.  Drain well and set aside.

Saute onion and red pepper in butter until crisp-tender (about 3 minutes).  Combine vegetables and remaining ingredients; spoon into a lightly greased 12 x 7 x 2-inch baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until bubbly.  Serves 8.
name: SQUASH CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1  8 oz. can sliced water chestnuts, drained

recipeInstructions: Bake potatoes.  Cube with skins on.  Cook bacon halfway, then combine with potatoes and continue cooking.  Add cheese and mayonnaise; mix together.  Put in 9 x 13-inch pan for about 30 minutes at 300°.
name: POTATO CHEESE BAKE

recipeInstructions: Combine last 5 ingredients and pour over the vegetables.  Let stand several hours or overnight.
name: CUCUMBERS AND ONIONS

individualIngredient: Imperial, Vidalia or other sweet onion, chopped coarsely
recipeInstructions: Cook rice in 5 cups boiling water for 5 minutes.  Drain; set aside.  Cook onions in butter in large skillet until limp but not browned.  Combine all ingredients.  Mix well and pour into greased 2-quart casserole.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.
name: SWEET ONION CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 8 c. Imperial, Vidalia or other sweet onion, chopped coarsely

individualIngredient: can plum tomatoes, drained and quartered
oregano, crumbled fresh ground black pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: In large skillet that has a cover.  Saute onion in margarine until soft.
Add corn, zucchini, tomatoes, oregano and pepper tossing ingredients to combine.  Cover skillet and cook on low 15 minutes stirring a few times.
Can also be served over pasta with grated Parmesan cheese.
name: MEXICAN SUCCOTASH
recipeIngredient: 1  28 oz. can plum tomatoes, drained and quartered
1 tsp. oregano, crumbled fresh ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Combine eggs and milk well and add cracker crumbs.  Set aside until liquid is absorbed.  Add remaining ingredients except cheese to cracker crumbs mixture, stirring well.  Pour into a greased casserole dish.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  Sprinkle with cheese while hot.
name: CORN CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Combine okra, onion, flour, cornmeal, salt and pepper.  Beat egg slightly and add to okra mixture.  Mix well.  Heat cooking oil in skillet (I use safflower oil).  Drop okra from a tablespoon in hot oil.  Flatten with a pancake turner.  Cook about 3 minutes on each side.  Drain on paper towels.  Serves 6.
name: OKRA CROQUETTES
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. cooking oil or bacon drippings

recipeInstructions: I can substitute 2 egg whites or egg beaters for eggs.
Preheat oven to 375°.  Combine oatmeal and sugar; add buttermilk, egg and oil.  Add to oatmeal mixture.
Sift together dry ingredients.  Stir into oatmeal mixture just until moistened.  Spoon mixture into greased and floured muffin cups, 2/3 full.  Bake 25 minutes until lightly browned.  Makes 1 dozen.
name: OATMEAL MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Combine all the ingredients and pour into pie shells.  Freeze. Take out of freezer a few minutes before serving.
name: BANANA PUFF PIE

recipeInstructions: Cream butter and sugar; add beaten yolks of eggs, nuts and raisins; mix well.  Stir in beaten egg whites and pour into unbaked pie shell and bake in 350° oven about 45 minutes.
name: OLD RECIPE "OSGOOD PIE"
recipeIngredient: 2 c. chopped nuts pecans or walnuts
1 c. chopped raisins regular seedless okay

recipeInstructions: Place peaches in pastry shell.  Combine remaining ingredients; pour over peaches.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour 10 minutes.
name: OPEN FACE PEACH PIE

recipeInstructions: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend well.  Pour into well-greased 10-inch pie pan and bake for 60 minutes at 350° or until set.
name: IMPOSSIBLE PIE

recipeInstructions: Mix together sugar, buttermilk, bananas and lemon juice.  Fold in Cool Whip.  Pour mixture into pie crust and freeze until firm.
name: BANANA PUFF PIE

recipeInstructions: Using a shortening cutter, cut margarine into flour until it is in coarse cornmeal sized granules.  Add water 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time.  Just enough to bind the dough together. Overlap 2 sheets of plastic wrap (14-inches long with 2-inch overlap).  Very lightly sprinkle them with flour.  Put half dough on wrap.  Sprinkle dough ball with flour, and put 1 more sheet of plastic wrap on top of ball.   Roll thin.  Remove half of plastic wrap and lay crust in pan.  Do not remove top sheet until dough is shaped in pan.   This way the dough doesn't stick and there isn't a mess.  Makes 2 crusts.
name: NEVER FAIL PIE CRUST

recipeInstructions: Combine thawed lemonade, Cool Whip and Eagle Brand milk. Whisk well.  Pour into the pie crust and freeze at least 1 hour.
name: LEMONADE PIE

recipeInstructions: Combine cornmeal, flour, honey, baking powder and salt.  Add yogurt, egg, oil and water, mixing just until dry ingredients are moistened.  Fill 12 oiled or paper-lined muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake at 425° for 15 to 18 minutes.
name: YOGURT CORN MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: In a large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed, beat butter and sugar about 1 minute until blended and sugar is free of lumps.  Add remaining ingredients, reserving 1 tablespoon oats; beat about 1 minute just until batter is smooth.  Spoon batter into 12 greased 2 1/2-inch muffin pan cups; sprinkle with reserved oats.  Bake at 375° for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.
name: BANANA OAT MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 3/4 c. light brown sugar, firmly packed
2 medium size very ripe bananas, mashed

recipeInstructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water.  Mix shortening, sugar and salt; add to yeast.  Mix the 2 flours and add to other mix.   Blend. Put in greased bowl and let rise until doubled.  Punch down and make into rolls and let rise until double.  Bake at 375° about 30 minutes or until brown.  Makes 24 rolls.
name: HOT ROLLS

recipeInstructions: Remove the stems from the strawberries, wash and cut into small pieces.  Combine with the Grand Marnier and sugar and let stand for 15 to 20 minutes.  Preheat the oven to 425° to 450°. Brush cups of muffin pans with melted butter.
name: STRAWBERRY MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Sift together and set aside flour, baking powder and salt.  In a mixing bowl, beat 2 eggs.  Stir into eggs in this order:  sugar, honey, peanut butter, milk and dry ingredients.  Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.  Into a cup, spoon 1 rounded tablespoon butter.  Press the back of a spoon into each filled cup to make a well.  Spoon into each well 1 teaspoon of jelly.  Cover jelly by evenly dividing remaining batter into the cups.  Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm with extra peanut butter and jelly on the side.  Makes 12.
name: PEANUT BUTTER AND JELLY MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Mix Topping well.

Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.  Sift together and set aside all dry ingredients.  In a mixing bowl, beat egg.  Stir in 1 at a time in this order:  sugar, oil, milk and dry ingredients.  Spoon 1 tablespoon batter into each muffin cup.  Sprinkle over the batter in each cup 1 teaspoon of topping.  Divide remaining batter into the cups.  Divide and sprinkle remaining topping over batter.  Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned.  Serve warm.
name: SWEET STREUSEL MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Mix together and bake in greased 9 x 11-inch pan at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.
name: BROCCOLI CORNBREAD

recipeInstructions: Grease 12 (2 1/2-inch) muffin cups.  In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and brown sugar. Stir until well blended.  In a separate bowl, mix the eggs, milk, margarine and applesauce.  Make a well in the dry ingredients and stir in the applesauce mixture with quick strokes just until well moistened.  Fold in the nuts.  Spoon the batter into the muffin cups filling them 3/4 full.  Bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.
name: APPLESAUCE MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Sift together flour, salt, soda, baking powder, cinnamon and allspice.  Add oil, sugar and applesauce.  Mix well until blended.  Bake in greased muffin pans at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes.
name: APPLESAUCE MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Cream softened butter and sugar until fluffy.  Add eggs one at a time and mix.  Beat in applesauce.  Stir flour, baking powder and salt.  Add to butter mixture; stir just to moisten.  Spoon into mini muffin cups, greased.  Bake at 425° 15 minutes until golden.  While still warm, dip tops or all sides into melted butter and cinnamon sugar.  Serve warm.  Makes 36.
name: LITTLE APPLESAUCE MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients well.  Pour into paper-lined muffin pans. Bake at 325° until lightly browned.  Makes 6 dozen minis or 3 dozen regular sized muffins.
name: PLUM MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Combine flour, baking powder, sugar and salt.  Cut in margarine until mixture equals coarse cornmeal.  Add egg and milk, stirring quickly.  Knead lightly on floured board.  Roll 1-inch thick.  Cut into biscuits.  Place on greased pan 1-inch apart. Bake at 450° for 12 to 15 minutes.
name: SKY HIGH BISCUITS

recipeInstructions: Sift dry ingredients.  Cut in shortening coarsely.  Add milk. Knead gently 1/2 minute.  Roll 1/4-inch thick.  Brush with margarine.  Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.  Cut in 2-inch strips stack 5 high.  Cut off 2-inch pieces and place cut side down in greased muffin pans.  Bake 12 minutes at 425°.
name: MY MOM'S UP AND DOWN BISCUITS

recipeInstructions: You will need a loaf pan.

Combine dry ingredients.  Stir in olives and nuts. Combine milk, melted butter and egg; add to mix.  Stir until just moistened.  Bake in a well-greased loaf pan at 350° for 55 to 60 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes and remove from pan. Cool completely. Wrap tightly.  Refrigerate at least 12 hours before serving. Great with cream cheese and snipped parsley.
name: OLIVE NUT BREAD

recipeInstructions: Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup water.  In a large bowl, combine potato water, butter, sugar and salt.  When this has cooled to warm, add the yeast mixture and 3 cups of flour; beat well. Gradually add remaining 3 1/2 cups of flour.  Finish by kneading on a floured board until smooth.  Place in greased bowl, turning once to coat top.  Cover and let double in size (1 to 1 1/2 hours).  Knead down in bowl.  Divide into 24 pieces.  Shape into balls and place on greased cookie sheets.  Cover and let rise 45 to 60 minutes.  Sift flour over tops before baking.  Slash tops with shears.  Bake at 425° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Cool on wire racks.
name: POTATO WATER ROLLS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. hot water from boiled potatoes

recipeInstructions: Sift together the flour, baking soda and sugar.  In a large bowl, lightly beat the eggs.  Mix in oil and rind.  Stir in the sifted flour mixture until just blended.  Fold in the strawberries and nuts.  Do not overblend or the bread will be tough.

Butter and lightly flour an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch loaf pan.  Pour the batter into the pan and bake on the center rack for 1 hour at 350° or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.  Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out on a wire rack to finish cooling.  Cut in squares.  Total prep/cooking time:  1 hour, 50 minutes.
name: STRAWBERRY BREAD

recipeInstructions: You will need a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.

Place bread in baking dish.  Combine eggs, milk, sugar, salt, orange juice and vanilla; beat well.  Pour mixture over bread slices.  Turn bread over to coat evenly.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Melt 2 tablespoons margarine in a large skillet. Remove 4 slices from dish and saute for 4 minutes on each side or until browned.  Repeat with remaining 4 slices.  Serve immediately.  Great with an orange sauce.
name: OVERNIGHT FRENCH TOAST

recipeInstructions: Roll pastry 1/8-inch thick and cut into 6 large squares. Place an apple in the center of each square. Combine sugar, cinnamon and salt.  Place equal amount of sugar mixture in center of each apple.  Dot with butter or margarine.  Moisten edges of pastry.  Bring corners together at top of apple.  Seal edges. Prick pastry with fork or make gashes with sharp knife.  Place in shallow baking pan.  Bake in moderate oven at 375° 30 to 40 minutes or until apples are tender.
name: INDIVIDUAL APPLE DUMPLINGS

individualIngredient: ripe bananas the riper the better
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl.  Mix the milk, bananas, egg whites and oil in a bowl or blender.  Add to the dry ingredients and mix.  Line the muffin pan with paper baking cups and fill them with batter.  Bake for 17 minutes.  Makes 12 muffins.
name: BANANA NUT MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 2 very ripe bananas the riper the better

recipeInstructions: Mix and pour into slightly greased, hot iron skillet.  Bake 45 minutes in 350° oven.  Let stand 1 hour before serving.
name: MEXICAN CORNBREAD

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.  Combine egg and milk; add to flour mixture, then add shortening and mix only enough to dampen flour.  Fold in cereal.  Fill greased muffin pans 1/3 full.  Spoon 1 teaspoon jam onto batter in each cup, then top with remaining batter.  Bake at 425° 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.  Makes 8 muffins.
name: BRAN MUFFINS AND JAM

recipeInstructions: Saute green pepper, onion and zucchini in margarine until tender about 3 to 5 minutes.  Add bacon.  Separate rolls into thin layers.  Place 1 layer in the bottom of a Bundt or tube pan. Sprinkle with part of the Parmesan cheese and vegetable mixture. Continue layering rolls, Parmesan cheese and vegetable mixture. Bake in a preheated 350° oven for 30 minutes.
name: VEGETABLE PULL-APART BREAD

recipeInstructions: Soak dried apricots in water for 30 minutes.  Drain and cut into pieces.  Mix remaining ingredients and mix with apricots. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 350° for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
name: APRICOT BREAD

recipeInstructions: Cream margarine and sugar.  Add eggs, beating well.  Mix in buttermilk, then flour and other dry ingredients.  Fold in pears and vanilla.  Pour batter into four greased 5 x 3-inch loaf pans. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until done.
name: PEAR BREAD

recipeInstructions: Grease 12-cup Bundt pan.  Combine first three ingredients in small bowl and mix well.  Separate biscuit dough; cut each biscuit in half.

Dip in melted butter, then roll in cereal mixture, coating generously and pressing into dough.  Layer in Bundt pan.  Sprinkle with remaining cereal mixture and drizzle with remaining butter. Preheat oven to 350°.  Bake 30 minutes; turn out immediately onto plate; serve warm.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.
name: BRUNCH BUBBLE RING

recipeInstructions: Mix cream cheese and vanilla until well blended.  Combine cinnamon and sugar in mixing bowl.

Melt butter.  Cut crust off bread and spread with cream cheese mixture.  Cut each slice in 4 strips and roll up.  Dip in melted butter and sugar mixture.  Bake at 350° for approximately 15 minutes.  Outside should be bubbly hot.
name: CINNAMON ROLL-UPS

recipeInstructions: Sift flour and baking powder together.  Beat eggs, milk and peanut butter together.  Slowly add honey and mix well.   Add flour mixture and stir.  Pour into a 9 x 12-inch oiled pan.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.  Cool and cut into pieces.
name: PEANUT BUTTER BREAD

recipeInstructions: Mix together melted butter, water, honey, milk, eggs and yeast.  Mix them with mixer or whisk until frothy.  Add 2 cups flour and mix again until smooth.  Set this aside until very bubbly, about 10 to 15 minutes.

Gently fold in 3 cups flour, one cup at a time.  Knead in 1 cup flour until dough is smooth.  In a large bowl, put enough oil to coat the bottom of the bowl.  Swirl the dough ball; smooth side down in the oil.  Flip dough ball over.  Let bread dough double in size.

Punch the bread down and knead it until all air bubbles are gone.  Divide the dough into two parts.  Shape each part into a loaf.  Put into large greased loaf pan.  Let stand until 2 1/2 times original size of dough.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes or until deep golden brown.  Remove from pans after 5 minutes. Rub crust lightly with a stick of margarine and onions.
For herb bread, add herbs and onions to the sponge stage, just before the 3 cups of flour are folded in.
name: LEEANNE'S BREAD (WHITE OR HERB)

recipeInstructions: In a small glass bowl, put raisins and water.  Microwave to a boil.  Let stand 5 to 10 minutes.  Drain raisins, retaining 2 cups of the soaking water.  In a large bowl, whisk together water, honey, milk, melted butter, eggs, yeast and cinnamon.  Mix well until smooth.  Add 2 cups of flour, whisk again until all lumps are gone.  Let this sponge stage stand 10 to 15 minutes.  Add raisins and 3 cups flour one at a time folding gently to avoid tearing the raisins.  Gently knead in the remaining flour.  In a large mixing bowl, pour enough oil to generously grease the bottom and sides of the bowl.  Put the dough ball smooth side down in the bowl.  Swirl the dough in the oil and then flip the ball over.  Let stand until doubled in size.  Punch down dough and knead out all air bubbles. Shape into 2 loaves and bake in greased loaf pans.  Pinch off all exposed raisins.  (Burned raisins really taste nasty.)  Let double in size.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until deep golden brown.  Remove from pans after 5 minutes and place on racks.  With a stick of margarine lightly grease the entire crust of bread.  This helps prevent the bread from drying out.  Do not bag the bread until it is completely cool.
name: LEEANNE'S RAISIN BREAD

individualIngredient: sour cream apricot/strawberry/cherry/raspberry jam raisins chopped nuts sugar cinnamon
recipeInstructions: Knead together flour, butter and sour cream.  Refrigerate overnight.  Separate dough into 3 parts.  Roll out thin.  Spread with layer of each remaining ingredients.  Roll up and place on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° until golden brown about 30 to 45 minutes.  Cool and cut diagonally into 1 or 2-inch pieces. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.
name: COFFEE STRUDEL
recipeIngredient: 1 c. sour cream apricot/strawberry/cherry/raspberry jam raisins chopped nuts sugar cinnamon

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and beat. Pour into 2 loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until done.  Test with toothpick.
name: LEMON POPPY SEED BREAD

recipeInstructions: Makes 1 (8-inch) loaf.

Thoroughly mix the flours with the baking powder and soda and the salt.  In a separate bowl, blend the honey, buttermilk and oil with beaten eggs.  Add the dry ingredients to the liquid, stirring just enough for them to become moistened.  Fold in the pecans and raisins or dates.

Turn the batter into a well-buttered 8-inch loaf pan and bake in a preheated 325° oven for 1 hour or until a straw inserted in the center comes out clean.  Cool for 5 minutes in the pan, then turn out on a rack.
name: WHEAT HONEY LOAF WITH PECANS

recipeInstructions: Sift together flour, soda, cinnamon and sugar.  Mix well and set aside.  Combine eggs, oil, strawberries and pecans.   Add to dry ingredients, stirring just enough to moisten.  Pour into greased loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes.  Makes 2 loaves.
name: STRAWBERRY NUT BREAD

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, eggs, butter and bananas.  Add spices and biscuit mix.  Pour in greased loaf pan.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.
name: QUICK BANANA BREAD

recipeInstructions: Crush cereal with rolling pin to make 1 cup crumbs.  Combine 1/4 cup cereal crumbs and 1/4 cup pecans, brown sugar and 1 teaspoon melted margarine; set aside.  Cream the margarine and sugar until fluffy.  Add egg, banana and buttermilk; mix well. Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and 1/4 teaspoon salt.  Add to creamed mixture; mix well.  Fold in remaining cereal crumbs and nuts.  Turn into greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan. Sprinkle reserved crumb mixture on top.  Bake at 350° for 55 to 60 minutes.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan and cool completely. Makes 1 loaf.
name: CRUNCH TOP BANANA LOAF

recipeInstructions: Cream shortening, sugar, eggs, bananas and flour mixture.  Add nuts and chocolate chips if wanted.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.
name: BANANA BREAD

recipeInstructions: Chop dates.  Add water (boiling) and soda.  Set aside to cool, stirring occasionally.  Cream shortening, sugar and eggs.  Add nuts and mix.  Sift salt, flour and spices; stir into creamed mixture, alternately with date mixture.  Line bottom of greased pan with waxed paper.  Bake in hot oven 400° to 425° for 20 minutes, then 1 hour at 250° or until tests done with a toothpick. Keeps well!
Combine and ice cake when completely cool.
name: MOM'S DATE LOAF DELIGHT
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. each: nutmeg, cinnamon and allspice

recipeInstructions: Cream butter.  Gradually add sugar, beating well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with pineapple, mixing well.  Stir in vanilla extract.  Spoon batter into greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 55 minutes to 1 hour or until wooden pick comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes; remove from pan and cool on a wire rack. Yields 1 loaf.
name: PINEAPPLE BREAD

recipeInstructions: Beat together water, yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Stir in this order sugar, oil, salt and 3 cups flour. Beat well.  Gradually add 3 to 3 1/2 cups kneading gently until smooth.  Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise until double (45 to 60 minutes).  Knead dough again and divide in half.  Shape into loaves and place into well-greased 9 x 5-inch baking pans.  Cover and let rise until doubled, 45 minutes.  Bake at 375° for 35 to 40 minutes.  Cool on wire racks.  Makes 2 loaves.
name: PERFECT WHITE BREAD

recipeInstructions: Grease tube pan with margarine.  Place frozen individual rolls around bottom of pan.  Drizzle melted margarine over rolls. Combine dry pudding, brown sugar, cinnamon and nuts.  Sprinkle mixture over rolls.  Cover and leave at room temperature overnight to allow rolls to rise.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Let set 10 minutes, then invert onto plate to remove from pan.
Variation:  Use 1 cup brown sugar, 1 package butterscotch pudding, 1 stick margarine and 1/2 cup nuts.  Serves 6 to 8.
name: PULL APART BREAD
recipeIngredient: 1  3 oz. pkg. vanilla pudding not instant

recipeInstructions: Melt Parkay.  Add spices and stir.  Brush onto bread sticks that are 2 minutes from completed baking time.  Return sticks to oven and bake 4 more minutes.
Prepared butter can be stored under refrigeration and remelted as needed for 2 weeks.
name: HERB BUTTER FOR BREAD STICKS

recipeInstructions: Bring the ingredients to a boil.  Grease 9 x 13-inch pan and put above caramel in bottom.  Cut Texas toast (4 strips per slice).  Put close together on top of sauce.  Beat together topping and pour on top of bread.
Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. When ready to serve, turn the pieces of toast over and the caramel sauce will be on top.
name: SKIERS FRENCH TOAST

recipeInstructions: Mix together all ingredients.  Add just enough flour to make a thin batter.  Dip slices of bread in batter and fry in oil.  Serve hot with syrup or jam.
name: FRENCH TOAST

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  On lightly floured surface, roll pastry to 12-inch circle.  Place a 9-inch pie plate.  Turn under edge; flute.  Bake 5 minutes.  Melt caramels with 1/4 cup evaporated milk over low heat, stirring until smooth.  Add nuts.  Spread 1 cup caramel mixture on bottom of crust, set remaining caramel mixture aside.  Mix pumpkin, remaining evaporated milk, sugar, eggs, salt, cinnamon, ginger and cloves until well blended; pour over caramel mixture in crust.  Bake 15 minutes.  Reduce oven temperature to 350°; continue baking 40 to 50 minutes or until set.  Cool.  Stir reserved caramel mixture and milk over low heat until thoroughly heated.  Spread 1/4 cup over top of pie.  Serve remaining caramel sauce with pie.  Makes 6 to 8 servings.
name: PRALINE PUMPKIN PIE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Prepare pastry.  In large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.  Add flour, sugar and brown sugar; beat until well blended.  Blend in butter.  Stir in semi-sweet chocolate morsels and walnuts.  Pour into pastry lined pie plate.  Bake until set about 1 hour.  Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.
name: TOLL HOUSE PIE

recipeInstructions: Beat egg whites until foamy.  Mix baking powder and sugar together.  Gradually add sugar and baking powder to egg whites. Beat until stiff.  Fold in cracker crumbs and pecans.  Pour into buttered pie plate.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Cool and top with whipped cream.
name: PECAN DELIGHT PIE

recipeInstructions: Combine chocolate and coffee in a small saucepan.  Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the chocolate melts.  Remove from heat; add butter.  Stir well until butter melts.  Cool.

Combine eggs, syrup and sugar.  Beat until light and fluffy. Gradually stir in chocolate; stir in pecans.  Pour into pastry shell.  Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes or until filling is set. Yields 9-inch pie.
name: CHOCOLATE PECAN PIE

recipeInstructions: Blend all ingredients and pour into crust.  Chill.  Serves 6.
name: QUICK LEMON PIE

recipeInstructions: Cream sugar, eggs and oleo.  Add flour, meal, vanilla, coconut and pineapple.  Pour into unbaked pie shell.  Bake slow.  Serve with whipped cream or Cool Whip.
name: COCONUT PINEAPPLE PIE

recipeInstructions: Into a large mixing bowl, combine pumpkin, spices and brown sugar only.  Whisk until smooth and spices are evenly distributed. Add Eagle Brand milk and eggs; mix well.  Pour into pie shell and put into oven immediately.  Bake at 425° for 15 minutes then reduce heat to 350° and bake about 45 minutes longer.  Pie will test done with a clean knife as for custards.  Cool and serve with whipped cream.
name: PUMPKIN PIE

recipeInstructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl; make a well in center of mixture.  Combine eggs and next 3 ingredients.  Add to dry ingredients stirring just until moistened.  Place paper baking cups in muffin pans and coat with cooking spray.  Spoon batter into paper cups filling 3/4 full.  Bake at 425° 20 to 22 minutes. Remove from pans immediately.  Makes 36 mini muffins.
name: LEMON RASPBERRY MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. lemon extract vegetable cooking spray

recipeInstructions: Combine first 7 ingredients in large bowl; make a well in center of mixture.  Combine eggs and next 4 ingredients.  Add to dry ingredients stirring just until moistened.  Fold in blueberries.  Spoon into greased muffin pans filling 3/4 full. Bake at 400° 18 to 20 minutes.  Remove from pans immediately.
name: BLUEBERRY OAT MUFFINS

recipeInstructions: Allow cream cheese and butter to soften at room temperature; blend together.  Stir in flour.  Chill slightly for 1 hour.  Shape into 2 dozen 1-inch balls.  Place in tiny ungreased 1 3/4-inch muffin cups.  Press dough against bottom and sides of cups.
name: PECAN TASSIES

recipeInstructions: Place eggplant in a baking pan and bake in oven at 375° for about 30 minutes.  Remove eggplant and let cool; split open and scoop out pulp; set aside.
Position knife blade in food processor bowl.  Add garlic, peeled eggplant pulp, Tahini, lemon juice and salt.
Process until smooth.  Cover and chill.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Serve with pita bread wedges.
name: BABA GHANOUJ

recipeInstructions: Mix cheese, pineapple, pepper, onion, salt and half of the nuts and shape into a ball.  Roll ball in remaining nuts.  Wrap in foil and refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.  Serve with crackers
name: CHEESE BALL

individualIngredient: finely chopped parsley or finely chopped nuts
recipeInstructions: In large bowl of mixer, combine cheeses, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper and salt.  Cream until well blended and smooth. Spoon into a piece of wax paper or plastic wrap and refrigerate. In about 15 minutes, mold into a ball while in paper or plastic wrap.  Chill.  To serve, roll in chopped parsley or chopped nuts. Serve with apple wedges and crackers.
name: CHEESE BALL
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. extra sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
1/4 c. finely chopped parsley or finely chopped nuts

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients as listed.  Put in plastic bag and shape. Chill.  Serve with crackers.  This can be made ahead and frozen. Yield:  1 cheese ball.
name: VINEYARD CHEESE BALL

recipeInstructions: Cream together cheese, butter, pepper and salt.  Add flour and sesame seed.  Make into a roll and wrap in wax paper; refrigerate.  Slice and bake in 350° oven until slightly golden color.
name: CHEESE BENNIES
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 c. flour pinch of red pepper

recipeInstructions: Over medium heat in saucepan, heat salsa enough to melt cheeses.  Serve hot or cold.
name: CHUNKY SALSA CHEESE DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 tub Kraft cheese snack any flavor

recipeInstructions: Wash, dry and remove from stem.  Place on pan.  Put in freezer and leave until frozen.
A great summer snack!
name: FROZEN GRAPE SNACK

recipeInstructions: Sprinkle with paprika or parsley if you wish before serving.
This is a low-fat version.  If you like Tahini, use only 1 can beans.

Drain beans.  Reserve 1/4 cup liquid.  Either in blender or food processor (with knife blade) drop garlic into processor or blender.  Process 3 seconds until minced.  Add beans and reserved liquid and remaining ingredients.  Process 3 minutes or until smooth.  Add more water if needed to the right consistency.
Spoon into serving bowl.  Serve with pita bread and raw vegetables.  Yields 3 cups.
name: HUMMUS
recipeIngredient: 1/3 c. lemon juice fresh is best

individualIngredient: Ro-Tel tomatoes one with chilies, one without chilies
recipeInstructions: Brown meat and drain off fat.  Melt the Velveeta cheese.  Add onions, tomatoes and meat to the melted cheese.  Keep hot in crock-pot until time to serve and serve over chips or with chips.
name: NACHO DIP
recipeIngredient: 2 cans Ro-Tel tomatoes one with chilies, one without chilies

individualIngredient: seasoned bread crumbs dry herb stuffing
recipeInstructions: Combine first four ingredients and mix thoroughly. Shape into balls about the size of a quarter.  Brown on all sides in a dry skillet; drain on paper towels.  Drain fat from skillet, then add remaining ingredients.  Stir well.  Return meatballs to sauce. Refrigerate until time to use.  When ready to use, reheat, simmering for 20 minutes.  Serve in a chafing dish with cocktail picks.  Yields 36 balls.  For a party of 50, triple recipe.
name: SAUSAGE BALLS
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. hot or mild bulk sausage
1/3 c. seasoned bread crumbs dry herb stuffing

individualIngredient: cheese cracker crumbs, divided canola oil
recipeInstructions: Combine beef, egg, chili sauce, onion, salt and pepper with 1 cup cracker crumbs.  Mix well.  Shape into tiny meatballs and roll in remaining 1/2 cup cracker crumbs.  Saute meatballs for 5 minutes in 1/2 inch hot oil, turning to brown all sides.  Remove to chafing dish and serve with toothpicks.  Yields about 30 meatballs.
name: TANGY MEATBALLS
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. cheese cracker crumbs, divided canola oil

recipeInstructions: "Grind" each of the vegetable ingredients in food processor before measurements or chop by hand, then measure.
Pull all chopped/ground ingredients in large pot with sugar, salt and vinegar.  Bring to slow boil.  Cook that way for 15 minutes.  Pour into scalded jars and hot water process 10 minutes.
name: SALSA

individualIngredient: garlic powder or garlic salt parsley
recipeInstructions: Mix.  Sprinkle with parsley.  Cover and chill.  Makes 3 1/2 cups.  Serve with cracker or melba toast.
name: SMOKED FISH DIP
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. garlic powder or garlic salt parsley

individualIngredient: pumpernickel bread, scoop out middle, save pieces to use as dippers
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients in order given.  Thoroughly stir together. Cover and refrigerate.  (Make sure spinach is dry.)  When ready to serve, place bread on serving plate.  Fill center with dip and place the bread pieces around the plate to dip with.  Attractive and very good.
name: SPINACH DIP
recipeIngredient: 1 loaf pumpernickel bread, scoop out middle, save pieces to use as dippers

individualIngredient: garlic powder fresh vegetables, cut very fine broccoli, cauliflower, onion, tomatoes, carrots, etc.
recipeInstructions: Press crescent rolls in bottom of jelly roll pan (12 x 18-inch; larger or smaller okay).  Bake at 375° for 10 minutes. Cool.
Mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise and Ranch dressing; mix well.  Add dill weed and garlic powder.  Spread on cooled crescent roll.  (Good to do the day before you want to serve bars.)
Sprinkle vegetables on top of cream cheese.  Top with shredded Cheddar cheese. Cut and serve as appetizer or main dish.
name: VEGETABLE CHEESE BARS
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. garlic powder fresh vegetables, cut very fine broccoli, cauliflower, onion, tomatoes, carrots, etc.

individualIngredient: Nature's Seasonings or Mrs. Dash, etc.
kidney beans hot sauce if desired
recipeInstructions: Brown beef or turkey.  Drain well.  Put into large pot or slow cooker.  Add tomatoes, onion, pepper, cabbage and seasonings.  Add water to cover vegetables.  Simmer until cabbage is tender.  Add kidney beans, undrained
Serve with cornbread.
name: CABBAGE BEAN SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. Nature's Seasonings or Mrs. Dash, etc.
16 oz. kidney beans hot sauce if desired

recipeInstructions: Brown beef.  Remove grease.  Add all other ingredients in large pot and bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 1 hour.  Makes 3 quarts and can be frozen for later use.
name: CABBAGE AND BEEF SOUP

individualIngredient: cooked rice or orzo pasta poultry seasoning
recipeInstructions: Put cut pieces of chicken in 3-quarts water.  Add seasonings. Cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.  Remove chicken and cool, then debone. Refrigerate broth until fat coagulates; skim off.  Dice meat (discard bones).  Return meat to broth and reheat.

Saute celery, onions and carrots in butter or margarine until tender.  Add to broth with can of stewed tomatoes.  Put in parsley, salt and pepper.  Cook 20 minutes.  Add rice or orzo when ready to serve.  Makes 10 servings.
name: GRANNY'S CHICKEN SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. cooked rice or orzo pasta poultry seasoning

recipeInstructions: Saute onions in butter, sugar, salt and nutmeg.  Add bouillon. Simmer 10 minutes.  Add wine before serving.  Top with slice of French bread sprinkled with grated Swiss and grated fresh Parmesan cheese.  Brown slightly.  Serve hot.
name: FRENCH ONION SOUP

individualIngredient: Dijon mustard salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, pepper and onion.  Combine garlic, basil and remaining ingredients with a wire whisk until blended. Pour over tomato mixture; toss gently.  Cover and chill at least 1 hour.  Yields 5 servings - 1 cup per serving.
name: GAZPACHO SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. Dijon mustard salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients in a large pan; bring to a boil.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes until pasta is done, stirring occasionally.  Yields 9 servings.  One cup per serving.  Top with Parmesan cheese, grated.
name: QUICK MINESTRONE SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1  10 oz. pkg. frozen peas and carrots

recipeInstructions: Combine potatoes, onion, celery and water.  Cover and simmer 45 minutes or until done.  Put vegetables through a coarse sieve, and return to water in which they were cooked.  Add milk, salt and pepper; reheat.  Cook bacon until crisp.  Just before serving, float parsley and crisp bacon pieces on soup.  Yields 6 servings.
name: OLD FASHIONED POTATO SOUP

recipeInstructions: In Dutch oven, brown and crumble sausage.  Drain fat.  Add everything else except mustard.  Cover and simmer 1 hour.
When lentils and veggies are tender; stir in mustard and remove bay leaf.  Yields 6 servings.
From Country magazine, February, 1994.
name: SAUSAGE LENTIL SOUP

individualIngredient: onions, chopped salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Soak peas in water overnight. Drain.  Put peas and ham bone in water.  Add onions and celery.  Bring to boil and simmer slowly, stirring occasionally until peas disintegrated and turned to mush. Add seasonings.  Makes 8 to 10 servings.
name: SPLIT PEA SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. green or yellow split peas
2 medium onions, chopped salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Cook onion in oil in medium saucepan until lightly brown.  Stir in flour, then add 2 cups buttermilk.  Stir over low heat until thick.  Add tomatoes and remaining 1 cup buttermilk, salt, pepper and parsley.  Heat, but do not boil.  Makes about 5 cups.
name: TOMATO BUTTERMILK SOUP

individualIngredient: chopped fresh basil optional chopped green onion optional
recipeInstructions: In saucepan, simmer tomatoes, onion and bay leaf.  Add sugar, salt and pepper for 10 minutes.  Run through sieve and set aside. In saucepan, melt butter.  Add flour and cook about 2 minutes.  Add milk at once.  Cook; stirring until thick, add salt and pepper to white sauce.  Slowly stir in tomato mixture.  Garnish with green onion if you wish and basil.  Yields 4 cups.
name: CREAM OF FRESH TOMATO SOUP
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. chopped fresh basil optional chopped green onion optional

individualIngredient: poultry seasoning salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: In a large kettle, cook turkey carcass with water to make 3-quarts stock.  Remove bones; reserve meat for soup.  Strain stock; set aside.  In saucepan, combine onions, celery, carrots, rice and 1-quart of the stock.  Cook for 20 minutes; set aside.

In a large soup pot, melt butter or margarine.  Blend in flour and heat until bubbly.  Add half and half and remaining 2 quarts stock to flour mixture; cook and stir until bubbly.  Stir in vegetable mixture, turkey and seasonings to taste.  Heat slowly to serving temperature.  Yields 4 to 4 1/2 quarts.
name: TURKEY SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: plain yogurt mint sprigs for garnish
recipeInstructions: Puree blueberries in blender until smooth.  Add milk, honey, cinnamon and 1/3 cup yogurt.  Puree well.  Pour mixture into a bowl and stir in remaining yogurt.  Cover bowl and chill thoroughly. Serve garnished with mint.  Serves 4 to 6 people.
name: BLUEBERRY HEAVEN
recipeIngredient: 1 1/3 c. plain yogurt mint sprigs for garnish

individualIngredient: apple cider apple slivers for garnish
recipeInstructions: Cut apple into quarters.  Place in blender with milk and cinnamon.  Blend at medium-high speed until smooth.  Add apple butter and sour cream.  Blend well.  Add apple cider and blend until smooth and creamy.  Pour into bowl and cover.  Chill thoroughly before serving.  Garnish with apples when served. Serves 4.
name: HARVEST APPLE SOUP
recipeIngredient: 1 c. apple cider apple slivers for garnish

individualIngredient: plain yogurt chopped pecans for garnish
recipeInstructions: Combine milk, dates, ginger, cardamon and nutmeg in blender. Puree until smooth (medium speed).  Add bananas.  Blend well until smooth and creamy.  Stir in yogurt.  Pour into a bowl.  Cover and chill thoroughly before serving.  Serve garnished with pecans. Serves 4.
name: SOUTHERN BANANA SOUP
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. plain yogurt chopped pecans for garnish

individualIngredient: can crushed pineapple in its own juice
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients. Store covered in refrigerator.
name: LO-CAL AMBROSIA
recipeIngredient: 1  6 oz. can frozen orange juice, thawed
1  15 oz. can crushed pineapple in its own juice

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients.  Cover mixture and chill for at least 8 hours.  Yields 6 to 8 servings.
name: OLD-FASHIONED AMBROSIA

recipeInstructions: Combine gelatin, sugar and water in a small saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve sugar and gelatin.  Remove from heat and stir in fruit; set aside to cool.
Combine condensed milk and cream cheese, beating until smooth; stir in gelatin mixture, then nuts.  Pour into a 9-cup mold and chill until firm.  Yields about 20 servings.
name: DREAMY APRICOT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1  14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, chilled

individualIngredient: ripe peaches, cut into bite size
recipeInstructions: Dissolve jello in hot water.  Add cold water.  Mix cream cheese and sugar until smooth.  Stir in gelatin.  Fold in Cool Whip and peaches.  Pour into mold and refrigerate until congealed.
name: CONGEALED PEACH SALAD
recipeIngredient: 2 c. ripe peaches, cut into bite size

recipeInstructions: Prepare Jell-O as directed on package.  In a large 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan, mix blueberries and pineapple. Pour Jell-O mixture over this and chill until set.
Mix sour cream with softened cream cheese.  Add 1 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla.  Mix well and spread over chilled Jell-O. Sprinkle nuts over top and chill until ready to serve.
name: GRAPE, BLUEBERRY SALAD

individualIngredient: can sliced cling peaches, drained and cut into chunks
recipeInstructions: Mix all fruit together.  Stir pudding mix into pineapple juice.   Mix with fruit.  Refrigerate until ready to serve. Yields 10 to 12 servings.
name: FRUIT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 large can sliced cling peaches, drained and cut into chunks
1 can pineapple chunks, drained, reserve juice

individualIngredient: red or white vinegar I prefer rice vinegar
recipeInstructions: Cook carrots in large saucepan of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, 5 to 8 minutes.  Rinse under cold running water to cool; drain.
Combine carrots and onion in medium bowl; mix oil, vinegar, dill, salt and sugar.  Pour over carrots. Allow to set in refrigerator covered at least 20 minutes or longer.
name: ALBERT DILLED CARROT SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. red or white vinegar I prefer rice vinegar

recipeInstructions: Peel carrots and slice into discs.  Cook in boiling water until tender (do not overcook).  Put carrots in bowl, slice onions into thin rings and add to carrots.  Cut green pepper into strips and add to mixture; add tomato soup, undiluted.  Add vinegar and oil.  Add remaining ingredients and mix well.  Chill and serve.
name: CARROT PENNIES SALAD

recipeInstructions: Shred cabbage.  Finely chop pepper, pimento and onions.  Boil together 1 minute: salad oil, vinegar, sugar, celery seed, salt and pepper.  Pour over vegetables.  Mix well.  Refrigerate at least 2 hours.  Keeps up to two weeks.  Gets better daily.  Can substitute fresh red sweet pepper for pimiento.
name: COLE SLAW

individualIngredient: peeled, seeded, thinly sliced cucumbers approximately
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except sesame seed and mix well.  When ready to serve, sprinkle with toasted sesame seed.
(To toast sesame seed, sprinkle evenly onto flat pan.  Place in 350° oven for 7 to 8 minutes, stirring every 2 minutes.)
name: CUCUMBER SALAD ORIENTAL
recipeIngredient: 3 c. peeled, seeded, thinly sliced cucumbers approximately

recipeInstructions: Rinse beans in cold water and drain.  Chop the onion.  Toss the beans, onion and parsley, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper together.  Serve at room temperature or chilled over romaine and/or variety of salad greens.  Salad may be made a day ahead.
(Healthy Choice and excellent source of fiber.)
name: BLACK AND WHITE BEAN SALAD

recipeInstructions: Combine and shake vigorously.   Pour over salad just before serving and toss.
name: MANDARIN ORANGE SALAD WITH POPPY SEED DRESSING

individualIngredient: shredded cabbage red pepper flakes to taste optional
recipeInstructions: Place dressing ingredients in a blender and process on low until well mixed.  About an hour before serving, place dressing in a large bowl and then add cabbage 2 cups at a time, tossing after each addition of cabbage. If using red pepper flakes, add now. Cover the bowl and chill for 1 hour, tossing every now and then.
At serving time, add coarsely chopped peanuts.  Toss salad once more.  Delicious.
name: SWEET AND SOUR SLAW
recipeIngredient: 1/3 c. rice vinegar or cider vinegar
3 Tbsp. peanut butter smooth or crunchy
8 c. shredded cabbage red pepper flakes to taste optional

recipeInstructions: Put in food processor.
Freezes well.  Spread into Ziploc bags; freeze flat.  Break off chunks and thaw.
Clean basil and remove all water from the leaves.  Pour oil and garlic into bottom of food processor bowl.  Pack in a bunch of leaves, chop finely.  Pack in more leaves, chop finely.
Repeat until mixture is the consistency of thick paste.  Add a pinch of salt.
Use as a base for salad dressings; toss with pasta and Parmesan cheese; or add to soups, stews, etc.
name: PESTO
recipeIngredient: 1 whole glove garlic fresh basil lots

individualIngredient: sliced green onions with tops lettuce tops
recipeInstructions: Mix equal portions of frozen green peas and salted Spanish peanuts with Miracle Whip to taste.  Serve immediately.
Note:  Best if served crunchy so keep peas in refrigerator until last possible moment.
name: SHRIMP SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 c. cherry tomatoes halves or quartered
1/2 c. sliced green onions with tops lettuce tops

individualIngredient: fresh, clean, broken into bite size spinach
recipeInstructions: Break spinach leaves into large salad bowl.  Add sliced boiled eggs; bacon strips broken into small pieces, sliced mushrooms and onions/scallions cut into small pieces.  Cover with plastic wrap and chill until just before serving.

Mix dressing ingredients in order given.  Shake well and refrigerate.  When ready to serve, shake dressing well and spoon over salad, mixing together until desired combination is achieved. Yields 10 to 20 servings.
name: SPINACH SALAD WITH POPPY SEED DRESSING
recipeIngredient: 2 lb. fresh, clean, broken into bite size spinach

individualIngredient: salad oil salt and pepper, freshly ground
recipeInstructions: In a saucepan, pour boiling water over the bulghur wheat. Stir.  Place over low heat and cover.  Cook 20 minutes or until water is absorbed.  Chill wheat.
Dice vegetables, onion, tomatoes and cucumber.  Mix wheat, vegetables and herbs.  Add lemon juice and oil, salt and pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.  Can keep several days.
name: TABBOULEH SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. salad oil salt and pepper, freshly ground
2 Tbsp. mint, dried if fresh, use

recipeInstructions: Combine bulgur and boiling water in large bowl.  Water should barely cover the bulgur.  Let stand for 30 minutes until water is absorbed.  Add tomatoes and remaining ingredients.  Toss.  Serve at room temperature or chilled.  Food processor works wonderfully well in chopping parsley, mint and onions.  Cucumber may be added.  It is best if seeded and diced.
name: TABBOULEH SALAD
recipeIngredient: 1 c. cracked wheat bulgur boiling water

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in container of an electric blender; process on low speed for 1 minute or until smooth.   Cover and chill thoroughly.  Stir well before using.  Yields 2 cups.
name: SPICY FRENCH DRESSING

recipeInstructions: Mix egg, garlic, onion and celery powder or salt using fastest speed on blender.  Add lemon and oil very slowly.  Start with a drop at a time.  Add Roquefort cheese until dressing reaches desired consistency.
name: ROQUEFORT DRESSING

individualIngredient: garlic herbs optional : basil, thyme, oregano, rosemary, your choice
recipeInstructions: Mix together.  Marinate meat.
name: CAMILLE'S MARINADE FOR CHICKEN OR BEEF
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 c. oil omit for fat free
2 cloves garlic herbs optional : basil, thyme, oregano, rosemary, your choice

individualIngredient: sugar juice and grated rind of
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Use to marinate beef, venison or other red meats.  Especially outstanding marinade for flank steak.
Will store in refrigerator for 1 month.
name: MARINADE SAUCE
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. sugar juice and grated rind of

individualIngredient: lemon juice garlic powder butter or margarine water oregano
recipeInstructions: Cut your chicken in pieces.  Wash them and skin them.  Place in a baking pan.  Pour in your water to cover bottom of pan about 1/2-inch.  Add your lemon juice (your discretion) to water.  Put small pats of butter on each piece of chicken.  Sprinkle garlic powder over chicken, also sprinkle oregano on chicken.
Bake at 350° until chicken is cooked.  Baste chicken while cooking.  Remove chicken and make a gravy from juice.
name: BAKED ITALIAN CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 1 chicken lemon juice garlic powder butter or margarine water oregano

recipeInstructions: Separate chicken breast fillets if connected, cutting away membranes or fat.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Rinse mushrooms; drain and pat dry.  Season flour with salt and pepper and dredge chicken breasts in mixture.  Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat and cook until nicely browned on one side (about 3 minutes).  Add garlic cloves.

Turn chicken and scatter mushrooms over them.  Continue cooking, shaking skillet and redistributing the mushrooms so they cook evenly (about 3 minutes).  Add vinegar, broth, bay leaf and thyme.  Cover and cook over medium-low heat 10 minutes.  Turn pieces occasionally as they cook

Transfer chicken to a warm serving platter and cover with foil.  Cook sauce with mushrooms, uncovered, over medium high heat about 7 minutes.  Swirl in butter.  Discard bay leaf.  Pour mushrooms and sauce over chicken and serve.
name: CHICKEN BREASTS COLLETTA
recipeIngredient: 3/4 lb. small to medium sized mushrooms
3/4 c. fresh or canned chicken broth

recipeInstructions: Mix sour cream, chicken soup and mushroom soup together.
Layer:  First, 1/3 amount soup mixture.  Second, noodles and almonds (1/2 amount each).  Third, chicken and mushrooms (I use fresh - 1/2 amount).
Repeat above, then remaining 1/3 of soup mixture.  End up with noodles on top.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
name: CHICKEN CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 4 chicken breasts, cooked up and diced

individualIngredient: dried parsley flakes salt and pepper
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 300°.  Place chicken breasts in a large, heavy ovenware pot.  (An enamel coated cast-iron pot is best.)  Peel potatoes, slice 1/2-inch thick and place on top of chicken.

Peel and quarter the onion.  Peel carrots, quarter lengthwise and cut into 2-inch lengths.  Cut ends off the green beans or separate frozen beans and place in the pot with parsley flakes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.  Pour sherry over all and cover tightly.  Bake 2 hours or until vegetables are tender.
Yields 4 servings.  Approximate calories per serving 310.
name: CHICKEN DINNER IN THE POT
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp. dried parsley flakes salt and pepper

individualIngredient: cans undiluted cream of chicken soup
recipeInstructions: Combine cooked, chopped, broccoli and chicken in 12 x 9-inch baking pan.  Set aside.  Combine soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice and curry powder.  Pour over broccoli and chicken.  Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Yields 12 servings.  You may substitute turkey for chicken.
From "A Taste of Country," 3rd edition.
name: EASY CHICKEN DIVAN
recipeIngredient: 2  10 3/4 oz. cans undiluted cream of chicken soup

individualIngredient: enchilada sauce small can sliced black olives
recipeInstructions: Make enchilada sauce mix according to package directions using the 8 ounce can tomato sauce and water.  Meanwhile, heat 1/4 to 1/2-inch oil in small skillet.  Fry tortillas one at a time about 3 seconds on each side.  Drain on paper towel.  Stuff tortilla with chicken and cheese.  Place in 9 x 13-inch pan with seam down. When all are stuffed, pour sauce over them, sprinkle with olives and then add layer of cheese.
Save some cheese for the final layer.
name: CHICKEN ENCHILADAS
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. white or yellow corn tortillas
1 pkg. enchilada sauce small can sliced black olives

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 450°.  Place rice in a 13 x 9-inch dish.  Pour the chicken broth over the rice and place your chicken on top. Pour your melted margarine over the chicken and bake in oven at 450° for 1 hour.  You can debone your chicken and mix the chicken into the rice.
name: EASY CHICKEN AND RICE

individualIngredient: Mozzarella cheese, grated oregano olive oil
recipeInstructions: Beat together egg and water.  Mix together crumbs and cheese. Dip chicken breasts in egg and water.  Roll in bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese mixture.  Brown in hot oil.  Place in baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over chicken.  Sprinkle on some oregano, then the Mozzarella cheese.
Cover; bake 35 minutes at 350°.  Serves 4.  Great with spaghetti and marinara sauce.
name: CHICKEN PARMESAN
recipeIngredient: 4 oz. Mozzarella cheese, grated oregano olive oil

individualIngredient: plain flour seasonings: salt, pepper, and onion powder to taste
recipeInstructions: Season chicken, then stew until tender.  Remove to plate; let cool, then tear into bite size pieces.  Season and cook vegetables until tender.  Drain; mix with thickened broth.

To thicken broth, melt margarine in a large heavy saucepan over low heat; add plain flour, stirring until smooth.  Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Gradually add broth; cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened.
Line bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch casserole with chicken.  Next pour vegetable mixture over chicken, then pour crust on top.  Bake at 350° 45 minutes or until golden brown.
name: CHICKEN POT PIE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. plain flour seasonings: salt, pepper, and onion powder to taste

individualIngredient: breasts, cooked and deboned broth from chicken and
cream of chicken and stir up
recipeInstructions: Put vegetables in pan and chicken on top.  Pour broth on top of these ingredients.  Make biscuit dough with ice water.  Cut out and place on top.  Melt stick margarine and brush on top.  Bake at 400° until brown.
name: CHICKEN POT PIE
recipeIngredient: 4 chicken breasts, cooked and deboned broth from chicken and
2 cans cream of chicken and stir up

individualIngredient: cooked chicken, cut in small pieces
Uncle Ben's wild and white rice, cooked
water chestnuts, diced salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients.  Pour into a 2 1/2 to 3 cup casserole. Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350°.
name: CHICKEN SPECTACULAR
recipeIngredient: 3 c. cooked chicken, cut in small pieces
1 box Uncle Ben's wild and white rice, cooked
1 can water chestnuts, diced salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Combine margarine or butter, honey and mustard, salt and curry powder.  Pour over chicken.  Heat oven to 350°.  Bake chicken 1 1/4 hours, basting every 15 minutes until chicken is tender and nicely brown.  Good served with rice.
Recipe taken from "More With Less" cookbook.
If you wish to have less fat in your chicken dish, skin the chicken and cut the margarine or butter to 1/4 cup.
name: HONEY BAKED CHICKEN

recipeInstructions: Roll chicken in oil to coat.  Place in baking dish, salt and pepper; sprinkle on garlic.  Squeeze 1/2 lemon over chicken.  Slice remaining lemon.  Place on each piece of chicken.  Bake for 15 minutes at 400°.  Turn and bake 20 to 25 minutes longer.  Spoon pan juices over chicken before serving.  Serves 4.
name: LEMON GARLIC CHICKEN

individualIngredient: onion powder can substitute fresh onion, minced
recipeInstructions: Split chicken, halves or quarters.  Place in shallow baking pans.  Combine other ingredients in a jar and shake or whip in a bowl.  Pour sauce over chicken.  Cover tightly and marinade in refrigerator 6 to 8 hours or overnight (up to 24 hours).

Remove chicken from refrigerator about 1 hour before cooking. Put on grill skin side up.  Cook for 25 minutes.   Brush often with sauce.  Turn.  Cook 20 minutes more or can bake in oven, turning and basting at 350° about 45 minutes or until drying and browning.
name: LEMON MARINADE CHICKEN BARBECUE
recipeIngredient: 4 chicken breasts can use chicken thighs
2 tsp. onion powder can substitute fresh onion, minced

recipeInstructions: Preheat the oven to 400°.  Coat a baking sheet with 3 sprays of the vegetable oil.  Put the chicken in a large bowl with the ice water.  (Make sure chicken is skinned.)  Put the yogurt in a medium bowl.  Set both bowls aside.  Toss all the breading ingredients into a large, tightly sealing plastic bag.  Seal and shake well to mix.  Remove 2 pieces of the chicken from ice water.  Roll each piece in the yogurt.  Put the chicken into the plastic bag.  Reseal and shake to coat thoroughly.  Transfer the breaded chicken to the prepared baking sheet.  Repeat the process until all the chicken is coated.  Spray the chicken lightly with the vegetable oil.  Place the baking sheet on the bottom shelf of the oven and bake for 1 hour, turning the pieces every 20 minutes to allow even browning. Serve hot or at room temperature.  Very good and crispy!  Makes 12 pieces.
The secret to this recipe is to make sure that both the chicken and the yogurt are very cold.  Proper soaking will help the breading adhere and produce a crisp coating like fried chicken.
name: UNFRIED CHICKEN

individualIngredient: cream of mushroom or cream of celery soup
recipeInstructions: Place chopped dried beef in bottom of large baking dish. Arrange breast on top.  Combine all other ingredients; mix well. Pour over chicken.
Bake at 325° for 2 hours.  Yields 5 to 10 servings.
name: YUMMY CHICKEN
recipeIngredient: 10 split, deboned chicken breast, skin removed
1 can cream of mushroom or cream of celery soup
1 Tbsp. heaping dried onion soup mix

recipeInstructions: (For more hens, double ingredients.)

Remove giblets from hens.  Rinse hens and pat dry.  Place hens in baking dish.  Stir orange peel into softened butter.  Pat butter mixture onto the hens. Pour orange juice over them.  Bake in 375° oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour, basting every 15 minutes. Serve with rice.  Yields 2 to 4 servings.
name: ORANGE GLAZED CORNISH GAME HENS

recipeInstructions: Cook noodles.  Chop turkey into cubes.  Melt butter or margarine in medium saucepan.  Stir in flour.  Gradually add milk and broth.  Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened.  Add Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, turkey and mushrooms.  Continue heating until turkey is hot.  Serve over cooked noodles.  Makes 4 to 5 servings.
name: SMOKED TURKEY FETTUCINI
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. salt dash of white pepper

recipeInstructions: Thaw spinach.  Heat oven to 350°.  Butter a large baking pan. Process bread into fine crumbs.  Chop onion.  Cook onion in oil until soft, 2 to 3 minutes.  Whisk eggs with milk, basil, salt and pepper.  Add spinach, onion, turkey, bread crumbs and lemon juice; mix well.  Turn mixture out into baking pan and form it into a 9 x 5-inch loaf.  Brush with ketchup and bake 30 minutes.  Melt butter and baste loaf with it and continue to bake, basting occasionally, until well browned 30 to 35 minutes.  Makes 8 servings.
name: TURKEY MEAT LOAF

individualIngredient: Birds Eye sweet corn, thawed and drained
natural shredded Colby/Monterey Jack cheese, divided
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Brown meat; drain.  Stir in salsa, corn, dressing and chili powder.  Layer half each of meat mixture, chips and cheese in 2-quart casserole.  Repeat layers.
Bake 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.  Top with shredded lettuce and chopped tomatoes if desired.  Makes 6 servings.
name: BEEF NACHO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 c. Birds Eye sweet corn, thawed and drained
8 oz. natural shredded Colby/Monterey Jack cheese, divided

individualIngredient: Lipton onion soup mix with mushrooms
recipeInstructions: Cut up potato and apple, thinly.  Over medium high heat, mix beef, potato and apple.  Stir-fry until almost done.  Mix 2 tablespoons peach jam and 2 tablespoons red wine.  Fix onion soup mix as directed.  Add to peach jam mixture.  Add pepper and add to beef stir-fry and simmer until peppers are done and jam is over beef, stirring well.  Serve over rice or pasta.
name: BEEF STIR-FRY
recipeIngredient: 1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix with mushrooms

individualIngredient: sirloin steak, trimmed and cut into very thin strips
recipeInstructions: In hot margarine, saute onion, garlic and mushrooms until lightly browned. Add beef.  Cook, stirring until red color disappears.  Stir in lemon juice, wine, consomme, salt and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, 15 minutes.  Stir in uncooked noodles.  Cook, covered, 5 minutes or until noodles are tender.  Mix in sour cream; heat quickly but do not boil.  Serve at once.  Yields 8 good size servings.
name: BEEF STROGANOFF
recipeIngredient: 2  3 oz. jars sliced mushrooms, drained or
2 lb. sirloin steak, trimmed and cut into very thin strips
1/2 c. burgundy or other red wine

recipeInstructions: Grease pie plate, 10 x 1 1/2-inch.  Mix biscuit mix, water and beans.  Spread into pie plate.  Layer remaining ingredients on bean mixture.  Bake 30 minutes at 350°.  Serve with sour cream.
name: BURRITO BAKE

individualIngredient: can stewed tomatoes salt to taste
recipeInstructions: Brown meat and onions; drain fat.  Add chili powder, garlic, sauce, tomatoes, salt and simmer 20 minutes.  Add mushrooms.  Line a 9 x 13-inch pan with tortillas.  Top with half meat mixture, then half the cheese.  Repeat tortillas, meat mixture and cheese. Bake at 350° about 20 to 30 minutes.
name: ENCHILADA PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 large can stewed tomatoes salt to taste

recipeInstructions: Take sausage out of casing. Brown ground beef and sausage together. Add tomato sauce and seasonings.  Let simmer for 45 minutes.  Add paste, simmer about 5 more minutes.  Cook noodles according to package directions.  Layer noodles, sauce, cottage cheese, Mozzarella cheese and Ricotta cheese in greased pan. Place in 350° oven until top cheese melts and bubbly.
name: LASAGNA
recipeIngredient: 1  8 oz. pkg. lasagna noodles salt pepper

individualIngredient: French bread or loaf Italian bread
can cheese soup Italian seasoning to taste at least
recipeInstructions: Cut bread in half lengthwise, using care scooping out inside and break into bite sizes.  Combine ground beef, chopped onion and green pepper in large saucepan.  Cook until meat is browned.  Stir in soup, cheese and bread pieces.  Add Italian seasoning.
Spoon meat mixture into bottom half of bread shell and cover with top half of bread shell.  Wrap loaf in foil.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  To serve, cut into slices.  Yields 8 servings.
name: MEAL IN A LOAF
recipeIngredient: 1 loaf French bread or loaf Italian bread
1  11 oz. can cheese soup Italian seasoning to taste at least

recipeInstructions: After meat is cooked, add fajita seasoning.  Layer in order given.  Bake about 350° until hot.  Serve hot.
name: MEXICAN LASAGNA

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 325°.  Cook ground beef and onion in skillet until brown; drain.  Stir in tomato sauce, salt, oregano, cinnamon, pepper and garlic powder.  Mix sauce mix, milk, water and margarine in 2-quart saucepan.  Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat; cool 2 to 3 minutes.   Gradually stir sauce into mixed eggs. Grease baking dish 13 x 9 x 2-inches. Layer half each of the potatoes beef mixture and cheese in dish; repeat.  Pour over top.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Bake uncovered 1 hour.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving (6 to 8 servings).
name: MOUSSAKA

individualIngredient: Campbell's Healthy Request cream of mushroom soup
recipeInstructions: Mix together flour and spices you prefer.  Take cube steak and flour with flour mixture.  Cook steak in oil until done.  Take steak from pan; set aside on paper towel.  Mix soup, onion, mushroom and some water and bouillon cube in pan you cooked meat in.  Place meat in gravy and let cook on low for 30 minutes or so. Check every 10 minutes to stir.  May add more water if too thick. Very good to serve with rice or pasta.  And to add some color, steamed vegetables are great!
name: MUSHROOM GRAVY AND CUBED BEEF STEAK
recipeIngredient: 1 can Campbell's Healthy Request cream of mushroom soup
1/4 c. chopped onion or mushrooms optional

recipeInstructions: In a large skillet, cook the onions, celery and garlic in the canola oil for 3 minutes.  Add the round steak, cut in thin strips and the strips of green pepper.  Cook until meat is slightly seared.  Add the beef broth, tomatoes and mushrooms.  Mix the soy sauce with the cornstarch until smooth.  Add to meat mixture and cook on medium heat until mixture is clear.  Serve over rice or noodles.  Yields 4 to 6 servings.
name: POLYNESIAN STEW
recipeIngredient: 1/2 sweet green pepper, cut into strips

recipeInstructions: Cook potatoes in skins until almost tender and then remove skins.  Mix ground beef, egg, salt and pepper.  Cover each potato with hamburger, pressing well.  Place balls in greased 9 x 13-inch casserole.  Pour tomato juice over balls and top with onions and peppers.  Bake at 350° until meat is done and potatoes tender. Serves 6 to 8.
name: POTATOES IN BEEF JACKETS

recipeInstructions: Prepare stuffing:  Finely chop onion and green pepper and parsley.  Food processor with knife blade works great.  Add salt, pepper, paprika, allspice to ground meat.  Also add tomato paste. Mix with onion, pepper and parsley that has been chopped.  Set aside.  Lay tomato down, seam side down and cut slits about 1/2-inch apart.  Do not go completely through tomato.  Trim eggplant and cut into rounds.  Put in colander and sprinkle with salt.  Let drain for 20 minutes.

Spray eggplant rounds on both sides with Pam.  Put 1 tablespoon of stuffing into each tomato slit.  Stuff eggplant placing rounds back to back.  Arrange in 9 x 13-inch pan ungreased.  Cover with foil.  Heat oven to 350°.  Bake until tender about 1 hour.  Uncover and place under broiler and brown top.  Serves 6 to 8.  Serve with rice pilaf.
name: STUFFED EGGPLANT AND TOMATOES

recipeInstructions: Brown beef in skillet.  Drain well.  Put all ingredients in crock-pot. Stir well.  Cover and cook on low 6 to 8 hours (high 3 hours).  Serves 10.  May be frozen.
name: TEXAS HASH

individualIngredient: dried white beans, soaked overnight, rinsed and drained
recipeInstructions: Brown the lamb chop.  Saute all vegetables in the drippings. Place all ingredients in large pot.  Cover with water.  Bring to a slow boil.  Cook until beans are soft, replenishing water as needed.  Should take 1 1/2 to 2 hours.  Serve over rice.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  Feeds 8 to 10.
name: CAUSSOLET
