recipeIngredient: 4 c. dried white beans, soaked overnight, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Place leg of lamb on rack in shallow baking pan.  Roast for 1 hour.
Combine remaining ingredients and spread over lamb.  Continue roasting for 1 1/2 hours or until done.  Baste 2 or 3 times during last roasting time.
Yields 8 to 12 servings.
name: ROAST LEG OF LAMB WITH HERBED MUSTARD GLAZE

recipeInstructions: Cut the meat into 1 1/4 inch cubes.  Put the oil, wine, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, pepper, paprika and allspice together. Finely chop garlic or use a garlic press.  Cut the onions lengthwise into quarters and then crosswise in half.  Add onions and all the spices, wine and oil to meat.  Work mixture with hands a few minutes.  Cover and marinate 24 hours.  Stir occasionally. Thread alternating pieces of meat with onions on skewers.  Leave some space so they can be turned.  Prepare eggplant and cutting lengthwise and crosswise into 1-inch pieces.  Sprinkle with salt and let set in colander for 30 minutes.  This draws out any bitters from the eggplant.  Thread on skewers and spray with Pam.  Cut peppers into 2-inch squares and thread on skewers.  Thread the whole tomato on a skewer.  Start a charcoal fire.  The coals should be hot.  Grill turning meat often.  The meat takes about 12 minutes.  Eggplant about 12 minutes, peppers 10 minutes and tomatoes 5 minutes.  The meat and vegetables are cooked separately because they have different cooking times.  Shish kebab can be cooked in broiler.
name: MOTHER-IN-LAW SHISH KEBAB

individualIngredient: salt fresh parsley sprigs for garnish
recipeInstructions: Place bread crumbs (cubes) in bottom of a greased 2 1/2-quart baking dish; set aside.  Cook sausage until browned, stirring to crumble; drain well.  Combine sausage, eggs, milk, cheese and salt in a large bowl.  Stir well.  Pour over bread cubes.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Bake uncovered at 350° for 50 minutes or until golden brown and set.  Remove from oven and garnish.  Cut into squares to serve.  Yields 12 servings.
name: BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. salt fresh parsley sprigs for garnish

recipeInstructions: Baste and charbroil ribs 20 minutes on one side, 10 minutes on the other side, 20 minutes glazing.  Total 50 minutes.
name: GLAZE FOR RIBS
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. dry mustard salt and pepper

individualIngredient: bulk Italian sausage, cooked, well drained optional
frozen chopped spinach, thawed, squeezed dry
recipeInstructions: Thaw bread dough and let rise according to package directions. Roll 2/3 down onto 11-inch circle on lightly floured surface.  Line bottom and sides of greased 9-inch cake pan with dough.  Place tomatoes and sausage in pan.  Sprinkle with basil, oregano and pepper.  Combine Ricotta, spinach, Mozzarella, 3/4 cup Parmesan, garlic and salt; spread over tomatoes.  Roll remaining dough into 9-inch circle.  Place over cheese mixture.  Pinch edges to seal. Bake at 450° for 25 minutes.  Spread with pizza sauce.  Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese.  Bake 10 minutes more.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.  Makes 8 servings.
Note:  If using a dark colored pan, reduce oven temperature to 425°.
name: STUFFED SPINACH PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. bulk Italian sausage, cooked, well drained optional
1/4 tsp. each oregano, pepper and salt
10 oz. frozen chopped spinach, thawed, squeezed dry

individualIngredient: red snapper fillets pinch of ground nutmeg pinch of ground black pepper
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Combine onion, orange juice and orange rind and salt.  Marinate fillets in mixture for about 30 minutes. Drain and bake, flesh side up, for about 12 minutes or until done. Just before baking, sprinkle each fillet lightly with nutmeg and pepper.  Serve immediately.  Yields 4 servings.
name: RED SNAPPER CITRUS
recipeIngredient: 10 oz. red snapper fillets pinch of ground nutmeg pinch of ground black pepper

individualIngredient: sea legs mixture of snow crabmeat, pollock and turbot
fresh or frozen lemon juice paprika salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Melt 1 stick of butter and when cool, add lemon juice and set aside.  Mix all seafood together carefully.  Add butter/lemon mixture and mix again.  Place in a shallow baking dish, such as Pyrex or 13 x 9-inch baking pan.  Add about 1/4 to 1/2 cup water and sprinkle a little paprika on top.  Cut the remaining 1/2 stick of butter into small pieces on top.  Bake at 350° about 30 to 45 minutes, stirring periodically in a basting fashion, so you can keep the meat in large pieces.
name: SEAFOOD CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. sea legs mixture of snow crabmeat, pollock and turbot
2 Tbsp. fresh or frozen lemon juice paprika salt and pepper to taste

recipeInstructions: Saute vegetables in oil in large skillet until tender.  Add tomato sauce and seasonings.  Simmer 20 minutes.  Mix in shrimp. Heat 15 to 20 minutes longer on medium-low.  Serve hot over rice. Makes 3 to 4 servings.
name: SHRIMP CREOLE

individualIngredient: white cooking wine liquid crab boil
red pepper dash of Tabasco sauce
recipeInstructions: Peel shrimp.  Rinse in colander.  Cook in just enough water to cover.  Add 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1 tablespoon crab boil.  Cook on high until water begins to simmer.  Cover pot.  Turn off heat and let stand 5 to 7 minutes.  Remove shrimp from water.  Save water. Peel eggplant and cut into chunks.  Cook eggplant in shrimp water until soft enough to mash.  In large skillet, heat olive oil. Saute onions, bell pepper and celery.  When lightly brown and "limp," add garlic.  Saute 2 more minutes.  Remove skillet from heat.  Mash eggplant until chunks are not intact.  Add 1/2 teaspoon herb mix (oregano, basil, thyme, bay leaves, powdered). Add remaining salt and red pepper.  Add sauteed vegetables.  Cut shrimp into 1/3-inch long pieces.  Add wine, beaten raw egg, Worcestershire and Tabasco sauce and mayonnaise.  Mix thoroughly. Add bread crumbs.  Mix well.  Spread in 2-quart greased casserole. Top with grated Parmesan cheese and bake for 30 minutes in 325° oven.  If mixture is too dry, add more mayonnaise or egg.   If too moist, add more bread crumbs.
*Purchase fresh or properly cared for shrimp.
name: SHRIMP STUFFED EGGPLANT
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. white cooking wine liquid crab boil
1/4 tsp. red pepper dash of Tabasco sauce
1 egg, beaten dash of Worcestershire sauce

individualIngredient: olive oil angel hair spaghetti Parmesan cheese Mozzarella cheese, grated
recipeInstructions: Saute mushrooms and garlic in olive oil.  Break whole tomatoes with a fork and add with crushed tomatoes to mushrooms and garlic. Add basil and let simmer for 30 minutes.
Cook spaghetti.  Serve tomato mixture over spaghetti, sprinkled with Mozzarella cheese.  Top with Parmesan cheese.
name: HERB VERMICELLI
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. olive oil angel hair spaghetti Parmesan cheese Mozzarella cheese, grated

individualIngredient: chopped fresh parsley pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Melt margarine in a saucepan over medium heat.  Add garlic, saute 1 minute.  Stri in flour.  Gradually add milk, stirring with a wire whisk until blended; cook 8 minutes or until thickened stirring constantly.  Stir in cream cheese, cook 2 minutes.
Add 1 cup Parmesan cheese, stirring constantly until it melts. Pour over hot fettuccine; toss well.  Top with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan, parsley and pepper.  Yields 4 servings.
name: LIGHT FETTUCCINE ALFREDO
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp. chopped fresh parsley pepper to taste

individualIngredient: red hot pepper or fresh hot red pepper
recipeInstructions: Soak black-eyed peas overnight or at least 10 hours.  Cover with water.  Drain water.  In large saucepan, place peas and cover with water.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 1 hour or until peas are tender.  Adjust seasoning; remove hot pepper. Serve as a side dish with chicken or fish or as part of a vegetarian meal with rice or pasta.
name: BLACK-EYED PEAS ITALIAN STYLE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. dried black-eyed peas, picked over
1/4 lb. bacon or Canadian bacon, chopped
1 dried red hot pepper or fresh hot red pepper

recipeInstructions: Coat medium pan with oil and melt butter.  If using onion, saute 2 minutes.  Add noodles and saute until golden color.  Add bulgur and water or broth.  Water or broth must be boiling hot before using.  Add salt and pepper.  If using currants, add along with bulgur.  Bring to boil and lower to simmer for 10 minutes or until water is absorbed.  Sprinkle with pine nuts before serving. Makes 4 servings, 1 cup each.  Bulgur is a very nutritious food. It is a good meat substitute if served with beans to make complete protein.
name: BULGUR PILAF

individualIngredient: mild or sharp Cheddar cheese or more if you like
recipeInstructions: Cook macaroni as directed; drain.  In saucepan, melt butter; remove from heat.  Blend in flour, salt and mustard.  Add milk. Heat, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens a little and is smooth.  Add most of the cheese (save some for the top).  Heat until melted, stirring constantly.  Combine cooked macaroni with sauce in a 2-quart casserole, top with remaining cheese and paprika.  Bake at 375° about 20 to 25 minutes or until nicely browned and bubbly.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.
name: BAKED MACARONI AND CHEESE
recipeIngredient: 2 c. mild or sharp Cheddar cheese or more if you like

recipeInstructions: Combine macaroni, hot water and evaporated milk in 2-quart casserole.  Microwave uncovered on High for 12 minutes or until macaroni is soft and most of liquid has evaporated, stirring twice.  Stir in 1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese.  Microwave on High for 1 minute or until cheese has melted.  Season to taste with minced fresh chives and herbs.  Serves 4.
name: MICROWAVE EASY MACARONI AND CHEESE

recipeInstructions: Wash off pinto beans.  Let soak in water about 2 hours, then cook in clean water until soft and then drain.  While beans are cooking, shred cheese and slice pepperoni into thin slices.  Also fry up in a skillet your ground beef.  Drain the beef really good. When beans are ready, you use a casserole dish to layer your ingredients.  First put some sauce on bottom of dish, then beans, then pepperoni, then cheese.  Top with sauce and continue. Process until all is finished.  Bake at 350° until all is melted together and hot about 30 minutes.
name: PINTO BEAN PIZZA
recipeIngredient: 1 jar Prego tomato sauce or homemade

recipeInstructions: Do not drain beans.  Brown beef and onion flakes.  In a large casserole, put beans, ketchup, mustard, sugar and meat.  Mix well and bake 1 hour at 350° (uncovered).
name: RANCHO BEANS

individualIngredient: sugar salt optional pepper to taste
fresh or canned tomatoes, peeled and sliced
recipeInstructions: Heat oil in heavy duty saucepan, add garlic, onion, eggplant, zucchini and green pepper; saute vegetables until they are barely tender.  Add seasoning, mixing well.  Add tomatoes and simmer until tender, about 20 to 25 minutes.
name: RATATOUILLE
recipeIngredient: 1 sweet green pepper, sliced into rings
1 tsp. sugar salt optional pepper to taste
4 medium fresh or canned tomatoes, peeled and sliced

individualIngredient: dried kidney beans, rinsed and soaked overnight covered in water, rinse
Tony Chachere creole seasoning sausage smoked and/or ham hocks
recipeInstructions: Brown sausage or ham hocks.  Saute chopped vegetables in the drippings and place all the ingredients in a large pot.  Cover ingredients with water.

Two cooking methods:  1) Stove top:  Cook at slow boil.  Simmer for several hours (1 1/2 to 2) until beans are soft. 2) Oven:  Must use cast-iron pot with cover.  Cook in oven 200° to 400° for several hours until beans are soft.  Serve over rice.  Feeds 8 to 10.
name: RED BEANS AND RICE
recipeIngredient: 4 c. dried kidney beans, rinsed and soaked overnight covered in water, rinse
1 Tbsp. Tony Chachere creole seasoning sausage smoked and/or ham hocks

individualIngredient: butter or margarine, cut in pieces
recipeInstructions: Mix ingredients all together.  Pour in 1 1/2-quart baking dish.  Bake 1 hour in preheated 350° oven.
name: RICE CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 stick butter or margarine, cut in pieces

individualIngredient: raw white rice or brown rice
boiling water or low fat chicken broth white pepper and salt to taste vegetable cooking spray
recipeInstructions: Serves 4 people.  Coat a medium saucepan with cooking spray. Melt butter over medium heat.  Add noodles constantly stirring over low heat until noodles become golden brown.  Add rice.  Coat with butter.  Meanwhile bring water or broth to a full boil.  Add at once to rice.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Put on a tight fitting lid and simmer until water is absorbed.  If brown rice is used, add more water and cook longer.
Turn off heat.  Let the rice stand from 10 to 30 minutes. Stir and serve.  Rice always needs to rest before it is served.
name: RICE PILAF
recipeIngredient: 1 c. raw white rice or brown rice
2 c. boiling water or low fat chicken broth white pepper and salt to taste vegetable cooking spray

individualIngredient: pinto beans, soaked overnight in water, rinsed and drained
canned or fresh tomatoes, finely chopped
recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients except the cheese in a large pot.  Cover with water.  Bring to a slow boil.  Cook until beans are soft (1 1/2 to 2 hours), replenishing water as needed.
When beans are soft, add cheese.  Cook, stirring constantly until cheese is melted.  Serve.  Great as a meal with cornbread. Feeds 6 to 10.
name: SAVORY PINTO BEANS
recipeIngredient: 4 c. pinto beans, soaked overnight in water, rinsed and drained
2 c. canned or fresh tomatoes, finely chopped

recipeInstructions: Heat all ingredients to boiling in 10-inch skillet, breaking up tomatoes and stirring frequently.  Reduce heat.   Cover and simmer about 10 minutes or until liquid is almost absorbed.  Makes 4 servings.
One serving: 235 calories; 1 gram fat; 12 grams protein; 0 miligrams cholesterol; 57 grams carbohydrates, 580 miligrams sodium.
name: SPICY RICE WITH BLACK-EYED PEAS

individualIngredient: flour dash of salt and pepper
recipeInstructions: Split and wash green peppers.  Take out seeds; drain.  Mix half and half, flour, eggs, salt and pepper.

Mix cheeses together; reserve 1/3 cup.  Start layers in casserole dish with peppers, cheese and milk mixture in that order.  Pour can of tomato sauce over layers and sprinkle remaining cheese on top.  Place in 350° oven for 1 hour 15 minutes or until set and golden brown.
name: CHILI RELLENO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/3 c. flour dash of salt and pepper

individualIngredient: whole wheat bread crumbs or cubes
diced apples apple juice enough to moisten salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.  Use to stuff turkey or press into oiled casserole dish.  Cover and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
name: BREAD STUFFIN'
recipeIngredient: 5 c. whole wheat bread crumbs or cubes
1/2 c. diced apples apple juice enough to moisten salt and pepper to taste
1 c. chopped walnuts stir in last

recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, toss together the bread cubes or crumbs, giblets, almonds, sunflower seeds, celery and onion.  In a small bowl, combine the melted butter, chicken broth and Spike or seasoning salt.  Pour over the bread cubes mixture and toss to combine well.  Place in a buttered baking dish and bake, covered with foil for the last hour the poultry is cooking.  If you want crunchy stuffing, remove the foil for last half hour of baking. Serves 4 to 6.
name: NUTTY STUFFING
recipeIngredient: 6 c. dry bread cubes or crumbs
1 c. giblets, cooked and cut up
2 Tbsp. Spike or any seasoning salt

individualIngredient: margarine may leave out plain or cheese Ritz crackers, crumbled to cover top of casserole.
recipeInstructions: (This recipe will double well.  Bake in 9 x 13-inch pan.)

Take half the can of mushroom soup and spread on bottom of a 1 or 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Next, layer the asparagus, then eggs, almonds and the rest of the soup.  Spread it on top.  Sprinkle the crumbled crackers on top.  Dot the 1/4 stick of margarine on top of the crackers.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until bubbly.
name: ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1 large can green long stem asparagus
1/4 stick margarine may leave out plain or cheese Ritz crackers, crumbled to cover top of casserole.

individualIngredient: olive oil or more if needed
recipeInstructions: Heat olive oil; add minced garlic cloves and saute for a few minutes.  (Do not brown!)  Add peppers and bake at 250° for about 45 minutes, turning and basting often.  Cool and store in jar in refrigerator.  Use in salads, stews, soups, sandwiches, pizza, etc.
name: ROASTED BELL PEPPERS
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. olive oil or more if needed

individualIngredient: may also use green or mix the two
garlic, finely chopped or to taste
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 450°.  Wash peppers and drain well.  Place peppers on cookie sheet and bake about 20 minutes or until the skin of the peppers become blistered and charred.  Turn the peppers every 5 minutes with tongs.  Place hot peppers in a large kettle; cover kettle and let them stand 15 minutes.  Peel off charred skin with sharp knife.  Cut each pepper into quarters.  Remove the ribs and seeds and cut out any dark spots.  In large bowl, combine oil, lemon juice, salt and garlic.  Put the pepper mixture, with or without anchovy fillets, into a 1-quart dish or jar, covered. Refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Serve as an appetizer, a side dish or use in a tossed salad.  Makes 1 quart.  Excellent with lasagne or other Italian meals.
name: ROASTED PEPPERS SICILIANO
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 lb. may also use green or mix the two
3 cloves garlic, finely chopped or to taste

individualIngredient: shredded Colby cheese or reduced fat Cheddar cheese
recipeInstructions: Cook broccoli in a small amount of water for about 6 to 8 minutes; drain.  Place broccoli in a lightly greased 9-inch pie pan.  You may use Pam if desired.  Sprinkle with green pepper, onion and cheese.  Set aside.  Blend remaining ingredients in a blender for 15 seconds or until smooth.  Pour over broccoli mixture.  Bake at 375° for 25 to 30 minutes or until set.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.  Yields 6 servings.
Cauliflower may be used instead of broccoli.
name: EASY BROCCOLI QUICHE
recipeIngredient: 1 c. shredded Colby cheese or reduced fat Cheddar cheese

recipeInstructions: If using fresh broccoli, clean well and cut into bite size pieces.  Steam fresh or frozen broccoli until barely tender, keeping the bright green color.  In a small pan, melt butter and stir in basil.  Allow basil to cook in butter over very low heat for about 5 minutes. Just before serving, toss the broccoli gently with the basil butter.  Yields 4 servings.
name: STEAMED BROCCOLI WITH BASIL BUTTER

recipeInstructions: Steam carrots.  In a 10-inch skillet, melt butter.  Add onions and cook over moderate heat.  Cover until they are transparent, about 10 minutes.  Add apple slices and cover.   Continue to cook, just until tender, but still hold their shape, about 5 minutes, depends on variety of apples used.  Drain carrots and add carrots to skillet; stir in lemon juice, salt and pepper; reheat.  Yields 6 servings.
name: CARROTS PLUS
recipeIngredient: 2 medium onions cut into thin strips
2 medium apples, pared and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Beat eggs one at a time and pour into ingredients.  Add milk, vanilla, melted margarine and corn; mix well.  Pour into baking dish and bake at 350° for 1 hour.
name: CORN PUDDING

recipeInstructions: Stir ingredients together. Pour into small casserole.  Bake at 400° for 1 hour.
name: FAVORITE CORN PUDDING

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients; place in a greased casserole (9 x 13-inch) dish.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender.  Serves 6 to 8.
name: GARLIC POTATOES

individualIngredient: margarine salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Peel and slice potatoes into round pieces.  Put in casserole dish mixed with sliced onions.  Add soup and milk with salt and pepper; pour over potatoes.  Top with pieces of margarine.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
name: POTATO CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 stick margarine salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: all-purpose flour salt and pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Will need 5-quart casserole.  Place a layer of potatoes and onions in casserole dish; sprinkle with flour, salt and pepper. Dot with butter.  Repeat; top with a layer of potatoes.  Dot with butter.  Add enough hot milk to cover, almost the last layer of potatoes.  Bake covered in preheated moderate oven (375°) for 45 minutes.  Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer.  Add cheese the last 5 minutes.
name: SCALLOPED POTATOES
recipeIngredient: 6 Tbsp. all-purpose flour salt and pepper to taste

individualIngredient: bow tie pasta, cooked and drained
recipeInstructions: Heat oil in pan.  Saute bacon, green onions and rosemary for 3 minutes.  Add frozen peas and cook covered for 5 minutes.  Drain. Process until pureed the cheese and milk.  Add to cooked pasta and bacon mixture.  Toss to coat.  Serves 4.
name: ROSEMARY PEAS AND PASTA
recipeIngredient: 4 oz. Canadian style bacon, cut in
3/4 lb. bow tie pasta, cooked and drained

individualIngredient: pkg. frozen spinach, chopped, defrosted and squeezed dry
recipeInstructions: Saute mushrooms, garlic and onions (until onions are limp) in artichoke marinade.  Stir in drained and dry spinach, soup and sour cream, eggs, oregano, nutmeg, pepper and lemon juice until well blended.

Spoon half of this mixture in greased glass casserole or pan, then layer on top of the artichokes.  Spoon the remainder of spinach mixture on top of artichokes.  Cover the top with croutons and bake at 325° for 35 to 40 minutes or until custard is set. Let stand a few minutes before serving.  Serves 4 to 6.
name: SPINACH-ARTICHOKE CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 2  10 oz. pkg. frozen spinach, chopped, defrosted and squeezed dry

individualIngredient: each diced onion, carrots and red bell pepper
recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Melt 1 tablespoon butter and brush on cut surfaces of squash.  Place cut side down in a large baking dish without crowding.  Add enough water to cover bottom of pan.  Bake 30 minutes.  In a medium skillet, melt remaining butter over medium heat.  Saute remaining ingredients 5 minutes only stirring frequently.  Spoon vegetables into squash halves.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until squash is tender.  Serve 4.
name: AUTUMN STUFFED SQUASH
recipeIngredient: 2 small acorn squash, halved and seeded
1/2 c. each diced onion, carrots and red bell pepper
1/2 c. thickly sliced zucchini and mushrooms

recipeInstructions: Cook bacon in a large skillet until crisp; remove bacon, reserve 1 tablespoon drippings in skillet.  Crumble bacon and set aside.  Saute squash and onion in reserved drippings 6 minutes or until tender.  Stir in sour cream and seasonings.  Spoon into serving dish; sprinkle with crumbled bacon.  Yields 8 servings.
name: SKILLET SQUASH

recipeInstructions: Slice and steam yellow summer squash.  Make sauce in large bowl.  Mix well.  Add squash and mix.  Place in casserole/baking dish.  Top with crumbs; dabs of butter (optional).  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.  Serves 6 to 8.
name: SUMMER SQUASH CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: Cracker Barrel cheese, grated seasoning salt buttered cracker crumbs
recipeInstructions: Combine squash, onion, salt and sugar.  Simmer with small amount of water for 20 minutes.  Drain well and mash with potato masher.  Add eggs, melted butter, flour, milk and cheese.  Add seasoned salt to taste.  Bake in buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole for 30 minutes.  Top with buttered crumbs.  Bake 10 minutes longer.  Bake uncovered.  This can be stored in refrigerator unbaked for 2 or 3 days.  Freezes well unbaked.  Serves 10 to 12.
name: SQUASH SOUFFLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. Cracker Barrel cheese, grated seasoning salt buttered cracker crumbs

individualIngredient: Pepperidge Farm crumbs pinch of salt to taste pepper to taste
recipeInstructions: Cook squash; drain, mash and add remaining ingredients, adding sour cream last.  Pour into a 2-quart casserole dish and bake in 350° oven until brown and bubbly.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.
name: VELMA'S SQUASH CASSEROLE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pkg. Pepperidge Farm crumbs pinch of salt to taste pepper to taste

individualIngredient: potatoes, peeled, quartered and cut into
cabbage or bok choy greens, coarsely chopped
sea salt optional fresh ground black pepper
recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Place all vegetables in heavy oven-proof casserole with lid.  Dot with butter.  Sprinkle with parsley, Spike, sea salt and pepper.  Cover and place in oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Toss with additional butter, if desired, and serve with salad. Serves 4.
name: BAKED GARDEN VEGETABLES
recipeIngredient: 1 c. carrots, cut into fine matchsticks
2 c. potatoes, peeled, quartered and cut into
2 large zucchini, quartered and cut into
2 c. cabbage or bok choy greens, coarsely chopped
1/2 tsp. sea salt optional fresh ground black pepper

recipeInstructions: Cook sweet potatoes; peel and slice crosswise, about 3/8-inch thick.  Spread in a greased shallow 1 1/2-quart casserole.  Cut margarine into flour and brown sugar as you would in making a pie crust.  Add pepper, milk and ground nuts; mix well.  Spread over potato slices.  Broil about 6-inches from heat until bubbly and carmelized, about 7 minutes.  Yields 6 servings.
name: SWEET POTATO CRISP

recipeInstructions: Cook 2 small packages of frozen mixed vegetables according to directions on packages.  Don't overcook.  Drain and mix with above. Spread in 9 x 13-inch baking pan.  Crush Ritz crackers and spread on top.  Melt stick of margarine and pour on top.  Bake 20 minutes at 350°.
name: VEGETABLE CASSEROLE

recipeInstructions: Combine and cover with marinade for at least 4 hours.
name: VONDERFUL VEGGIES
recipeIngredient: 1 c. celery in bite sized pieces

recipeInstructions: Mix together and chill for 2 hours.
Roll up as you would a jelly roll.  Cut into 1-inch slices and drop into hot syrup.  Cook in 350° oven until golden brown or about 45 minutes.
name: APPLE ROLLS

recipeInstructions: Mix together all dry ingredients; set aside.  Mash bananas. Add pineapple, oil and eggs, slightly beaten.  Add all ingredients and mix well.  Spoon into muffin tins 2/3 full.
Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.  Makes about 28 muffins or less.  They freeze very well.
name: ALICE'S HEALTH BANANA OATMEAL MUFFINS

individualIngredient: frozen unsweetened apple juice concentrate, thawed
recipeInstructions: Mash bananas.  Mix in egg white, apple juice concentrate and melted butter.  Add flour and baking soda; mix well.  Stir in walnuts.  Pour into an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch loaf pan that has been sprayed with nonstick vegetable spray.
Bake at 325° for 45 to 50 minutes.  Leave in pan for 10 minutes and remove; cool.  Wrap in plastic wrap overnight so the banana flavor will develop.
One slice equals 1 fruit exchange, 1/2 bread exchange, 1/2 fat exchange.
name: BANANA BREAD
recipeIngredient: 3/4 c. frozen unsweetened apple juice concentrate, thawed

recipeInstructions: Mash bananas with fork.  Add beaten egg, sugar and margarine; mix well.  Add remaining ingredients.  Pour into greased loaf pan or 2 small loaf pans.  Bake at 325° for 1 hour.  Very moist and delicious.
name: PATS BANANA BREAD

individualIngredient: raisins or other chopped, dried fruit
recipeInstructions: Combine bran, flour and baking soda.  Combine butter and honey. Melt together in saucepan or microwave.  Combine buttermilk, eggs, butter and honey together; beat well.  Add to dry ingredients. Stir just to moisten dry ingredients.  Add raisins.  Divide among 12 greased or paper lined muffin cups.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
name: BRAN MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. raisins or other chopped, dried fruit

individualIngredient: flour White Lily or any other soft winter wheat flour
baking powder omit if using self-rising flour
salt omit if using self-rising flour
buttermilk or less depending on humidity
recipeInstructions: Mix flour (sift if desired) together with shortening and work to consistency of cornmeal.  I use a pastry blender.  Add other ingredients and then add buttermilk; stir in well.  Turn out on floured surface (wax paper saves a mess).  Knead only until it can be rolled.  Roll using rolling pin to 1/3-inch thickness.  Cut out biscuits with cutter.  Bake on greased pan for 8 to 10 minutes at 450° oven.  Makes 1 1/2 dozen.  This will be a hit with your yankee friends!
name: SOUTHERN BUTTERMILK BISCUITS
recipeIngredient: 2 c. flour White Lily or any other soft winter wheat flour
2 tsp. baking powder omit if using self-rising flour
1/4 tsp. salt omit if using self-rising flour
1 c. buttermilk or less depending on humidity

recipeInstructions: Blend eggs, margarine, sour cream and corn.  Add salt and muffin mix.  Pour into greased 9 x 12-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  This is best when served hot.
name: CORNY CORNBREAD
recipeIngredient: 1 c. sour cream or plain yogurt

recipeInstructions: Bake at 400° about 45 minutes.  Bake in 2 pans.
name: MEXICAN CORNBREAD

individualIngredient: chopped nuts juice and rind of
recipeInstructions: In mixing bowl, beat egg.  Add sugar and oil.  In 1-cup measure, squeeze orange to extract juice.  Grate rind.  Fill cup with boiling water to make 1 cup liquid.  Add to sugar mixture. Add dry ingredients that have been sifted together.  Blend quickly. Add whole cranberries and nuts.  Pour in greased and floured pan. Makes 1 large loaf or 2 small loaves.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Turn off oven and let set 10 minutes.
name: BOBBIE JEAN'S CRANBERRY BREAD
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. chopped nuts juice and rind of

recipeInstructions: Cream butter, sugar, egg yolks, one at a time.  Add lemon extract and soda water.  In a separate bowl, mix raisins and nuts thoroughly in flour.  Add this to butter mix.  Beat egg whites and fold into mixture.
Divide into 3 greased loaf pans.  Bake 2 1/2 hours at 250° until knife comes out clean.
name: LEMON LOAVES

recipeInstructions: (If using self-rising flour, omit baking powder and salt.)

Combine oil, sugar, egg and milk.  Sift together dry ingredients; add to egg mixture and stir only to combine.  Bake in muffin tins for 20 to 25 minutes.  When baked, dip in melted butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
name: MUFFINS THAT TASTE LIKE DOUGHNUTS

recipeInstructions: Combine oatmeal and buttermilk; set aside for 5 minutes.  Add eggs and sugar; mix well.  Mix together flour, salt, soda and baking powder.  Stir all together adding oil last.   Fill muffin pans half full and bake at 400° for 20 minutes.  Excellent with honey butter.
name: OATMEAL DINNER ROLLS

recipeInstructions: *If yogurt is used, add 2 tablespoons water.

Cream butter.  Gradually add sugar.  Beat eggs, one at a time and add to sugar and butter. Combine dry ingredients alternating with buttermilk.  Stir in pears, vanilla, nutmeg or mace.  Pour into greased and floured pan (9 x 5 x 3-inch) loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
Apples may be substituted for pears.  Add to batter 1 teaspoon nutmeg, 1 teaspoon allspice and 2 teaspoons cinnamon.
name: JANE'S PEAR BREAD

recipeInstructions: Grease two small loaf pans and line with wax paper.  Mix dry ingredients.  Sift if you wish.  Add oil, eggs, pumpkin and water to dry ingredients.  Mix well at medium speed.  Add dates and nuts.  This batter is thin.  Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.  Truly outstanding.
Taken from "Think Christmas" published by Junior League of Washington, D.C.
name: MRS. MONDALE'S PUMPKIN BREAD

individualIngredient: frozen unsweetened apple juice concentrate, thawed
recipeInstructions: Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Combine egg whites, buttermilk, vanilla, apple juice concentrate and pumpkin.  Add to the dry ingredients.   Stir until just moistened.  Fold in nuts.  Spray muffin tins with nonstick vegetable coating.  Pour in batter.  Bake at 375° for 20 minutes. Yields 12 muffins.  One muffin equals 1/2 fruit exchange, 1 bread exchange.
name: PUMPKIN NUT MUFFINS
recipeIngredient: 3/4 c. frozen unsweetened apple juice concentrate, thawed

recipeInstructions: Slice bananas into blender.  Whirl until pureed.  Combine flours, wheat germ, sesame seed, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Cream sugar and butter until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg and vanilla.  Beat in bananas until smooth.  Add flour mixture until well blended.  Stir in zucchini and add raisins.  Turn into well-greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pan.  Bake in preheated 350° oven 55 to 60 minutes or until tester comes out clean.  Cool in pan 10 minutes.  Remove to wire rack to complete cooling.  Yields 1 loaf.
name: ZUCCHINI BANANA BREAD

recipeInstructions: Beat eggs until foamy.  Add oil, sugar, zucchini and vanilla; mix well.  In separate bowl, mix flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt.  Add to above mixture.  Mix well, then add nuts.  Makes 2 loaves.  Bake at 325° 1 hour until done (toothpick comes out dry).
name: ZUCCHINI BREAD

individualIngredient: pumpkin, cooked and mashed or canned
recipeInstructions: *May use butter, margarine or canola oil.

Sift together dry ingredients. Beat egg yolks.  Combine with milk, shortening and pumpkin.  Add to dry ingredients.   Beat egg whites until stiff.  Fold into batter.  Pour onto hot waffle iron. Sprinkle with a few chopped nuts and bake.  Makes about 8 waffles, depending on size of iron.  Serve with warm maple syrup.
name: PUMPKIN NUT WAFFLES
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. pumpkin, cooked and mashed or canned

recipeInstructions: In large bowl, stir together flour, oats, baking powder, cinnamon and salt; set aside.  In small bowl, stir together eggs, milk, butter and brown sugar.  Add to flour mixture; stir until blended.  Pour batter onto grids of preheated lightly greased waffle iron (amount will vary according to size of waffle iron). Sprinkle a few chopped pecans on top of batter; close lid quickly; do not open during baking.  Remove cooked waffles and serve with maple syrup; fresh fruit and yogurt, etc.  Yields 12 waffles (4-inch squares).
name: OATMEAL WAFFLES

recipeInstructions: Mix together dry ingredients.  Add honey, milk and water, then yolks and oil.  Beat until smooth.  Fold in whites.  Bake on medium heat waffle iron.
name: WONDERFUL WHOLE WHEAT WAFFLES

recipeInstructions: Mix well together flour, oil, water and salt.  Roll between 2 sheets of wax paper one half at a time for pie pastry.  To keep flaky crust, don't handle a lot.
To bake crust alone before adding filling, line pie pan with pastry.  Prick and bake at 450° for 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown.
name: OIL CRUST

recipeInstructions: Combine flour and salt in large mixing bowl.  Cut in shortening (do not use hands) until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle water evenly over surface.  Stir with fork until all dry particles are moistened.  Shape into a ball; divide into 2 parts. Roll each into a 12-inch circle.  Fit into 9-inch pie plate and crimp edges.  Yields 2 crusts for 9-inch pies or for pie with top crust.
name: STANDARD PIE CRUST

recipeInstructions: Combine cream cheese and butter; blend well.  Stir in flour. Refrigerate 30 minutes.  Press dough into bottom and up sides of 9-inch pie pan.  Flute edge as desired.  Chill until needed for filling.
name: PRESS 'N BAKE CREAM CHEESE CRUST
recipeIngredient: 3 oz. cream cheese at room temperature

individualIngredient: tart apples, pared, cored and thinly sliced Granny Smith's great
cinnamon dash of ground nutmeg pastry for
recipeInstructions: Sprinkle apple slices with lemon juice; mix.  Combine sugar, flour, spices and dash of salt.  Mix with apples.  Line 9-inch pie plate with pastry.  Fill with apple mixture.  Adjust top crust; brush with milk.  Sprinkle sugar until lightly covered, then cinnamon.  Slit top crust for steam to escape.  Bake at 400° for 50 minutes or until done.
name: APPLE PIE
recipeIngredient: 10 c. tart apples, pared, cored and thinly sliced Granny Smith's great
1 tsp. cinnamon dash of ground nutmeg pastry for

recipeInstructions: Melt butter or oleo in baking dish.  Cut fruit over butter. (Sprinkle cinnamon over blueberries.)  Mix sauce in bowl with flour, sugar and milk; pour sauce over fruit.  Bake at 375° about 30 minutes.  Can top apples with brown sugar, butter, flour, nut topping (crumbled together).  (For two people, use 1/2 cup instead of 3/4 cup above.)
name: QUICK APPLE CRISP/OR BLUEBERRY

recipeInstructions: Combine flour, sugar, spices and salt.  Add apples and lemon juice.  Stir and combine.  Place in a 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.  Dot with butter.  Roll pastry 1-inch longer than top of pan.  Cut vents.  Trim and flute edge just inside of pan.  Bake at 425° about 50 minutes until pie is brown and apples are tender.
A 9 x 12-inch baking pan can be used.  Add about 12 cups sliced apples and adjust sweetness to taste.
name: DEEP DISH APPLE PIE

recipeInstructions: Mix Streusel ingredients with hand until crumbly.

Heat oven to 325°.  Grease pie plates 10 x 1 1/2-inch.  Mix apples and spices; turn into pie plate.  Beat remaining ingredients except Streusel until smooth, 15 seconds in blender on High or 1 minute with hand beater.  Pour over apples and sprinkle with Streusel.  Bake until knife inserted in center comes out clean 55 to 60 minutes.
name: IMPOSSIBLE FRENCH APPLE PIE

individualIngredient: pkg. sweet cooking chocolate, broken into pieces
recipeInstructions: Combine sugar, salt and corn syrup in a small saucepan.  Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved; boil 2 minutes.  Remove from heat; add chocolate and butter.  Stir until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth.  Cool.

Gradually pour chocolate mixture over eggs, stirring constantly.  Add vanilla and pecans; mix well.  Pour into pastry shell. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes; cool.  Top with whipped cream to serve.  Yields 1 (9-inch) pie.
name: BROWNIE PECAN PIE
recipeIngredient: 1  4 oz. pkg. sweet cooking chocolate, broken into pieces

recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients except coconut; beat on low speed for 3 minutes.  Pour into a 9-inch greased pie pan.  Let set in pan 5 minutes, then add coconut.
This pie forms its own crust.  Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
name: AMAZING COCONUT PIE

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 325°.  In a large bowl, combine sugar and cornstarch.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Blend in lemon juice and butter; stir in lemon rind.

Pour mixture into pie shell.  Bake pie until puffed and golden and a thin knife inserted into pie about 1-inch from the edge comes out clean, about 50 minutes.  Cool completely before serving.  Yields 1 (9-inch) pie.
name: CHESS PIE

recipeInstructions: Set egg whites with cream of tartar and vanilla in mixing bowl aside in room.

In saucepan, mix 1 1/2 cups sugar, cornstarch, flour and salt. Gradually add hot water, stirring constantly.  Cook and stir over high heat until mixture comes to a boil.  Reduce heat; cook and stir 8 minutes longer. Remove from heat.  Stir small amount hot mixture into egg yolks, then return to hot mixture.  Bring to a boil.  Cook 4 minutes more.  Keep stirring.  Add butter, lemon peel, slowly add lemon juice; mix well.  Pour into cool shell. Beat egg whites with vanilla and cream of tartar until soft peaks form.  Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff and glossy peaks form and all sugar is dissolved.  Spread Meringue over hot filling, sealing to edge of pastry.  Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes or until Meringue is golden.  Cool.
name: LEMON MERINGUE PIE

individualIngredient: coffee ice cream vanilla can be used
recipeInstructions: Mix crushed Oreo's and margarine.  Place in 9-inch pie plate and press onto bottom and sides.  Place in freezer for 30 minutes or longer.  Spoon ice cream into shell and smooth surface.  Place back in freezer until ice cream is very hard.

Cook cocoa, sugar, milk and syrup at a boil for about 1 minute. Stir constantly.  Add butter and vanilla.  Spread 1 cup over frozen ice cream and return to freezer until hardened.  Store remaining cup for future use.  Yields 1 (9-inch) pie.
name: LE PIE
recipeIngredient: 1 qt. coffee ice cream vanilla can be used

recipeInstructions: Heat oven to 350°.  In a medium bowl, beat eggs well.  Add sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, flour, vanilla and salt to eggs; beat until well combined.  Fold in melted butter and chopped pecans.  Pour into unbaked pie shell.  Arrange pecan halves on top.  Bake until filling is set (center of the pie will stay firm when pie is shaken gently), about 55 to 60 minutes.  Cool completely before serving.  Yields 1 (9-inch) pie.
name: PECAN PIE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. light brown sugar, firmly packed

recipeInstructions: Save egg whites for meringue.
Bake pie shells.  Mix and put in cooled pie shells, powdered sugar and peanut butter (save 1/4 cup for topping).

Filling:  Combine cornstarch, sugar and salt in a double boiler and add egg yolks and milk; cook until thickened, stirring constantly with a whisk.  Add margarine and vanilla.  Stir.  Pour into baked pie shells.  Top with meringue made from the 4 egg whites.  Sprinkle with topping you saved.  Bake at 375° until brown.  Serve.
name: PEANUT BUTTER PIE

recipeInstructions: Spray 9-inch pie plate with oil.  Place all ingredients in blender in order.  Blend until smooth.  Pour in pie plate. Sprinkle with topping.
Mix together with a fork.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes.
name: PUMPKIN PIE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Cream sugar and butter with mixer on medium low.  Add remaining ingredients; blend well.  Pour into prepared crust.  Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until knife inserted into center comes out clean.  Cool on wire rack.  Good served chilled and topped with whipped cream.  Yields 1 (9-inch) pie.
name: PUMPKIN CHESS PIE
recipeIngredient: 1/4 tsp. each ginger, nutmeg and cloves

recipeInstructions: Mix eggs, sugar and milk.  Add remaining ingredients.  Pour into pie crust.  Bake 15 minutes at 425°.  Reduce heat to 350° and bake 25 to 30 minutes.
name: RHUBARB PIE
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp. melted butter pinch of salt

recipeInstructions: Mix fruit together. Mix cake dough together and combine with fruit.  Pour into wax paper lined well greased pans and pack well.
Bake 1 3/4 hours at 300° or until done.  Keeps good in freezer.  This makes 2 large loaf pans or several smaller pans.  I prefer smaller pans.
name: BRAZIL NUT FRUIT CAKE FOR BRAZIL NUT LOVERS
recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 c. orange peel or candied pineapple

recipeInstructions: Cream Crisco, sugar and eggs for 1 minute at high speed.  Add 1 cup flour beating 1 minute.  Add 2 other cups alternately with milk.  Add flavoring and bake 1 hour at 325° then turn heat up to 350° for 10 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
name: BUTTERNUT POUND CAKE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.
Crust:  Combine graham cracker crumbs with sugar and 1/3 cup melted butter.  Pat into sides and bottom of 9 1/2-inch spring-form pan.  Set aside.

Beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Add 1 cup of the brown sugar and continue to beat for 3 minutes.  Add eggs and beat until thoroughly blended.  Stir in vanilla.  In a small bowl, knead together 1/2 cup softened butter, 1/4 cup flour, 1 cup brown sugar and pecans.  Pour cream cheese mixture into crust and drop the pecan mixture lightly over top of it.  Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.  Let cool completely.
name: BUTTER-PRALINE CHEESECAKE

recipeInstructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine all dry ingredients in the pan, the cake is to be baked in the same pan as it was mixed in.  Stir with a fork until well mixed.  Make three depressions in the dry ingredients, one hole for oil, one for vinegar, one for vanilla, then pour 1 cup water over all the ingredients and stir with fork until well blended.  Bake 30 minutes.  Use 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
name: CRAZY CHOCOLATE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Cream 3 sticks margarine and softened cream cheese.  Add sugar a little at a time.  Add eggs, one at  a time, beating mixture after each addition.
Sift together 3 times, 3 cups of plain flour.  Add salt.  Add to mixture a little at a time.   Add vanilla and lemon flavoring.
Prepare tube pan.  Line bottom with waxed paper.  Sprinkle nuts on bottom.  Pour in batter.  Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.
name: CREAM CHEESE POUND CAKE

recipeInstructions: Cream butter, cream cheese and sugar.  Add eggs alternately with flour and salt to creamed mixture.  Add vanilla.
Pour into greased and floured tube pan. Put in cold oven and bake at 300° for 1 hour 45 minutes.  Cool in pan.  Margarine may be used instead of butter.
name: CREAM CHEESE POUND CAKE

recipeInstructions: Coat fruits and nuts with the flour; mix well.  Set aside. Beat eggs and sugar together until smooth.  Mix fruits and nuts with eggs and sugar.  Pack with hands into 2 loaf pans.   Mixture will be very thick.
Bake at 275° for 1 1/2 hours or until brown and toothpick comes out clean.
name: FANNIE'S NUTTY FRUIT CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. candied cherries, sliced in half

recipeInstructions: Cream butter, sugar and Crisco.  Mix in eggs and beat well. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk.  Add flavorings.  Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours in tube pan greased and floured.  Do not preheat oven.
Combine and pour over hot cake.  Cool in pan.
name: FIVE FLAVOR POUND CAKE

individualIngredient: chopped nuts black walnuts are best
recipeInstructions: Cream sugar, margarine, and oil until fluffy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating until mixed.  Add flour and salt, alternating with the milk; beat until smooth.  Add nuts coated with flour and flavoring.  Pour into a greased and floured tube pan.
Bake at 325° for 1 hour 15 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted in cake comes out clean. Cool in pan 20 minutes, then invert onto plate.
name: IRIS' BROWN SUGAR MAPLE POUND CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1/2 c. chopped nuts black walnuts are best

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, oil and eggs.   Add flour, soda and salt.  Mix well and add fruit cocktail and vanilla.  Bake 45 minutes at 350°.
Topping:  Mix all ingredients together and boil 5 minutes. Pour over cake and top with coconut and nuts if desired.
name: FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE

recipeInstructions: Grease 9 x 13-inch pan with butter.  Layer coconut and pecans in bottom of pan.  Makes German chocolate cake mix as directed. Pour over coconut and pecans.  Mix cream cheese, sugar and butter. Spread over cake mix.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.
name: GERMAN CHOCOLATE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE

recipeInstructions: Cream margarine and shortening until fluffy.  Add sugar; beat well.  Beat in egg yolks.  Mix together flour and soda.  Add alternately with buttermilk.  Mix in vanilla.  Add nuts and coconut.  Fold in egg whites.  Pour into 3 prepared (9-inch) layer pans.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
Mix well and cover cake.
name: ITALIAN CREAM CAKE

recipeInstructions: Cream butter and Crisco.  Add sugar and beat well.  Add eggs one at a time.  Beat after each egg.  Add flour and milk; beat again.  Grease tube pan well and flour.  Put cake into oven while it is cold.  Turn oven to 300° and bake for 1 hour.  Turn oven up to 325°.  Bake for 30 minutes.
name: MOM'S COLD OVEN POUND CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix dry ingredients, then add shortening.  Add slightly beaten egg, vanilla and milk.  Dough will be stiff.  Spread over greased pans.  This recipe will make 4 (8-inch) pie pans or 3 (9-inch) pie pans.  Cakes are thin.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.  When cake is done, melt 2 tablespoons margarine or butter.  Brush each cake with margarine or butter.  Pour sweetened strawberries over each layer as they are assembled in layers.  Serve with whipping cream.
name: MRS. MURRAY STRAWBERRY SHORT CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix the cake ingredients and put into a greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.  While cake is baking, mix topping and apply to top of cake while hot.
name: MEXICAN FRUIT CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1  20 oz. can crushed pineapple unsweetened , undrained

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, sugar and soda.  Add pineapple (including juice) and eggs.  Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.  Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. (If Pyrex pan, bake at 300° for 35 minutes.)  Make holes in hot cake with fork.
Icing:  Mix ingredients together and spread on hot cake. Chill.
name: MEXICAN FRUIT CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 large can crushed pineapple with juice

individualIngredient: each: baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice
recipeInstructions: Blend together sugar, butter and eggs.  Add flour and spices alternately with buttermilk.  Add vanilla, nuts and prunes.  Use 2 (8-inch) round pans or 1 (9 x 13-inch) pan.  Grease and flour pans. Pour batter in pans.  Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until done and brown.  Remove from oven and use following icing.
For Icing:  Mix and boil all ingredients until soft ball forms in cold water.  Pour over cake while cake and icing are still very hot.
name: OLD FASHIONED PRUNE CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. each: baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice

recipeInstructions: Cream butter and sugar until smooth.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Dissolve soda in buttermilk and add to cream mixture.  Place flour in a large bowl.  Add dates, orange slices and nuts.  Stir to coat each piece.  Add flour mixture and coconut to creamed mixture.  Bake in a greased 9 or 10-inch tube pan at 250° for 2 1/2 hours.  Remove from oven.  Pour hot glaze over top of cake.  Let set in pan overnight.
Combine and pour over hot cake.
name: ORANGE SLICE CAKE

individualIngredient: each: ground cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon
recipeInstructions: Cream together sugar and shortening; add egg yolks and mix well.  Sift together all dry ingredients and add to mixture, alternating with milk.  Add 1 cup mashed potatoes.   Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites, add nuts and vanilla.  Pour batter into 1 (10-inch) pan (can use two 8 or 9-inch pans).  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Let cool.
For Icing:  Bring margarine, milk and cocoa to boil.  Pour over powdered sugar.  Beat until smooth.  Add vanilla.  Spread Icing over cooled cake.
name: POTATO CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp. each: ground cloves, nutmeg and cinnamon

individualIngredient: yellow cake mix, bake as directed on box sheet cake
boxes instant vanilla pudding, mix as directed
recipeInstructions: Using a large punch bowl, divide cake in half and crumble each half.  Pack half of crumbled cake in bottom of bowl in order.  Use half of each ingredient in layers.  Pudding, coconut, pineapple, cocktail, cherries, Cool Whip; top with pecans, layer again starting with cake first then in order as first.  Refrigerate. Best if leftover night before serving.
It serves a large crowd of people.
name: PUNCH BOWL CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 box yellow cake mix, bake as directed on box sheet cake
2 large boxes instant vanilla pudding, mix as directed

recipeInstructions: First Layer:  Mix flour, 1 package nut topping and oleo; pack in bottom of 13 x 9-inch dish.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Let cool.
Second Layer:  Beat cream cheese, sugar and 1 Cool Whip; spread on first layer.
Third Layer:  Mix pudding with 3 cups milk.  Spread on second layer.
Fourth Layer:  Spread 1 Cool Whip on third layer and sprinkle with other package chopped nuts.
name: SIN OR CHOCOLATE DELIGHT

individualIngredient: angel food cake I use Betty Crocker cake mix
crushed pineapple I use the heavy syrup , do not drain juice
recipeInstructions: Chill mixture in refrigerator until thick but not firm.  Whip 2 packages of Dream Whip with 1 cup milk, then add pineapple mixture to Dream Whip and blend.  Tear angel food cake into 1-inch pieces or smaller.  Line large mixing bowl with Saran Wrap, then put layer of cake, layer of pineapple mixture.  Repeat, adding layers (3 or 4 layers of each) ending with layer of mixture.  Chill until firm, then turn cake upside down.  Remove Saran Wrap and frost with 1 package of Dream Whip.  Cover with coconut.  Keep refrigerated until served.
name: SNO-BALL CAKE
recipeIngredient: 1 large angel food cake I use Betty Crocker cake mix
20 oz. crushed pineapple I use the heavy syrup , do not drain juice

recipeInstructions: Beat all the ingredients until smooth.  Add zucchini and mix together, then pour into tube pan.  Bake 1 hour 15 minutes.
name: ZUCCHINI CHOCOLATE CAKE

recipeInstructions: Mix first 3 ingredients and pat into 9 x 13-inch pan.
Mix remaining ingredients and pour into pan on top of cake batter.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
name: GOOEY BUTTER COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Melt butter and brown sugar in heavy saucepan.  Add pecans and bring to a boil.  Cook 2 minutes. Line greased 9 x 15-inch pan with graham crackers.  Spread with cooked mixture and bake at 300° for 10 minutes.
name: BETSY BLAKENSHIP'S REUNION SNACKS
recipeIngredient: 1 c. pecans, cut in large pieces

recipeInstructions: Mix all together at once and drop by teaspoon on no stick cookie sheet.  Bake at 375° for 8 minutes.
Mix with enough powdered sugar to make thick icing.  Makes 6 dozen.
name: CARROT COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Grease an 8-inch square pan.  Stir together the egg, brown sugar and vanilla.  Quickly stir in flour, baking soda and salt. Add nuts.  Spread in pan and bake at 350° for 18 to 20 minutes. (Cookies should be soft in center when taken from oven.  Leave in pan and cut.)  Makes 16 squares.
Instead of walnuts, try dates.
name: CHEWY WALNUT SQUARES

recipeInstructions: In a saucepan, melt the chocolate.  In a medium sized bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.  Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition.  Mix in vanilla and melted chocolate.

In a small bowl, stir together flour and salt and then stir into the sugar mixture.  Add nuts and chocolate chips (optional). Spoon into a greased 9-inch square baking pan.   Bake in preheated 375° oven about 30 minutes.  Cool and cut into squares.  Yields 16 to 24.
name: HAZELNUT BROWNIES

recipeInstructions: Cream first five ingredients.  Sift together; add flour, salt and soda.  Stir in oatmeal, nuts, chocolate chips and raisins. Drop by teaspoon on baking sheet.  Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.  Makes 3 1/2 dozen.
Variations:  Use butterscotch chips, sunflower seeds instead of nuts and chocolate chips.
name: MOM'S OATMEAL CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Cream first five ingredients.  Sift together and stir in next four ingredients.  Stir in oatmeal and coconut.  Drop by teaspoons on baking sheet.  Bake at 350° (no higher) for 10 minutes.
Makes 3 1/2 dozen.
Note:  Add 2 tablespoons more flour for higher elevations and I usually use a bit less sugar.
name: OATMEAL COOKIES

recipeInstructions: Mix flour, sugar and salt.  Add milk; set aside.  Separate eggs; add only yolks to mixture.  Cook on High in microwave 2 minutes; remove and stir with wire whip.  Repeat microwaving 2 minutes at a time until pudding thickens.  Add vanilla.
Layer vanilla wafers, bananas sliced and pudding.  Top with wafer crumbs.
name: BANANA PUDDING

individualIngredient: sweetened condensed milk do not use plain condensed milk
size pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
bananas, sliced and dipped in lemon juice
recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, combine sweetened condensed milk and water. Add pudding mix; beat well.  Chill 5 minutes.  Fold in whipped cream.  Spoon 1 cup pudding mix into 2 1/2-quart glass bowl.  Top with 1/3 wafers and 1/3 bananas.  Repeat layering twice, ending with pudding.  Chill.  Garnish as desired and serve.  Refrigerate leftovers.
name: CREAMY BANANA PUDDING
recipeIngredient: 1   14 oz. sweetened condensed milk do not use plain condensed milk
1  4 serving size pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
3 medium bananas, sliced and dipped in lemon juice

recipeInstructions: First Layer:  Mix flour, nuts and margarine in oblong pan and brown in oven at 350°.  Cool.
Second Layer:  Mix together confectioners sugar, cream cheese and Cool Whip.
Third Layer:  Two packages instant chocolate pudding mixed with milk
Fourth Layer:  Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle with nuts (yum, yum, good).
name: COUSIN PAM'S ICEBOX DESSERT

recipeInstructions: Mix sugar, cornstarch and curry into well drained fruit.  Pour melted butter over all.  Bake uncovered 30 minutes at 350°.
name: CURRIED FRUIT

individualIngredient: cantaloupe balls or cubes fresh mint sprigs
recipeInstructions: Combine water and sugar; bring to a boil.  Add mint (chopped or bruised to bring out flavor).  Strain and chill.  Add to blueberries and cantaloupe.  Serve in sherbet glasses or bowls with a sprig of fresh mint.  Great on a hot evening for dessert.
name: MINTED CANTALOUPE AND FRESH BLUEBERRIES
recipeIngredient: 2 c. cantaloupe balls or cubes fresh mint sprigs

recipeInstructions: Dissolve jello in hot boiling water, then add strawberries and pineapple; mix and chill.
Topping:  Mix together and put on chilled jello.
name: STRAWBERRY DESSERT

individualIngredient: crushed pretzels old fashion not too fine
recipeInstructions: In 13 x 9-inch cake pan, melt butter or margarine with brown sugar until butter or margarine is melted and sugar dissolved. Remove from heat.  Immediately toss pretzels in pan; spread evenly and bake in 350° oven for 5 minutes.  Remove cool to lukewarm. Dissolve jello in boiling water; cool and add strawberries.  Beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth, then beat in carton of Cool Whip slowly.  Spread on evenly over pretzels, seal edge all around pan with this.  Carefully spread (pour) jello mixture over cream layer.  Refrigerate until jello is set, about 1 hour or longer. Cut into squares.
name: STRAWBERRY PRETZEL
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 c. crushed pretzels old fashion not too fine

individualIngredient: food cake, torn into bite size pieces
almond extract or almond flavored liqueur
recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and confectioners sugar; add sour cream and vanilla; set aside.  In a small bowl, whip the cream, vanilla and sugar; fold whipped cream into cheese mixture.  Add cake pieces; set aside.  Combine strawberries, sugar and almond extract or liqueur.  Layer together in large glass bowl, starting with strawberries, then adding cake mixture.  Continue layering, finish with strawberries.  Cover with plastic wrap; chill well.  Yields 24 servings.
name: STRAWBERRY TRIFLE
recipeIngredient: 1 angel food cake, torn into bite size pieces
3 Tbsp. almond extract or almond flavored liqueur

recipeInstructions: Combine vanilla wafer crumbs, cocoa and confectioners sugar in medium bowl.  Stir in melted butter.  Press mixture onto bottom and sides of 12-inch pizza pan.  Chill.

Combine cream cheese, sugar, cocoa, milk and vanilla in small mixer bowl, beating until well blended and fluffy.  Spread over chilled crust.  Chill.  Arrange fruit in circular pattern over the cream cheese until surface is covered.  Heat preserves until thin; cool and spread over fruit.  Chill.  Serve in wedges.  Yields 8 to 10 servings.
name: SUMMER FRUIT COCKTAIL TART

recipeInstructions: Separate eggs.  Turn each white into small bowl of electric mixer.  Refrigerate yolks.  Let whites warm to room temperature 1 hour.  Mix 1/4 cup water with sugar in 1-quart saucepan, stirring over low heat to dissolve.  Boil uncovered without stirring to 236° on candy thermometer (syrup spins 2-inch thread when dropped from spoon).

Beat whites at high speed with salt just until stiff peaks form when beater is slowly raised.  Pour hot syrup in thin stream over whites.  Beat constantly until very stiff peaks form. Refrigerate covered 30 minutes.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Bake almonds in shallow pan just until lightly toasted 8 to 10 minutes. Chop finely.  Turn into small bowl and stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons almond extract

Beat cream with 1/4 teaspoon almond extract and vanilla until quite stiff.  With wire whisk using under and over motion, fold into egg white mixture until well combined.  Spoon into 12 paper lined 2 1/2-inch muffin pan cups.  Sprinkle with almond mixture; top with a cherry.  Cover with foil.  Freeze until firm.  For longer storage, wrap each well.  Keeps up to 1 month.
Perfect ending to any Italian dinner!
name: TORTONI - AN ITALIAN DELIGHT
recipeIngredient: 1/4 c. whole blanched almonds almond extract

recipeInstructions: Mix peanut butter, powdered sugar and margarine; pat into bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan.  Melt chocolate and smooth over top. Chill.  Cut in squares.
name: PEANUT BUTTER CUPS

recipeInstructions: Melt margarine.  Add marshmallows and melt.  Add vanilla.  Mix other items together.  Grease Bundt pan.  Pour melted mixture, while hot, over other mixture.  Grease hands liberally to mix together and pack into pan.  Cool in refrigerator about 2 hours before turning out of pan.  (Dip bottom of filled pan into hot water to help release.)  Must use serrated knife to cut.  This is a finger-food snack.  Keep well wrapped so it doesn't become stale.
name: POPCORN "CAKE"

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients except for the ice cubes in a blender. Whirl until smooth.  Bananas may be frozen in their skin, just peel the skin when you are ready to use them.  The skin will turn black in the freezer but it will not effect the flavor of the banana. Yields 4 servings.
name: BANANA SMOOTHIE

recipeInstructions: Mix orange juice according to directions.  Mix with other juice.  Pour into punch bowl; add ice or ice ring mold.  Yields 50 servings
name: FRUIT PUNCH FOR CHILDREN
recipeIngredient: 3 large cans frozen orange juice making

recipeInstructions: Combine juices and sugar in a punch bowl.  Stir until well mixed.  Add ginger ale and ice cubes.  Garnish with orange and lemon slices, if desired.  Yields 4 1/2 quarts of punch.
name: GOLDEN FRUIT PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Combine juices, sugar and water; let stand at least 30 minutes.  Add ginger ale when ready to serve.  Place ice ring in punch to keep cold and serve.  Yields 32 to 40 servings.
name: GOLDEN PUNCH

recipeInstructions: Combine water and lemon juice.  Add apple juice to sweeten. You may add more apple juice if your taste runs sweeter. Refrigerate.  Serve with a sprig of mint in each glass.  Yields 8 servings.
name: LEMONADE
recipeIngredient: 1/3 c. fresh squeezed lemon juice, unstrained
1/4 c. apple juice fresh mint sprigs

individualIngredient: cans frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
recipeInstructions: Combine orange juice concentrate, cranberry juice and sugar in a serving pitcher; stir well to dissolve sugar.  Chill thoroughly.
Stir in chilled club soda just before serving.  Pour over crushed ice in glasses and serve.  Great with brunch!
Yields 12 servings.
name: ORANGE BLUSH PUNCH
recipeIngredient: 2  6 oz. cans frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
1   28 oz. chilled club soda crushed ice

individualIngredient: cans frozen orange, thawed and undiluted
recipeInstructions: Combine first 3 ingredients.  Mix well; chill.  To serve, combine chilled mixture and ginger ale in a bowl.  Garnish with fruit slices.  Yields 2 gallons
name: PARTY FRUIT PUNCH
recipeIngredient: 2  12 oz. cans frozen orange, thawed and undiluted
4 qt. ginger ale fruit slices optional

recipeInstructions: Combine sugar and water in saucepan, stirring; bring to a boil.  Boil mixture for 3 minutes, stirring often.  Add orange juice and grape juice.  Chill mixture.  Before serving, add ginger ale.  Makes 1 1/2 gallons.
name: SPARKLING GRAPE JUICE

recipeInstructions: Mix all together and pour into punch bowl.  Make a ring of frozen orange crush to float on top.  Serves 18 to 22 people
name: ST. URSULA FACULTY PUNCH
recipeIngredient: 1  12 oz. can frozen orange juice concentrate

recipeInstructions: Mix ingredients in punch bowl.  Add ice and serve.  Serves 18 to 20 people.
name: TASTE LIKE CHAMPAGNE

individualIngredient: can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed and undiluted
recipeInstructions: Pour boiling water over tea bags; cover and steep for 5 minutes.  Remove tea bags, stir in sugar and lemonade concentrate. Set aside to cool.  Just before serving, stir in ginger ale. Serve over ice.  Yields 4 1/4 quarts.
name: TEA PUNCH
recipeIngredient: 1  12 oz. can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed and undiluted

recipeInstructions: Mix together.  To serve, use 2 teaspoons mix to a cup of boiling water.  Excellent gift.
name: CAPPUCCINO COFFEE MIX

recipeInstructions: Combine sugar, dry milk and cocoa in a large bowl; stir well. Store in airtight container. To serve, place 1/4 cup mix in a cup. Add 1 cup boiling water and stir well.  Yields about 28 servings.
Hot Mocha Mix:  Add 1 (2 ounce) jar instant coffee granules to above ingredients.  Stir well.  Serve the same as hot cocoa.
name: HOT COCOA MIX
recipeIngredient: 4 c. instant nonfat dry milk powder

recipeInstructions: Core and chop apples (do not peel).  Combine apples and cider in crock-pot.  Cover and cook on low 10 to 12 hours or until apples are mushy.  Puree in a food mill or sieve.  Return mixture to pot.  Add sugar, cinnamon and cloves.  Cover and cook on low 1 hour or more, until mixture is thickened.  Pour into jars and seal.
Yields 6 pints or 12 (1/2 pints).
name: APPLE BUTTER

individualIngredient: hard green peaches pears could be used
recipeInstructions: Peel and cut fruit; add 1-quart vinegar.  Boil for 20 minutes. Combine sugar and second quart of vinegar; boil until it is a thick syrup.  Pour off most of the liquid from the fruit and add to the syrup.  Boil this until it is thick.  Combine this thick syrup with the rest of the ingredients and fruit, except the ginger; cook 30 minutes.  Add chopped ginger and its syrup and cook 10 minutes longer.  Bottle the chutney.  Flavor improved if placed in sun for several days.  Yields 4 to 5 pints.
name: CHUTNEY
recipeIngredient: 4 lb. hard green peaches pears could be used

recipeInstructions: Skin and chop tomatoes.  Cut onions into small thin rings. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup salt. Cover and let set overnight.  Drain off excessive liquid.  Add vinegar to almost cover mixture.  Add sugar; bring to a boil.  Mix cornstarch, curry and mustard in small amount cold water.  Add to boiling mixture; cook 10 minutes. Add remaining spices.  Do not reboil.  Cover.  Refrigerate. Serve with sandwiches and burgers.  Freeze excessive chutney and thaw as needed.
name: ENGLISH TOMATO CHUTNEY

recipeInstructions: Combine all ingredients with wire whip or in your blender. This is much cheaper than buying condensed milk.  Store in refrigerator.  Yields 1 1/3 cups or the same as one can of condensed milk.
name: CONDENSED MILK

recipeInstructions: Wash fruit carefully in colander.  Let sugar and water come to a boil.  Add lemons and figs and spices tied in a bag.  Boil slowly until figs are tender and clear, about 1 hour.  Lift fruit carefully into jars and cover with juice.  Seal while hot.  Yields 3 pints.
Make sure jars and lids are sterilized.
name: FIG PRESERVES

recipeInstructions: Place all ingredients in a blender until smooth.  Use in place of sour cream for potatoes, dips, salads and fruits.  Yields 1 pint.
name: MOCK SOUR CREAM

recipeInstructions: Combine ingredients and strain into glass or stainless steel container.  Cover.  Keep warm (90°) overnight.  Blot off liquid with paper toweling.
Keep warm by wrapping in heat pad, putting near stove pilot light or other gentle, steady heat source.
name: HOMEMADE YOGURT

recipeInstructions: Adjust sugar to your family taste.

Mix fruit together.  Add white sugar and mix well.  Place in greased casserole dish.  Mix together butter and brown sugar. Sprinkle on top of fruit and add nuts.  Bake at 375` for about 40 minutes or more.
name: MARTHA'S CRANBERRY CASSEROLE

individualIngredient: low fat or fat-free yogurt plain
recipeInstructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Do not add water to orange juice.  Pour into popsicle molds and freeze until firm.  A good snack for children.
name: YOGURT POPSICLE
recipeIngredient: 2 c. low fat or fat-free yogurt plain
